zNQktnYD14csQcUXbsQRIw.text: Had high hopes for this local restaurant.  Brought my out of town guests here.  They don't take reservations so that was stressful but assumed it was because they have fast turnaround based on the menu items.  Got there after picking up my last guest from the airport.   Love the location, staff seemed nice, had s 30 min wait told to us at check in although there were a bunch of empty but dirty tables.  I assumed it was because dinner rush just ended.  It was about 8:20 on a Friday.  Had drinks at the bar.... strawberry Lenore cocktail was sooooo tasty.   Once seated we placed or orders, took a bit to our second round of drinks, had guacamole and fundido for our apps which I really enjoyed not to mention their great salsas (a red and green). Awesome....so far not so bad just a bit slower than expected. Unfortunately this was when it went a bit south.... aside from my husband who got the enchiladas who lived the mole the best out street Tacos were subpar.  The pork belly was doggy and chewy, shrimp were average, the other pork taco I forget what it's called my friend said was horrible seasoning and he couldn't eat it, and the chicken was dry..... not to mention we initially were waiting about 35 minutes after Apps and were told our order was lost and the replacement ticket was entered and our food came in minutes?!?!  I lived the flour tortillas nice and fresh, but others in the party were surprised that corn tortilla were not an option.   I would give this place another try if people were meeting there because drinks were good and apps were good but I regret that my company were so disappointed. Especially since I'm considered the foodie of the group (visiting from Austin and NY).  All and all atmosphere is young and hip, drinks well made, location good; but servers seemed way understaffed and not the best trained.  There is great potential though.

1bzmuPC3HLMCtzyt01inEQ.text: I could eat every meal at Otro and never get tired of the food. Otro serves up big, unique flavors in a casual/comfy environment. Otro serves up especially good options for vegetarians. I've had:  - Otro Salad: Yum! Sort of like the kitchen sink of salads but everything tastes really good together and the large size is meal-worthy with a little something extra. - Arugula & Quinoa Salad: Solid Mexican flavors rounded out by the bite of arugula and the creaminess of avocado. It's more quinoa than a lettuce type salad. - Vegetable Tacos: One of the best tacos ever! The tortillas are soft & fresh. The filling is in-your-face-delicious - sort of like a mexican curry of flavors. - Guacamole: Really good but a little on the spicy side.

H_4bY-BQiRhe3qhRNaqw1Q.text: Really good fish tacos and guac. I went here knowing it was the sister restaurant to Gallo Blanco and was not disappointed! The location is adorable as well.

GyxrawHU_QFsxl_jyGBV7A.text: Pleasantly Surprised. Stopped in during happy hour for something to eat before the dinner crowd. Had a delicious freshly made Ceviche, and loved every bite. The flavors were great, the chunks of sea bass, shrimp, jicama, cilantro, radish and cucumber slices were mixed in a light grapefruit based broth and not tomatoes, so that was a great find. The lemonade was very tasty too. And. Dessert was a yummy cupcake of pumpkin, cranberry. And nutmeg with cream cheese frosting.  Priced just right. I'll be back. Glad to know its there.

KOnQTHmne8p3L-0kPBD5KQ.text: With the end of Gallo Blanco, this is our back up place.  Menu is about the same.  Guacamole and chips are a necessary first.  Love the naco torta with a friend egg.  Messy but wonderful. Fries are A+.  The menu offers breakfast items and lots of interesting Southwestern and Mexican dishes with a flair with very reasonable prices.  Yes, it is quieter than Gallo Blanco, but that is a plus if you want to have a conversation with someone.  The ambiance is not so wonderful, but if you want good food at reasonable prices, you will notice why this place is crowded.  Parking is somewhat limited.

GHKeMklO2dnebCGNuaBooA.text: Granted, it is the day after Christmas, but service was painfully slow and our food arrived cold - omelettes are not good cold.

Xn047PfzAlXSLRP_kUe8mA.text: I went to this place today for lunch. Everyone was very nice. I sat at the bar so I got in right away and sat down. I heard the tacos were the best in town so I had to try a couple. I had the El Pastor taco and a Carne Asada taco. They brought them out on a plate so the tacos laid flat and open face so to speak. They were a little smaller than I hoped for. More street taco size. The El Pastor had a red marinade from the meat that flowed onto the plate and onto the other taco. Not a big deal as it was good but made the tortilla pretty juicy on the outside. They both had a good flavor but I was a little hungry still after just two. Everyone was happy and the place had a good buzz. I think I would come back but maybe try a burrito or other Mexican food. The price was not expensive but a little high for what I got I think. About $8 for two small tacos.

NTJrw1B-zgAaDlNmpUp_IQ.text: Literally my favorite restaurant! Drinks, food, service, atmosphere are all amazing :) been coming here for a couple years now.

GeMyS-SZ8HBT-hobcDnd7g.text: Amazing place! I love this place because it's different but familiar at the same time. I come here for breakfast and split the burrito and pancakes with my husband. Best of both I've ever had.

aG4zgTlWAm3X7M69cNiW5g.text: Tucked into a strip mall in the NE corner of 7th St & Bethany this gem is easy to drive by. Service was quick and polite. The decor is hip and minimal. Reminds me of done of the down town coffee shops and the open space into the kitchen makes you feel more apart of the cooking experience. I recommend the Paella and Pollo Asado.  The house made tortilla are chewy and fresh. This is another venue striving to provide fresh local ingredients in their menu.  I had their enchiladas with Verde twice with varying success. The first time they were incredibly hot the second much milder and pleasant. Very much with a visit!   My only complaint was twice when I went they had live music that made it almost impossible to speak with your dining companion.

tHNA4xksczd0GfP5ITvatw.text: The breakfast burrito was amazing as was the sampler. Our first time here - we WILL be back. Nice open environment too. Sooooo good

4MLAJTTzvexS3nSLPK5ZmA.text: Absolutely wonderful food! The staff is very friendly and cheerful. We had the enchiladas and tacos which were very good. The rice was the best rice I've had. I highly recommend Otro!

3Up72OFp7DDPvbAKElesLA.text: I took myself to the Otro Cafe for my Birthday today.  This is one of those nice independent places you might not find if you weren't looking for it.  I knew it was there and because my favorite pharmacist recommended it, I decided why not.   The food was interesting, I had the three enchiladas each with a different sauce.  I found I was expected to get all three with the same ingredients.  Because it was my birthday, and the cook was new, they let me get two vegetable and one chicken. I think i was there on the right night to be able to have gotten that substitution.  I won't plan on it happening again if I go on another night. When your server tells you about the sauces listen to.  What they describe as spicy will be.  The ingredients are fresh and tasty.  I do think I preferred the vegetable enchiladas but thought a bit more cheese in them would have been a nice touch.    More modern Latin food is served here. Some I haven't tried so I plan on going back to try some of the other items on the menu.  What I saw coming out to other diners looked intriguing.    I say the prices are moderate but that doesn't include alcohol.  If you have drinks, I don't know.  Nice interior that is clean and simple.  I like that with some interesting art on the walls.  They have a nice patio out front.  Parking is not a problem at all and it is easy to find.

JuDOijTt6qJ1kxLRM-mERg.text: I'm OBSESSED!! I have eaten breakfast, lunch and dinner here and I have always LOVED everything!!!  Everything is seriously so good. The service is great. The food is savory and fresh. Also, the horchata is amazing!!

P9Ca_R5wa920AtE0MvlQAQ.text: This place never disappoints. High in all standards, service, atmosphere, beverages and of course the quality and flavors of food are consistent and delicious every single time. Family favorite!

nq1bHPQKEWhFOvEWjLEkHg.text: Hands down, this place has amazing food. I received a gift card from some friends so I had the chance to come back here twice since my previous review. The staff is completely different, place gets busy and the staff appear stressed during those peak times. However, if you come during the off peak times, you'll get the star treatment.   As for the food, I can't imagine anyone saying anything bad about it. Every single thing we've tried on the menu is fantastically delicious (even though the taco prices are high for a single taco, they do load it up). Last time my husband tried the burger, and yes, even the burger is impeccable. So, go here during off peak hours, enjoy good food and that incredible salsa they serve with their chips.

VSRSYnwLO62N-g3SJrR-EA.text: Otro Cafe is great. I come here at least once a week for lunch/dinner with my friend. Their tacos are absolutely phenomenal. If you are here for breakfast/brunch, go with The Nordico. You will not be disappointed. They also have a pretty eclectic selection of draft beers as well as a very well-stocked bar.

QcCTPq47AuCJZxenilX_rA.text: Service is incredibly slow and we saw our waitress so infrequently that I forgot what she looked like.

v9QicBDSXQzKG2fC5C_Ykg.text: Amazing guac and tacos! Also the lime tart was the best desert I've had in years. This is my new go-to for happy hour after work. Check it out!

ByP5clR7nWLdo6DEaftBYQ.text: We ordered the guacamole...good taste but not mixed so there were bites that had too much hot spice.  The waiter recommended the goat tacos.  The tacos were dry and the meat likewise.  My friend ordered a salad with chicken.  It came with ham.   There was a discussion with the waiter about the fact that we ordered with chicken....and he huffed away.  We asked them to forget the salad order.   When the check came, would have expected there to be an accommodation for the fact that one member of the party had no dinner.  Instead, they said "we took off the salad".  Really?   Overall...expensive....mediocre food.  Better restaurants in central Phoenix.

EZiHK_HjYdN_ffuQYX6Zxg.text: Tried this place because it is a sister restrauant of el gallo blanco.  It's like el gallo blanco without the wait. Tried a couple of things on their menu and liked them all. Shrimp cocktail was good, all the tacos were great, and the alcohol drinks like sangria were good also.

bCgb1EkucsLXo1ZCn8plOA.text: Great food, great price, and incredible coconut dessert with chocolate shavings!

Xr6ve3mhaOHBEWYT0d6hRg.text: Carne Asada Torta was delish! I was nervous because I had read some bad reviews on the service. Our waitress was a peach and everyone that I came into contact with had a warm smile for me. Great food, great service. Def coming back.

kKQaWmO4qLuXusS6n509zw.text: Food ok, service was really bad. The waitress was sweet but forgot about us multiple times. We had to continue to remind her about our orders. I do not like writing bad reviews but it was just a long wait for nothing special...

oWVB1krYyxSe5oO58FJD1w.text: Fantastic food. But not a place to go I would go if you don't have plenty of time. Took like 1 1/2 hours for our food. On a Tuesday night. Had the carne asado tacos. They were amazing.  The service was great. Enjoyed the happy hour prices. Just wished it would have been a little quicker with the food. Will for sure come back

Bnjl4RHJz-VETWLlZJZ35Q.text: Delicious hidden gem in Phoenix! I highly recommend any of the tacos. Carne asada were amazing and so is the breakfast. Guacamole is fresh but sort of bland. The shrimp cocktail is served in a glass and all mixed up with a tomato base, it's okay if your on a diet but I wouldn't go there again for it.

DfsUNGYpTQYlsrxR--lEWg.text: Outstanding and interesting Mexican style food.   The tacos are delicious with many different flavors and spices.   My group was full and happy after our meal and we liked it so much we returned the following week.   If you like interesting, non-traditional Mexican food, give it a try.

aaaI44pS63v8gOUuXgI70g.text: Great food! sister restaurant to Gallo Blanco in the Claredon Hotel.  Same guac and awesome naco torta

CSW8UhO-iKUfCo7W-aUqnA.text: What a fun place!  Atmosphere comfortable yet trendy! Waitstaff helpful and friendly! The food was fresh and different and very delicious. Al Pastor taco was divine! Mexican with an ancient twist!

TFQa7O86an1P6gJ_9a_emQ.text: We generally quite enjoy this local place and eat here regularly.  Tonight the food was good as usual however my husband was seated in a chair that was covered with water. We then found that the table had a leg problem and was so uneven we had to move to another table. This is probably how the water spilled in the first place. There was water all over the floor we found as we switched tables. Even after telling our server about these issues they did not clean up the floor, fix the table or offer any courtesy for my husbands pants now being soaked. I was sort of amazed they didn't offer any compensation as most restaurants would. A little later we watched as they sat another couple at the same table who started dealing with the broken table immediately. They also brought the entrees out too fast as we were just starting our appetizer.  I have to agree with others that there doesn't seem to be a manager overseeing things. Unfortunate for Otro, as there are so many other choices in the area.

4jNNFpPY_UTaPvOZCy6KDg.text: Carne Asada street taco along with the Pork taco are awesome.  Best chips I have had a taco shop up to this point with great fresh salsa.  Fish taco is fresh piece of non-fried fish and is very good.

20CwOI_5X4jnmFhqcg-h5g.text: Great food... Service left room for improvement . Once we finished eating she never came back :( but the food was great!

1S-RTCGhw4EIUv5kdB1oiw.text: The BF and I just got back from lunch/happy hour at Otro. Let me start by saying I like Gallo Blanco, and I was fully prepared to like Otro. The space is nice and open and it wasn't nearly as busy as GB usually is. I ordered an individual guac, a carne asada taco and a fish taco and the BF ordered the turkey sandwich. The guac was good, just like the guac at GB and the salsas were also the same, so that was good. When the food came out, mine looked good, although the presentation isn't as cool as at GB (flat on a plate, not on a taco rack) and the tacos looked smaller. The BF was surprised to find mayo on his sandwich, since it wasn't listed on the menu. He told the waitress he had an egg allergy and she took the sandwich back and they remade the sandwich. Anyway, as far as the tacos go, the fish wasn't nearly as good as the one at GB and wasn't my fave fish taco overall...not sure what fish they use exactly, but it was a little fishier than other white fish I have had in tacos...it could have been an off day, who knows. The carne was good and had decent flavor. Both tacos required salsa, but their salsas are so good, that was fine. So then the BF's sandwich came back and looked better, so he ate it and enjoyed it very much. Now, this is not accusatory in any way, BUT I think there is a possibility that they just scraped the mayo off of the bread instead of remaking the sandwich because the BF got extremely sick to his stomach as we were leaving....I cannot say with certainty that this was what caused him to feel sick and I also cannot say with certainty that they didn't make the sandwich fresh with new bread because I wasn't watching and he may have been sick from something totally unrelated, but it was a little suspicious, and if that was the case, this restaurant should be more cognizant of the effects of food allergies on their customers since they can be very serious. Anyway, I would say that the food was overall good, but I can't say I will be rushing back here any time soon, especially when their sister restaurant is so close by.

CUqnpepQeO5cM9DNRAY3XA.text: When I want to be sure to eat healthy with local produce and meats I come here. Wither Chef Vincent & Doug is grilling on pecan wood all will be fresh and aromatic. And now they have a healthy alternative to beef and chicken - goat (lower calorie, fat and cholesterol totals). Prepared with carrots and potatoes in a broth (appears stewed to older crowd) tender tasty & healthy! Server Elaine told me it was AZ raised goat, no surprise I buy AZ goat cheese at Phx Public Market. Will be back again for more.

DKoyEhXGxS-PpHb41iAl3Q.text: I have visited this restaurant twice and have yet to be disappointed. The food is presented nicely, it tastes amazing and the setting and decor are fabulous. I recommend  the fish tacos; a bit spicy but very flavorful.

g1HI8QM8bLrKKXsjFlEzmw.text: Decor was nice.    Good for happy hour appetizers.    Food was just mediocre.   Would only go back for happy hour not dinner.

w39QhMBYk7skXaxkFv5RAg.text: I heard a lot about this place so I went in for a late dinner 6/26 for a test run. I had the carne asada and pork tacos. The food was very fresh, healthy and tasty. I will be back for a full dinner soon the menu had some great items I want to try.

80fh0WDNbfYp2m1Owh9z5A.text: Came in during happy hour so a lot of things are $1 off... We ordered the guacamole, shrimp coctel, and carne asada torta. Everything was really good and it was definitely more than enough food for two people. I can't wait to come back!

JxihPZ5FV4qot4Z2xEw7Yw.text: Not sure about this place. The menu was lackluster, the cocktails were minimal. Had to pay for chips and salsa and didn't even get real salsa. Got a green and a red sauce in ketchup bottles. My boyfriend and I ordered the carne asada tacos which he absolutely loved while I was busy trying to get rid of all the grizzle from the meat.  I don't recommend.

HNMhjyohAyseRWExacZkZg.text: Great food, worse service we've ever had. Couldn't get a glass of water if we were choking to death!

YRT6Aqbb8Q31l6y1cl-fgQ.text: Great food, great service, every time! Handmade little tortillas and Mexican breakfast are my faves.

2s-7Nj-dcM_m5L9a0-L3Jg.text: Went to the cafe on a Sunday for brunch and right away loved the ambience and atmosphere. Very rustic Mexican style and open space with a nice patio. The food and drinks were pretty good as well. However, I ordered the breakfast chilaquiles thinking they would be traditional style but they came out more like tortas layered with chicken and cheese and eggs on top. The chicken was also a little dry and not very much flavor. My friend ordered the breakfast burrito which looked really good with chorizo beans and all the other good stuff. I'd definitely go back again and try something else.

jkdFTrW91fUmBck8PTPNfQ.text: We love this place. The breakfast is probably the most consistently good. The hoemade flour tortillas are a nice touch. The Schriener's chorizo is great. The service is always good. That being said, some of the other dishes are inconsistent. I have enjoyed the vegetarian paella in the past, but last time I ordered it, it was undercooked and tasteless. I also had the pasole which was inedible. It was like water with some pork thrown it.  I will continue to go here (especially since my kids like it) but I will stick with the few good things on the menu.

yz8rjR5bV4sTVx5SDl6nUA.text: The food was delicious! Both hubby and I REALLY enjoyed the meal! We decided to go today b/c it was advertised on VeganPhx and I saw the restaurant had vegan friendly selections. I asked the server what the vegan options were and he said, "not much." Then it was silent. Then I asked since there "weren't much options" to tell me what they were and he said, "you can have a side of vegetables." He was so rude. I almost grabbed my stuff and left but I didn't want to ruin it. I had veggie tacos (I saw on IG the tortillas are vegan). Overall, I love that this restaurant supports local produce, I love the options for vegetarian and vegans but the waiter I could have gone without. Five stars for the restaurant, 0 for the service. I wonder who pissed him for today.

UqJK0sD_VUmsphL2ZebMvg.text: I can't believe it took us this long to discover Otro. What a delightful and yummy restaurant.  The hostess was really sweet, the food was perfect - especially the guacamole.  We ate on the patio, which was charming and very comfortable on a chilly night. The chips were delicious as was the salsa.   I will go again!

2PBJoAFBK3yDSRNQ-6ECEw.text: So just bare with me--The other night, I'm watching Black Jeopardy:   "Big Girls for $200  THE ANSWER: 'skinny women can do this  for you.'  THE QUESTION: 'What is: Not. A. Damn thing?"  Perfect fucking answer.   See, if you're like Us, when you eat at a place, you're asking yourself: What would I change? What would you add or take down a notch.   THE ANSWER: What is: Not. A. Day'm thing.    Otro, my --insert N-Word here--you're the shiznit.  No critiques. I would change nothing about you.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Road snacks.

Jpu6aqJyDu6Zf1QkemlY6w.text: Smell of sewage or rotten food made us get up and leave before order even arrived.(on a scale of 1 -10 it was 9 bad)  We noticed it the moment we walked in, but apparently staff had grown accustomed to the awful smell and made us feel like we were crazy. We were sat in the back corner. Not sure if the issue was in that area.. I could not stomach it. Not sure we will be back. Sad because we are in the neighborhood.

A5gpSKKl0yj47JYCY0VxLA.text: In case you didn't know, Otro mean's "other" and they serve traditional Mexican and new world cuisine. I've been to Gallo Blanco (Doug Robson's other establishment that was once at the Clarendon) and tried my first Elote from Otro at the Roosevelt Row Chili Pepper festival. I finally came here one early evening for happy hour. I loved the cleanliness and the vibe in this place. The menu consists of a variety of tortas, burritos and taquerias. The elote with its combination of smoked parpika and Cotija cheese is just amazing. I always go for pork and carne asada and ordered them both for my taqueria choices and a Dos Equis Lager. I really enjoyed the pork belly and all the flavors that came with that taco. With the happy hour prices, this place was both affordable and easy to stop in for a quick bite at the bar. I had a pleasant dining experience and look forward to stopping in again.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carne Asada &amp; Pork Belly Tacos
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Elote Callejero
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chips and Dos Equis Lager Especial

iixRtbRJkLZGw2bi9E5FKQ.text: Ok so an update - 10/1 - went back just to give another try.  This place is horrific. Can't tell you anything about the food because we never get to try it.  Sat there for 50 minutes without our food had to hunt down our server and then still didn't bring us anything we needed.  I don't know where the reviews come from - never again.  This is a sad sad restaurant that will eventually shut down for sure.  Pass - if you base the salsa on what food is to come then I'm guessing the food stinks.  Always out of something too.  Today was the torta bread -   I am so disappointed.  We showed up at 11:30am this morning specifically requesting fish tacos because all of the great reviews and the craving for great grilled fish tacos.  We waited for about 30 minutes got seated and then we sat for another 20 minutes until our server Cecilia showed up.  I specifically told her I knew what I wanted (fish tacos) but the family needed "a couple" of minutes to order and we would order the guacamole as an app with no cheese.    Again we waited and waited no chips no app no drinks.  I ordered a "premium" Mexican wine to enjoy with my tacos. Waitress comes back, I checked on our app as it still wasn't there and she forgot to put it in!  She Disappers for a bit again, eventually returns with a poor quality guacamole.  Ok, kids ate it so that's fine.    We ordered all of our meals and waited and waited.  Right when ALL of our family's food  was coming out she comes to the table and says, "oh, we are out of fish." HELLO? either the manager or owner came over and I went through the entire scenario and all he had to say was, "we've been out of fish since they received the order Friday and ran out yesterday."    My husband said we aren't eating if you can't eat so we told them never mind give us the check and we will try another time.  The manager or owner said, " well what do you want to do with the other food." What really?  I don't care.  No apologies no nothing.    We were there from 11:30am-1pm and ate NOTHING BUT CHIPS and had to take a $70 bottle of wine with us!  You can afford huge billboards attracting people and a "good story," but can't accommodate or at least inform your guests not hold up to the reviews.  Awful service awful management and quite frankly the food (guacamole) I would eat my 11 year olds before I would this place!  Pass!  We walked out with  an $88 bill and had to go to eat at a reliable Mexican food place (presidio) as we know there is consistency and care about those customers.  BTW - I should have known that when our waitress was carrying around dirty utensils in her back pocket - and I had to tell her before she removed it - that may be a sign to just leave.    Wow - don't stop here ---

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. See this sign.... Keep driving go to MEJICO -

QQOyHhQF1HqnEVUxGukibw.text: Amazing food! The chiliquiles are the best I've ever had! I enjoy the red sauce on them. I get the vegetable but you can add chorizo or chicken.  The guac is also WONDERFUL. I get a side of beans and those are flavored and cooked perfectly.

zS8bAfAoy3eieQtEYeilDw.text: Great service and FOOD!  We were in Phoenix on vacation for a week. After eating here the 1st time we went back 2 more times. The food is a fusion/new age Mexican. You can get as spicy as you want. Our waiter Ken was most attentive and steered us right all night with food choices. The carne asada tacos are to die for. Great beer selection for all types of beer.  Plan to go back next year.

_U6Ibi5cZZVwk-jjU1ff6A.text: Best carne asada taco ever! Delicious marinade on steak. Awesome fresh homemade tortillas. House margarita tasty too.

NFhne8oMSrX72Q8tNB3MvA.text: Everything on the menu is delicious!  I've been here many times and it's always a great experience.  Appropriate prices, enjoyable atmosphere and super tasty!

G8vLloj9PWtzUTs_4GwYfw.text: Decent restaurant. Really nice decor and nice staff. But sloooow service. Food was overpriced but decent. Seemed to be Mexican inspired upper class food. Tortillas and pancakes are delicious. Had the Sampler breakfast. Not sure it was worth $15. BF had the chilequiles which were a little dry and bland. I'm willing to try it again until I make a final decision but wasn't super impressed, even after multiple rave reviews from close friends.

3V8p3NQyIZqVQMxXHmhDUg.text: One of the best breakfasts I've ever had before.  This place never disappoints.  Amazing fresh scratch Mexican- great salsas, Tacos, salads and drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

GjZ_GGNjrXe4ClZ7Jg1QXg.text: I really loved it. I got the BLT & A sandwich with two eggs, and my husband got the chiliquiles. Both were very delicious. The place is a very traditional/trendy Mexican restaurant. Great for brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chiliquiles
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BLT &amp; A with 2 eggs

P8GqsnKydTsIhQ3--f1rZw.text: This place is so good! They have a great drink list! We always get their chips and guacamole which is delicious paired with their salsa (both are good, my favorite is the green). I've had quite a few of their menu items from burgers to burritos to tacos. Their carne asada is AMAZING and from what I'm told, their food is fairly healthy. Love going here!

Y6b_DmHNseYEsbKPw9GzYA.text: Do not come here, and if you do, do NOT park here.  I'll start with the restaurant. We used to love the restaurant, and we'd visit it upwards of twice a week. The staff new our names and our food orders by heart, they were helpful and friendly, and the food came out on time. In recent months, they've gone downhill considerably. Disrespectful staff, food takes forever, etc. Don't come if you're looking for the Otro that used to be here, now there's just the... other one.  Now for the parking. I parked in the Bethany Shops parking lot when I went to Joe's Midnight Run, because I thought Joe's was a part of the Bethany Shops (there is no indication either way, and the parking lot borders it). I guess it's not, because my car was towed between 12 and 1:30 am. The signs posted do not include the city ordinances and many other required pieces of information, so this action is already illegal. The next morning we go out to pick up my car way out in downtown Glendale, and find an unmarked residential-looking building surrounded by barbed wire, with about 20 people and 3 police cars out front. Long story short, Maverick Towing tried to charge me $195 dollars (illegally; the max is $105) in addition to making my family, myself and 20 other people wait out in the heat for nearly two hours.  If you do park at Otro and get towed, make sure to bring printouts of the relevant Phoenix and Glendale city ordinances.

eKaa1ee_nae2oyV9etNklA.text: Had a lovely experience at Otro tonight! My server Rich was so accommodating and funny. We loved the experience and the food was undeniably fresh and flavorful. I asked for the homemade tortillas togo,they were that GOOD . Loving this hidden gem (to me) and ask for Rich if you want laughs along with great recommendations! Ceviche and shrimp tacos are to die for.

oX_vwnHOrQjLFFY_rDYWvg.text: Made it back, and had a much better experience.  So glad this place is still around after Gallo Blanco went bye, bye.   The service was superb.  Food is absolutely amazing.

BfyTVeY_T_DQOMBLIi7c3g.text: I really want to like this place but ... I'm just not impressed. The pork belly entree sounded phenomenal but was the antithesis of anything I imagined. The cube of pork belly was a brick of dried, over cooked belly of something - Not good. My husband's enchiladas tasted reheated with Chef Boyardee on top. The dogs will love the leftovers ... Maybe.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mosco Burro

BKGywpzZHiY1kBGjxhygKw.text: We come here often.  It is one of our favorites here in Phoenix.  There are so many dishes we love.  Farm to table.  Amazing!

yCwxkxPn_6meut2EjZVY5Q.text: I took my dad and stepmom visiting from out of town - we were so impressed! Great breakfast (huevos rancheros and the nortica were amazing!!) and the service was top notch. I will be back to try more.

rx7Lkd388mwlYWcFj2Kj5g.text: I love this place. The actual place, decor, service, but the most important when it comes to a restaurant is the FOOD! Their food is perfection!   When it comes to Mexican food, I have very high expectations. That is why I usually don't go to Mexican restaurants, as they just load things with cheese, fat and some kind of tortilla and call it Mexican.   This restaurant cooks Mexican food to perfection. They have a balance dish where you can taste all the ingredients. They give the traditional Mexican food their own little Chef's spin- and results in art without staying far from real tasting Mexican food. The perfect example are their version of Chilaquiles- the typical chilaquiles have chip size tortillas with salsa and eggs or chicken. Their chilaquiles are the tortillas, but layered with the correct type of salsa (traditional). I order the ones with roasted veggies that are cooked to perfection! they have a large size, so I share them.   I have invited friends that are not fans of Mexican food, and they do offer other dishes that are not Mexican and are delicious. Their pancakes are excellent! They are made in the griddle, so they are not mushy and they have different toppings you can order. We had the banana ones. Great!   They also perfectly brewed coffee- which not all breakfast restaurants have good coffee. We have gone for breakfast a couple of times the last month- I haven't gone for lunch in a long time, but I remember it is delicious as well.   Two thumbs up! I always recommend this place! And the owner or co-owner are always there!

WjZPQlGrf2IA7UApSpod-A.text: Hands down BEST TACOS EVER! It was like a cornucopia flavor explosion! The braised pork was melt in your mouth amazing! The salsa...NEEDS TO BE BOTTLED! Rena the (queen) sever perfection! The homemade banana pie dessert top notch! I would travel the 7 hours from ABQ to Phoenix just to experience it again...and again! LOVE LOVE LOVE it! Oh! And the live entertainment topped off an unparalleled evening! Thank you!

5fedlSMdvYbSXKoMQuNFfA.text: YUM! I went here over the weekend, got the carne asada tacos and beans with an iced tea. Everything was amazing. The tortilla they used for the taco was thick, hot, and delicious, the salsa was fantastic, the beans were perfect. I'll definitely be back!

SrOENzPAMxBpkG1zJYGtLA.text: This place is sweet and spicy, but had no idea it existed! Very close to the Biltmore area, this will be a new go to Mexican restaurant. Started with the chips, salsa and guacamole and everything was great - salsa comes in the squeeze bottles.  Ordered the fish tacos and the otro salad with Carne asada and both were delicious! The staff are extremely friendly and helpful when I was making my dinner entree decision. I will definitely be back shortly to discover the other dishes that people are raving about. Oh yeah, the margaritas are perfect - fresh and tasty!

TUlygRcWwZ4mkE18xkW8Vg.text: We came here for breakfast , it was good , nothing more special than any other breakfast place. They don't have enough staff to seat full restaurant , it's half empty with people waiting at the door.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

hLwpb7aoMN4iaUm1As-MEQ.text: Love this place,  Service and food excellent. This is going to have be my new spot since Gallo is shutting down.

lXCn0ZXJt6qg7L4eDNbe4Q.text: Otro is one of my favs! I initially tried its sister restaurant Gallo Blanco. The menus are close, if not the same... But I definitely prefer the quieter, calmer, more laid back atmosphere at Otro.   The food is so good!  I love the Asada torta. The fried egg on it is a great touch! We have tried the guac and the elote. Both are worth getting.   I've been a bunch of times. Service is good. One time they overcooked the fried egg and were kind about trying to fix it and even gave us a free dessert.

oOkovaSROBRtcRij1TBMnQ.text: I stopped in on a slow weekday and sat at the bar. The bartender was super friendly and gave A+ service. I am giving them 3 stars because I was disappointed with the food. I had been so excited to try the tacos. I had eaten at Gallo Blanco at the Clarendon and loved the food, so I was hoping for a great dinner. I just didn't care for the flavor profiles. I tried the pork belly taco, the shrimp, and the cochinita (shredded pork). I'm determined to give this place another shot though. I love the laid back atmosphere, the truly Mexican vibe, the lack of pretentiousness completely, and the service. I hope next time I can give them 4 stars!

6mum6oHn_rfdTBzxonxUIw.text: Loved this place! First did breakfast here...best chorizo and eggs the we came here for dinner and loved that too. I am not a beer drinker, but they had a wine that was perfect.

DusNfcxgre1EO11o0lJq8w.text: Service was great and quick. The food was full of flavors which is not always the case at Mexican food restaurants. We ordered guacamole and chorizo queso fundido for apps. Tacos, pico Rico burger and the Naco torta. All were great! The salsas are awesome, wish we had room for dessert!

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chorizo queso fundido

pEDtgGkrMrVPai71pfRtPA.text: I was suprised this was in a nonedescript strip mall but had such panache! The food was delicious. I thought the guac was outstanding. The carne asada taco with a flour tortilla (yay) was very tasty and the Inca Salad was divinity. The salad had such a combination of textures;  quinioa, nuts, avo- with a citrussy vinegrette that was so so good.  We will definitely return. The Happy Hour pricing was a treat on the weekend!

InOZ02t2ZqajJdz_utYnow.text: Gave the place another chance because central kitchen wasn't open yet....and thought the patio might be a better option to avoid the obnoxiously loud music that was still playing from the last time I came in.....but no. Still playing overly loud music in the outdoor space as well. I just don't get it.

QsfdkmCwQbiawqOT0GhhVQ.text: Phenomenal!! Best mexican food I've had in Phoenix. This place has a funky, eclectic vibe and amazing food. We had tacos (chicken, fish and shrimp) all of which were great and prepared with unique sauces and toppings. Great burritos as well .. check it out

6dEYiPqhoXEguOea2vPJnw.text: I'm not a big Mexican food fan, but this place is fantastic!!  We were there on a Saturday afternoon. It was busy but we were seated within 5 minutes. The waiters/ waitresses were very good!  They  kept us refilled with water & drinks, which is vital when eating Mexican food!! I had an amazing Naco Torte, which I highly recommend!  The chips, salsa & guacamole were very tasty too! I'm a fan & plan to return!

UZoQYWcgwFxf0Z_MnBCB8Q.text: A great experience! My wife and I wanted to try half the menu - What we got was great and we cant wait to get back and try some more.  Service was 5 star as well - everyone friendly and helpful.  Basic Pancakes and bacon for the daughter was a plus.  Patio is a plus plus.

vnW6its2z3ZXjXJ17kjYbQ.text: Whenever I have out-of-town friends visiting who want to go out for Mexican food, this tends to be where I take them. The guacamole is my favorite of any restaurant I've been to in the Valley and is served with thick & perfectly crispy chips. While I could easily just eat chips & guac for a meal, I'm a big fan of their tacos as well. The one less-than-stellar point would be their margaritas, which while very good (especially the prickly pear), are disappointingly tiny for the price.   As others note this place is owned by the same folks who used to own Gallo Blanco. Having been to both places--Gallo was super close to my house and I only started going to Otro once it closed--I can say the food is pretty much the same.  As long as you're mainly looking for good eats (and not somewhere to get several rounds of margs), you won't be disappointed!

jhXTLfX6idzesN1fQuC37w.text: The food is very good here. I would come back more often but the service is absolutely terrible. Slow and very rude here. I've had extremely condescending waitresses here. Wish they wouldn't have such bad service because the food is actually pretty good.

ELBA3TFLvsfZqhezP7edaw.text: Back again!!!  Delicious as usual. Don't feel like cooking?  Make Otro do it for you.

CWlJdDvdDSXoGvoKk0ACHQ.text: Im guessing everyone there is new to the business or any customer service skills. For starters, they take way too long to even come offer you any drinks and another long wait until the drinks come. They take long on ordering and bringing you the food, its just tacos and burritos how long can it take? Our burritos came and it was cold!! Let me mention the place was empty so being busy can't be the reason. Finally after waiting a while the server decided to come ask how the food was, when we told her the problem she went and told the manager ( I have no idea how she became the manager), instead of just apologizing and taking care of our meal she stood there and said I don't know why or how that happened and offered 10% off...YES 10%!!! We saved $1.80 off our bill!! holy shit thank god for her I really needed that $1.80! I find that offensive to offer me a dollar off when really the burritos should have been replaced or free. Also, I have ate there 5 times now and only 1 time the service was good because the food was to-go. The food is pretty good especially the burrito(when its hot) but a little too over priced. Only because the food is good I will give them a star. Oh and if you're planning to go with a bunch of people, they barley have space so I would call ahead of time or go early daytime when its empty. In the end, if you only care about the food and not service this place is good but if you're like me and being charged restaurant prices for a burrito it better come with good service.

sOSFkaem-_oa919FgnGC2w.text: Sad to say, this was a disappointment.  We eat out quite a bit and try all the new restaurants.  The picture in Phoenix Magazine made the restaurant look bright and cheerful....but thought it was quite the opposite.  Interesting menu...the chips were great, but, unfortunately, the food was just "ok".  There are many other places in town that serve very good Mexican food.  In Amy's review, she said she "breaks out in hives when she has to eat in Scottsdale....well I felt the same with the clientele in this restaurant.

3aFTWq4eCCJSbVh5qu9mnQ.text: I went in yesterday with a friend. The Inca salad and fish tacos were amazing! Luis was my server and made the meal all the more enjoyable! I highly recommend this place. I'll definitely be back.

YfVcdCmubEgqoj55WUGnIw.text: Great food for a neighborhood restaurant. Staff is friendly and decor interesting with changing artwork. Happy hour is a great way to sample a lot of their best dishes.

cAXfqKlxPgOz-ILbyYaOyQ.text: Love this spot! Their food is really good and inexpensive, service was great! Was very impressed their brunch is one of the best for the price.

0y-ZI2W249a33ourraZ03A.text: Eat here, it's devine. The tacos are amazing. Our server was a little weird, but she warmed up by the time the food came. Eat the guac. We will be coming back!

0LF1C6IrMD4kWMpzSS0umA.text: Somewhere I can go to close my eyes and point to something on the menu and it will be good. Always have the best service and a great relaxed atmosphere with awesome people to talk to at the bar. A must if you are visiting phoenix or live and looking for something new!!

TuCkepmbUPXIsFKvAnw-Jw.text: The Mexican  Paella was delicious as was the pastor. It is now on my favorites list.

0LDauZsHqghrpK9kcNVwWA.text: Another great restaurant in the central corridor of Phoenix. The menu items are so interesting and tempting. Friends and family had highly recommended and I see why. We all had the street tacos and guacamole during happy hour on a Sat afternoon. Everyone was completely satisfied and anxious to try more items. This place is going to be a go to for us.

A-uvw2Wr_xyB0DdE7kc7lw.text: I must say great addition to the neighborhood! Great food and atmosphere. My wife and I have made this one of our regular food stops. We love the guacamole and the salsas! We have tried several of the items on the menu and have been very pleased with all ! Breakfast is also great!

Dbgij_UWJ0w38seTCrIDPw.text: Wasted an hour of my time  on a beautiful Sunday at Otro. The service was the worst I have had in a very,very long time , repeatedly asked for chips before they arrived and waited 40 minutes for our lunch. Unfortunately  the food was not edible and  we had no silverware .In retrospect they may have been trying to discourage us from eating the awfull meal.I ordered heuvos rancheros and my mouth tastes like charcoal  2 hours later. How do you butcher eggs and beans?The real issue is lack off emphasis on timely service.I can tolerate imperfect food (awfull) if I think the staff cares.

aw22z5YjLcM2LEMAZTEkoA.text: Great service and food.  The only reason I did not give it five stars was I ordered the chicken soup to go, and the description on the menu says it has snow peas in the soup, but when I got it home no peas :(   But that is just one minor error.  Truthfully this place has REALLY good tacos, chips, guacamole, entrees, etc. that you can't help but love this place.  We are already planning on going there again soon.  And for anyone reading reviews of mexican food places on 7th street - all I can say is stay away from Gadzooks on 7th street and venture down the road a little to this gem of a restaurant.  It's worth the drive.

dXVDTP4rbw_dURbTR2fuRw.text: Excellent quality and value in a quaint setting.  Recommend the fish tacos and otro salad.  Will definitely return soon!

guD8xMA_Bzh7hH_531Ja-g.text: Great food!  Husband and I had the Pica Rico burger. Excellent. Bartender was good and waited while I decided what to drink and made good drinks. Only issue came with the slight attitude from the bartender when I mentioned the music (Spotify). It was playing '90's which can be great but seemed out of place in there. Didn't intend for her to do anything but she just cocked her head and said "you don't like it?"  I'm in customer service and expected her to say "oh, it changes later" or "yeah, not everyone's a fan" but she acted as if I was stupid (and old) for mentioning it. Then, right after, as we turned to leave, I pointed toward a rear door and asked a young man behind the bar if the that lead out to the back parking area. He said yes, and then said "it says exit".  Which it did...Not a big deal but made me feel stupid ( again). Yes, it did say exit but in my work place those signs also indicate alarmed doors.  Didn't expect the snarky comment.  Just young staff being jerks but the place was filled with all ages so not sure why they felt comfortable with the the attitude.  This was between 5 and 6pm so not busy.  No biggie but tired of people thinking they can say anything and no one catches the underlying tone.

TTapT4vXas-LnPwrnKfnfQ.text: Food is Excellent!  Service was initially bad but somebody must have said something because they've stepped up their game. Go for the Gauc and veggies they are spectacular.

I8EsLg4JXFTUuvlCbh6_Zg.text: I went there last night with my boyfriend after hearing many positive reviews from friends and co-workers. It lived up to the hype. The atmosphere is a little more lively then what I typically like to go for when it is date night. (Bright lighting, open center booths, open kitchen concept) Please note, I am not knocking them for these features. I can dig it.  On to the food. We had the Coctel de Camaron for an app. and the white Sangria for drinks. We both liked them. We split the Paella De Campo and each got a taco. I opted for the Carne Asada, and he got the Al Pastor. Both were good, but my vote was for the Al Pastor. It was simi sweet, not overly sweet which is why I chose the asada instead. Then we over indulged and got the coconut pudding for dessert. We enjoyed it, but could have used less chocolate shavings (I know, what kind of girl says that?) The chocolate shavings were shaved small, but there was a lot of it which I personally felt took away from the pudding. Okay the best part, the price. We had a total of 4 drinks, 1 app, 1 entree, 2 tacos, and dessert for $56. I was very impressed. Keep up the good work!

0jSnOfgOgsUfAfetQZTMYA.text: Liked it when I first walked in. Disclaimer: my wife gave it 3 1/2 and liked the food but didn't like the service. We went for lunch and it wasn't packed but still had to wait. We shared the Otro salad, split the carne asada burrito and split an al pastor taco. I thought they had cheap ingredients in the salad and they skimped on the kale...in place there was a ton of cabbage, which looked it came out of a frys bag...with corn nuts that were sparse and cubed avocado. They also skimped on the steak in the burrito and had a ton of beans...the steak that was there didn't have much flavor. Most of the food was bland, which my wife liked...she likes a little less flavor or punch. She thought the taco was ok... However, it greased out more than a New York slice and I would way rather have Americas taco shop al pastor. I didn't get the enchiladas because they were 14 for three and I wanted to try more options...all in all seems like a good decision now. I liked the tomatillo sauce for chips but the red salsa was all spice and no flavor. Maybe there are other items on the menu worth trying but with so many better options in the valley and the price tag here, I think I'll stay away.

JgNvISNw4Y3lU-if5SnEZA.text: Excellent food and service. Prices were VERY reasonable, especially for CenPho. As another reviewer wrote, this is being added to the rotation.

L6ZMeQTbkEgYOXEOikFAtw.text: Seriously amazing! Great atmosphere and phenomenal food. I have some health issues which restrict my diet and that makes going to restaurants a little nerve wrecking. The manager, Ashley, took my order and actually took the time to make sure all my modifications were correct, and even came back to double check once the food was dropped off, even though the restaurant was insanely busy. We were very impressed. Ask for Marco at the bar! The amazing service and food can't be beat. It's become a staple for us in Phoenix.

ZKmm9OqjzD8ffEINWkyBuQ.text: Good food, good service but way too loud. My husband and I enjoyed what we ate but a ton of screaming children and drunk people.

wvcuRFf1DEhU0Tth84gvGQ.text: Loved it here. We came on a Saturday around 5:30 and happy hour was going on. $5 margs (which were not the cheap kind you normally get) and $3.50 tacos. Pretty family friendly but also a place you could bring a group of friends or just one. My friend and I don't live far so we will definitely be back!

PGWM7NqfQZJkjptG3Cr-_w.text: Service is always great here.  I normally get the chiliquilas with just cheese. I once ordered the 3 enchiladas to go and only got 2, so I won't order that again. The BLT with egg is REALLY good, although they don't make it past 4pm.  Some days they do have a fly problem which makes frustrating when your swatting flies every 30 seconds. Last time was so bad that I ended up just getting my food to go.  The water can sometimes/always taste really bad. Almost like dirt, sorry to say, like maybe the pipe it comes through hasn't been cleaned. So don't order water, I usually get an iced tea

QpbI3KigJL8T_SiPUoJcrw.text: We come here every Friday, everything is amazing. Carne asada burrito and chips and salsa are a must. If I could buy the hot sauce I would for sure.

ciIRDDEGDivFu2I6nk_Vsw.text: Ok, I was not expecting this place to be packed and 2 guys playing great music and the food was amazing.  I had the skirt steak burrito, chinchita burrito.  I had 2 bloody mary's they were delicious.  I can't wait to go back. The green ice tea was amazing. Our waiter Seth was fantastic.

NWAfKTVSJ45FsS1wgOpEmg.text: The only reason I am not giving this 5 stars is because of the service. To make it clear, the food is outrageously amazing and is what keeps us coming back. We come here so often they know us all too well, especially the morning crowd. Their pancakes and authentic Mexican breakfasts are wonderful (berry pancakes and breakfast burrito). Kids also eat for free in the am and with our two kiddos they cannot get enough.  As far as dinner goes, the few times that we have been here the service has been lackluster. Management needs to staff more servers or hire more employees to keep up with the crowds on the weekend. They run around with their heads in all different directions. That being said, the servers are amazing and do the best with what they are given. Hands down best server is in the morning for breakfast. If I could remember his name I would throw it in here but he is the tall skinny guy (checks in on every table even though they aren't his and always makes a connection with our kiddos). Hopefully management can make some changes to up their service game, but the food never disappoints!

Z2qNEMoSegUzEeyGMwzuzQ.text: Overall the menu at Otro Cafe is phenomenal!   Service sometimes is a hit or miss.....But big whoop welcome to the food business buddy!   Make sure you try the famous flap jack(s)! I promise you, #CRACK

7iygUdhnyjIesOmNWV_pNg.text: This is one my favorite places to go in the valley for brunch or dinner. Along with sister restaurant Gallo Blanco, they have the best fresh Southwest food I've had in as long as I can remember. When I lived in PHX I lived across the street from Gallo Blanco before they closed and reopened. When I moved back to Seattle I literally used to wish for the food from Otro and GB. For years. It's that good and we have nothing close on Seattle.  We always look forward to starting out with the chips, sometimes the queso crisp, or the guacamole. The green salsa is to die for with the chips and on everything else. Naco torta, al pastor, whatever you get it's going to be great. If you struggle with the sweet/savory conundrum like I do, for brunch I recommend the sampler so you get one of the flapjacks (I like the bananas and caramel option), chorizo, and eggs. Hits the spot.   Don't miss this place while in PHX. Sit on the back patio and get a Bloody Mary while you wait for your food.

cCQMs0cXuWzKb5JrQHXH1w.text: We have been going there for breakfast almost every other week, and we haven't had a bad experience. Service is always good and prompt, coffee and cream keeps arriving, and the breakfast sampler with flour tortillas is delicious as are the huevos rancheros with both sauces and a quesadilla on the bottom, and the chilaquiles with veggies (you can order chicken instead). All in all, it's a place that I recommend highly! I will visit lunch & dinner next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast sampler with flour tortillas and chorizo.
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chilaquiles Christmas style (both sauces)
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chilaquiles with eggs on top pictured on the bottom, and the breakfast sampler on the top.

GaVgAwvJQLZHN68cH3FbKA.text: Some of the best Mexican food I've had in a long time. Some of their dishes seem to have some Asian influence as well which makes the food exciting and very flavorful. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu but some of our favorites are carne asada tacos or burritos, the bistec entree was fantastic. The salsas and fresh and spicy. We also loved the pork belly spring roll appetizer. The breakfast burrito and barbacoa & eggs were both very tasty. Always a great ambience and wonderful service. One of my favorite places in Central Phoenix.

Zj_XEUNE27o2VdP8FBIuAw.text: Great service, nice - live music that was not overpowering.  Food was very good.  Chilaquilas with chicken was what I had - very good.  Great bacon also!  Gluten Free choices are marked on the menu, makes it easy to order!

0F-1CwonxPuPVHi3qQwIUg.text: This is my all time favorite go to place for pork belly tacos. Best pork belly tacos for me.  Introduced this place to my bf and he loves their pork belly tacos too and elote corn. Can't get enough of their elote corn! Last visit we got to try their banana creme pie and we devoured it. Service is always on point and I'll always come back because why not? Tacos are life for me and they got me coming back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

tUa7WMQ_DHxej8q5wkS-nQ.text: So Yummy!! Best pork belly and shrimp taco!  Fresh ingredients.  Excellent flour tortillas. Great waitress!  Easily accommodated 8.  Reasonably priced.

pnwVK7C6m_H6VVUGn8nAOQ.text: I like any place that sells margaritas by the jug. Because if I'm going to have a dinner with my colleagues, I am going to get inappropriately drunk (it's a career strategy that doesn't work for everyone, including me).   In addition to jugs of booze, Otro also offers all sorts of delicious food as well. The carne asada and al pastor will be delicious whether you want them in taco, torta, or burrito. The pollo asado, the guacamole, the salsas, and the chips are all winners, and the lamb rib special we tucked into was my favorite bite of the evening.   It isn't perfect,* and this Mexican joint in a strip mall might not look like much from the outside (although the inside is quite nice), but the food is legit, the service is excellent, and we all walked out stuffed and happy.  _____________ *The ceviche was tough, and the mole is too chocolately for me (but most moles are).

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carne Asada taco
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Elote Callejero
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lamb ribs special

bcA1Ld2VmStLByVrvHNa4w.text: Our lunch experience today was a pleasant surprise.  We found them on Yelp while in the area and couldn't have been more pleased.  Our server Mike was professional, knowledgeable and just cool! The food was great. I can hardly wait to come back and try other things on the menu.  The place has a warm, urban vibe!

6sqWR0nuxjeywTobX1j-Cg.text: (Lyrics - NWA - Straight Outta Compton)  Straight Otro Cafe, hungry funky Yelper named Bo Bites From the gang called Yelpers with Elite Badges When I'm called on, I got my song on Squeeze the bottle, and salsa is poured on Two drinks, boy, if ya drink with me My reviews are gonna have to come singing from me Off those stars, that's how I'm goin out  Otro Cafe is a Americanize Mexican food joint with some cute artwork and what I can describe is a classical home kitchen feel.  I really enjoyed walking in and looking at the arts and the open feel of this place.    My partner and I sat at a booth and shot for their Happy Hour drinks; $1 off pretty much most anything you ordered.  For our starters we went for the Chips and Guacamole and Queso Fundido.  The chips and guacamole were both thick in texture.  The guacamole was still creamy to the palate and had some fresh onions bits while providing a strong limey taste.  It came along with two sides of salsa in a squirt bottle; red and green.  The Queso Fundido came out hot on a skillet along side with some flour tortillas.  Super cheesy with some mushrooms and sausage mixed, it was both hot in temperature and just a tad bit spicy, but not too overwhelming.    As for our entrees with both went for the tacos!  I went for the traditional Carne Asada and Cochinita.  Both tacos came on a hand made tortilla, which was warm and soft to the bite.  The Carne Asada had a bit of charred texture but the guacamole smoothed it out.  The Cochinita had a subtle texture and sweet taste with a hint of the achiote.  Both were topped with cilantros and onions.    Overall, I really enjoyed the food and atmosphere at Otro Cafe.  I heard they serve Breakfast, but I'm too lazy sometimes to travel to get my food!  However, for happy hour drinks and small bites this place definitely delivers! - Enjoy!

NltH3F1rchVRYjXdWApWsQ.text: Food is excellent and happy hour deals were a welcome surprise. However, they get major props for playing "Viento" by Caifanes during dinner tonight!

NHbqrAXJHL7-ejiff5NAfA.text: One of my favorite places to go for breakfast with the kids. The kids absolutely love their pancakes and guacamole. The food is always delicious the service was great sometimes it takes longer cuz everything is made fresh So if you be a little patient you'll get delicious food also the kids get to pick two free items from the kids menu which is a huge bonus being that they don't always eat everything! Thanks Otro! Maybe add a changing table in the bathroom which is be a huge Plus

fNXuQA4GSgcG2j1J1duyrA.text: Thoroughly enjoyed dinner here with my friends tonight. I was the one wheel to add to the 6 others. Favorite meals were the appetizers and mole chicken dinner- none of which are pictured here. They also loved to cheese corn dish- but after its shanked down, it will only feed 1-2 people. They offer chips with 2 types of salsa straight away- the orange color is spicier, with the green being neutral.  The outdoor patio atmosphere is pretty good. We also enjoyed the bar situation. Don't get to the 7th St area enough to experience all the goodness!

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Quinoa salad with shrimp- $8 small salad plus +5 shrimp added
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. One taco with side of corn
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Paella

t7WZJCJUhXj6zqLdu9hPXg.text: The food here is excellent!  The service (in terms of how fast your food is prepared) is poor.  We came here for a lunch during the work day and we expected our lunch to take a little longer than normal, but this was a verrrrrryyy long lunch as we had to wait at least 30-40 minutes for our food.  It should be noted that the restaurant wasn't even at capacity.  I might come back on a weekend when I have more time to spare, but will not make this a regular place for workday lunches.  I ordered the paella and it was really tasty.  Funny enough, my favorite part of the meal was the flour tortillas they served on the side.  Those tortillas were to die for!  They were heavy, buttery, chewy, soft perfection, yum.  It was also enough food to take home and have another very filling meal.

TWyphti8e2EjSsNyHiFipw.text: Have you been to lunch where your 3 year old dumps the salt and proceeds to walk her doll through the "snow.?"  I have one available if you would like to try it out.  This may or may not have happened while dining here.  When you enter a nice (and super cute might I add oh wait scratch that I am married and he is probably 21 years old) host greets you.  The place wasn't very busy and we got seated right away on the patio.  The decor and ambience to me were boring and might I add it is in a strip mall meh meh meh.  We started out with the chips and salsa.  I am a stereotypical white girl who wants free chips and salsa, so that I can fill up on these before the meal comes.  Not here.  You have to pay and our chips were gone fairly quick. (they were only $1, but still $1 is a $1). The saving grace is the chips were good and I wouldn't be surprised if they didn't make them there. They bring you a red salsa and a green salsa.  The salsas are made fresh every day. My favorite was mixing the 2 salsas together for a nice surprise.    I ordered the shrimp taco and the carne asada taco.  They were both very flavorful, but unfortunately both were dry and slightly overcooked.  The tortillas are made there and you can tell because they were tasty, but flour so not traditional.  My daughter had the beans and the chicken taco, which to our surprise were the ripe ole price of FREE.  Next time my daughter is going to be super hungry and order everything off the menu or maybe I will treat her preschool class to lunch one day. (M-F 2pm-6pm only) The beans were super tasty and I'm pretty sure my daughter kept asking me to stop eating them.  The chicken on the other hand was dry but flavorful.  I highly recommend the guacamole.  It came on the taco and I considered ordering an entire serving of it.   Service was a mixed bag.  They seemed on top of things at first and then we never saw them.  We had to ask for our check 2-3 times.    I really love the fact they are family owned and a neighborhood restaurant.  I want to go back and try a few other things.  Next time will be Brunch.  *****Came back a second time and service was slooooooow.  Food was mediocre.  I liked it much better the first time.  Honestly don't think we will be back very soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp Taco and Carne Asada Taco

pvdVTzZAbCjtxLu0U5nXGw.text: Diversity of food on the menu is a plus. It had me at Breakfast all day!  Very friendly wait staff. Cool aesthetics. The smell from the grill is fantastic. Nice to see they serve Lux coffee.

ZrYq4xtNCLYBfwkX5p4ESg.text: Great surprise! Can't believe we hadn't tried this little spot. We walked in on a Sunday night and there was live music- just right!   We were seated quickly. The staff is very friendly!  I love that, just makes amor breaks the experience. The food was yummy BUT I'm taking 1 star off because they took forever!! We just ordered tacos, I mean how hard can it be to put together 5 tacos? Drinks were great, and the guac and chips oh and green salsa are my fav!   Will definitely  go back just knowing not to expect my food quickly.   Loved the decor and vibe btw!

H57RMyO6BWWh-lJZAsZGVA.text: We've specifically hit up Otro Cafe for breakfast/brunch on a few occasions simply because the wait was non-existent versus 40+ minutes elsewhere (even when we were driving to Otro, the line at Denny's was out the door! -- Come on, people!). Each time our visit has been a success. The chiliquiles are one of their more popular breakfast items and definitely worth a try, for my two cents.   Also big ups to the service at Otro. They're always on the ball and right on time with everything from drink orders, to refills, to clearing the table. All in all, I just highly recommend this place if you are looking for a good breakfast experience but don't require the place to be on Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives -- because Otro seems to be a little too good for that nonsense.

bh9yHbBzoPr2XcZ722kgDA.text: what a wonderful place I drive by here quite often I thought it was like a sandwich shop till one of my friends told me about it so decide to give it a try first off I must say their salsa is freaking delicious the red one is my favorite little spicy almost taste like Chipotle but not the green one is ok little too much tomatillo chips too thick for my taste but good I had the asada torta it was good but very simple lettuce carne and I spread meat was very tender season well probably one of the best tacos I've ever had but what put the cherry on top was the all-you-can-drink horchata amazing I had 3 silver we had was very nice help with the menu only thing was a disappointment was they had no mole it's only  dinner oh well I guess next time

DCUsuzJxAAwm6JrPPDbg1Q.text: They have the best fries! Fries are crispy but not too hard. Carne Asada is very flavorful, not overcooked nor still bleeding.  Fries, Carne Asada and Inca(salad) are the things I get every time.

c9M30AzfEZF-dJWTPWCMQw.text: Great tacos on homemade flour tortillas instead of the dry corn tortillas all over town. The shrimp tacos were great. Most places overcook the shrimp, but Otro did it right. I also loved the flapjacks. Pancakes with maple syrup and butter make a great desert. Bartender was generous with the pours and that makes me happy!

XM5TL6JeQ_xXzQryA-OqkQ.text: Our first visit to Otro Cafe and it was a pleasure. Great little spot, we came for lunch around 1130-12 on. Monday and they were moderately busy. Nice decor, not too cluttered with stuff.  Our server, Anthony knew the menu well and made good suggestions. I came in specifically for the Noca (I think that's right...lol) torta. I follow Otro on Instagram and someone posted a pic of that sammich, I literally told my wife to make a Uturn and head to Otro for that one - carne asada (ribeye) with guac on the bun and two fried eggs (I had over medium, perfect temp for a sammich). It was loaded with flavor, I would definitely reccomend that torta! Or, they will make it for you as a burrito also. Delicious! Sorry about not taking a photo of it! There is one on their Instagram page...lol.  My wife had the eggs benedict with smoked salmon, avocado and of course, hollandaise sauce....lots of hollandaise...lol. She likes it saucy, like her. I had a taste of course and it was savory and delicious! She enjoyed it very much, she is a eggs benedict addict.   Our little girl had a kid's quesadilla with Oxaca cheese and some crispy fried potatoes. She ate every bite and ate some of ours! I guess she likes it.   Manager (or owner) stopped by our table and was a nice host. I'm sorry I cant remember his name, a tall guy with a pleasant demeanor. I told him we would definitely be back! He said Sundays are crazy before 1pm, so you can call and see what the wait is. No reservations, so plan on a wait on the weekends. Great spot, go check it out!

vU5AnjCvl5zk97OXtBWjbw.text: Love the seasonal beer, had the pumpkin something and it was great. Had two and felt the happy come in. It's good solid non greasy Mexican Food. Had the guacamole and chips yummy yummy don't like the salsas they provide they don't taste authentic. For lunch had a Carne Asada Taco- delicious, Fish Taco- FN Fantastic, Shrimp Taco- only had one shrimp  it was sad. I would go again and be happy.

xOlQ0fnhaAPzc6huIyeynw.text: Who didn't shed a tear or two when Gallo Blanco left the Clarendon?? Thank goodness there was a back up! Thank you "Lil sister from the same Mister", Otro cafe! If you haven't tried there chilaquiles  you are in for a real treat. Their red and green salsa and thicker home style chips are just to die for. Drinks? They have that covered too! I haven't tried one that didn't make me smile. Give little sister Otro a try if you haven't already and she will be your best friend.

skZfx90MnuvmLJVB4NombA.text: Terrible experience.  Rude server. Will never come back to this place.  It appears that they don't care much about customer service.

zG3QR5CtRclmHMOmH51uLA.text: This cafe isn't like any otro! Incredible atmosphere, food, and staff make this a must eat. If you're in the area (or within 1,000 miles) you'd be doing yourself a disservice if you didn't make it out here. Get the pork belly taco!

u3yUtH1c9UUewO_L4kHHRA.text: Wow.  The food is amazing and I cannot wait to go back again.  Our first time and we are hooked.  The food is amazing and Jacque was a fantastic server.  Please do yourself a favor and go to Otro Cafe.

EdxW13CK6qi72heTWbz-hQ.text: It was my first time at Otro, and it was yummy. Steph recommended the pork taco, and it was as good as she described. Enjoyed  a side of beans for  a quick and delicious lunch. I will be bsck..

wjLafm2LMb1QuTnjKxZVPQ.text: Actually witnessed the bartender buying drugs in back parking lot while i was having a smoke. Explains the service and attitude. Food and ambience were exceptional but they really need to screen their employees better

jiWX217olhNS1eu-BG7mvQ.text: Must get chicken tacos! I've visited 4 times and my hubby and I have a consensus that this is the best dish so far. The tortillas are so soft and the sauce they put on the tacos should win an award for most addicting. I can literally put that sauce on anything. I also like their L.A. Maya margarita and fried potatoes with the addicting sauce on the side.

0MHO15DUcBmaB-LFOuLSCQ.text: For all of its good reviews, my experience there was super disappointing. The food was not good and the service was extremely slow. To the point that we were questioning what is going on in that kitchen.  We went on a Tuesday night and the food took forever to arrive. The servers were also way too busy. All the servers are pleasant, so it really made me want to like this place. But we tried for at least 10 minutes to hail someone over every time we wanted to ask for something.  The food was also subpar. The "large" guac was pretty small (3 of us shared and finished in less than 3 minutes). The description said the guac had oranges and other tasty ingredients, but no one in my party could find them. The paella rice tasted like rice out of a box. And the pork in the pork tacos was really salty.  My boyfriend and I love great food and are of the opinion even if a place is not True and authentic Mexican, if there is something they do great, we would still keep coming back. We did not find that at Otro Cafe, and we probably will not be back again.

nr3Rd3DHxCSqwjORCOyTHg.text: One of our favorite 7th Street restaurants.  We usually go on Wednesday evening for the flamenco music and dancers.  The nachos with guacamole is a must.  The pork belly taco is sinfully wonderful.  If you like mole the enchiladas with mole are top notch and the cocktails are smooth, well made fun.

S5r-N1QoXwhWpM3QU0aSMA.text: Superb! Great outdoor seating & inside... Menu was easy to understand. Yelp did great helping us find a good Mexican restaurant. It was packed when we got in & packed as we left. No waiting at all was seated right away.. The guys all worked together helping every table.. And their cook did an amazing job with our food! It was perfect! The food tasted very organic & fresh.. From their mixes of salad & their choices of meat.. It was all perfect! Gotta try their fish or shrimp tacos! My date had a beef burrito & that was slamin also! Many credits to their chef!

OFsy0AZ4PRrS7yOsof0Aow.text: Ordered a couple tacos for myself, a bowl of veggies for the baby, and my husband got the burger. I don't have a picture of the tacos, but I ate them too quickly, they were awesome but kinda small. My husband liked his burger except that is was rather on the well done side instead of medium.   Best thing ever here was the bread pudding! Can't go wrong here.
