Y9Cl0eQM_m5Pm_FJecPY_w.text: Came back again today with a group of people from work. We had about 10 people and they were able to get us on the patio. This time I tried the Pica Rico Burger and split that along with the Pollo Burito. The aoili they put in the burrito as well as on the burger is so flavorful, couldn't get enough of it. The french fries were potato wedge style and were cooked very nicely.   It was a little hot on the patio, and they could definitely use some more shade. But that didn't stop me from enjoying another experience at what has definitely become my favorite Mexican spot in Phoenix. Maybe even earth.

5_H6XF6WEj6NrEU08TqxvA.text: The food at Otro is just pure quality. I went to Gallo Blanco several times when they were still open and I loved their food so I'm glad that otro basically imitates the flavors and quality of Gallo. My wife and I came came with a few friends a couple weeks back and I got two chicken tacos and a carne asada burrito....hey it was happy hour I had to do it big. I was very surprised with the chicken tacos because I did not know that the mushrooms were going to pair so well with the taco. Also, that aioli that they slap on those tacos is straight fire! I could put that aioli on anything and it would be good. Carne asada burrito was good but it wasn't my favorite. Chips and salsa were delicious. My wife got their breakfast and it came with a pancake, schreiners chorizo, and a few fried eggs. We both agreed that it was the best pancake we ever had and the chorizo was amazing! Happy hour is not that special though only like $1 off certain menu items. I will definitely be returning.

iOBtjNDcdRCwmSGNbViIUg.text: The food was excellent and the service was even better! They have the friendliest staff and I can't wait to go there again.

QP9SvO4GOKzig2PVebbBdw.text: I'm giving this place only 2 stars because service was absolutely slow and the hostess ladies were very unfriendly.  There was no wait time. The hostess ladies didn't greet us with a "good morning, how are you...."but with a rude ,"how many?" We sat for almost 15 minutes without anyone taking at least a drink order. We had to go to the bar and ask if we can order coffee.  We waited even longer to order.  By then I was over this place and was ready to go. The waiter just dropped out food off, still no questions of how we doing or if we need anything else.  Brougth our food and walked off.  I ordered the juevos rancheros.  It was very good.  A small bowl of fruit for 6 bucks.  The outside doesn't have a nice view.  The inside of the cafe is very cute. Very disappointed in the lack of hospitality but kinda not surprised. There's a farmers market down the road that I look forward to visit after this place. I'm sure a more pleasing environment. If the employees enjoyed their work, they would have no problem with smiling and being friendly to customers.

7F9SrZbri0oPafCBIZGKXA.text: Disappointed that the restaurant's success has lead management to drop the complimentary chips. The explanation by our server as to waste made a little sense -to a point, since one bowl could still be offered gratis upon request (they promote consumption of good but higher margin cocktails!)  That said the rating still would have managed 5 stars had we not been overcharged $2 each for the shrimp burritos we enjoyed. While the menu clearly indicated that they were under the flat taco / burrito price in the banner for the group- as only whitefish and pork belly carried a premium- our waitperson still challenged us and had to bring in the manager. The manager did make the adjustment but only after serving up a lame and nonsensical excuse / explanation about "new" menus - while only the ones that we ordered from matter    While we enjoyed our meal, we had the sense that we were not appreciated and will be faced with unsupported rising prices at on future visits.

NtCXJU6tDpjvKwXkl9pYjw.text: I rarely seek out Mexican food, but we've been here a few times now. Didn't know it was affiliated with Gallo Blanco until I noticed a few familiar dishes on the menu. That's a good thing, since Gallo was one of the few, more authentic Mexican restaurants I enjoyed.  Food is excellent. You won't find the giant canoe sized plates full of shitty rice, pasty beans, questionable meats, soggy tortillas and watery salsa here like nearly every other TexMex toilet in this town. Everything I've had has been really good; tacos are outstanding, the Naco Torta is extremely good, and they've managed to keep most of the oranges out of the guacamole here (biggest let down of Gallo, ick!). We will try breakfast eventually. Only gripe was an entree steak salad I ordered. For the price, I expected something a little more generous than what was put in front of me. The steak was awesome, but they could have fluffed it up with another handful of greens. That being said, I won't venture too far from their staples in the future...  Drinks are good, a lot of innovative combinations that actually work, but all are super pricey and their quality is highly dependent on who's behind the bar. They have a few good beers, but nothing out of this world.   Where they lose stars, is the service. We have had outstanding service here, but we've also had Denny's like dismissive, inattentive service. Dry drinks, M.I.A. wait staff or bartender and a dash of attitude are what to expect when you strike out on service here. When the right combo of staff is working (seems to be just a few individuals that drag down the entire front of house), then your experience will be drastically better.    Overall, definitely worth a look. The food is great, just don't let the inconsistent service turn you off, and be sure to tip accordingly.

uiMk_GAORF7jZq43QD7vow.text: After an intense analysis of all of the taco places in Phoenix, my family finally decided on Otro Cafe.  My sister and I loved the vibe of this place - the decor, layout, and overall vibe were perfect and everything we hoped for.   Our food was delicious and our server was really great. All of the tacos I ordered were flavorful and fresh. If we ever make it back to Phoenix we will stop back at Otro!

w7hugqn2RUGy4A_8x8NdyA.text: I came here for happy hour and got a quinoa salad with grilled shrimp and sangria. Both the salad and the sangria were excellent. My only complaint is that there were only a few pieces of shrimp in the salad (maybe 3?). The space itself if very visually appealing, great spot! Waitress was great and very helpful when I was deciding which drink to try.

je2usNSzMjYRiBTaITl2VA.text: this preggo lady had a craving for battered fish tacos and was disappointed to learn upon arrival that they no longer offer battered fish tacos.  I ordered the grilled fish and the grilled shrimp.  Both were excellent but the fish taco was the stand-out.  Guacamole was very fresh with the perfect amount of kick.  Staff was super friendly and welcoming!

gWyNaQlzbaIIaj-KtrUcww.text: Friendly and the food was really good. Service friendly and prompt.   I had the carne asada burrito and it was unique, tasty and generous enough portion to fill me up. The iced tea was great too and my glass was always kept full. Chips and guacamole were great.

iO2IbQ5rlpz-kJFmdZIxPQ.text: This is my new favorite Taco spot. The long search for great Tacos, margaritas, and elote is finally over! The prices are very reasonable, the tacos were AMAZING as well as the elote. I highly recommend trying the pork belly tacos. They are to die for!  Service was great and the overall atmosphere was awesome.

GhNFc8UhXfDHnaDSVqwuAg.text: This review is really four stars for food and three stars for service! The pork belly burro was out of this world tasty! Wife had the pork burro...can't remember the name? Conchita or something of the sort? She enjoyed it as well. Had the chorizo queso fundido as a starter, tasty, as you would expect...greasy cheesy at its finest! Decent chips and homemade salsas, I could not choose between the two salsas...both had their merits. The service on the other hand...not just our server, but it was all kind of chaotic. Our drinks did not come at the same time, ordered appetizer and tried to order food, but the server just kind of wondered away! Probably for the better, appetizer servered by someone else and our server was M.I.A. the rest of the time.  Even the other servers seemed to be running around more chaotic than organized. We will definitely go back, I would recommend to anyone who wants to try some great flavors, not necessarily authentic Mexican, but delicious!

vPy77tlRRnBnQrXFdgtz5w.text: In a town full of good restaurants  Otro is something special. I'm always leary when places try re event Mexican food or " put their spin on it " ( translation = pretendouse bull shit ) but Otro maintains it roots while currently making THE BEST FOOD IN PHX. Yes I just said that. Seriosly............ Love your self, stop what you're doing and go now.

ReN2fGckL2i-Vau0-WgKEQ.text: Gallo Blanco is one of my favorite Mexican restaurants, so after finding out that the owner opened a new spot I definitely wanted to give Otro a try.  My husband and I came in for lunch. We were immediately served chips and two kinds of salsa; spicy red and a mild green. I only had a small taste of the red because I'm a wimp, it had quite a kick. The green was very fresh tasting and really good. I decided on the chicken noodle soup, shared guacamole, and my husband had the torta.   The chicken noodle soup was like a Mexican version of Pho. It was a big bowl of chicken broth with a generous amount of rice noodles and chunks of chicken. Fresh mint, basil, cilantro, bean sprouts and lime were served on the side. The broth combined with the fresh ingredients made for a very good meal.   The guacamole was very fresh, similar to Gallo Blanco with hints of citrus in it, it tasted great.   I only had a bite of my husbands torta, but the flavor was fantastic! The rice on the side was much different and had lots of fresh vegetables like squash and kale.  Oh and they serve passion fruit iced tea, which I love!  Service was very good too, they explained the menu and also warned me about how spicy the sauce for my soup was before dumping it into my whole bowl. I like being able to adjust the spice in my meals because I'm such a wimp when it comes to spice. I will definitely return to Otro Cafe.

w4pIw9_78DE2IG54L3XlTw.text: came here about a week ago. ordered the mexican breakfast and a pancake on the side. the mexican breakfast was really good but would probably order something else next time and the pancake is great.. will order atleast a pancake every time i go. it was a bad idea to sit outside with the flys though, next time ill eat inside.

u7356tkw9qNqVfJEwPzB7Q.text: Came here with friends for dinner. This place is amazing the feel of it is laid back and cute. Chill vibes and the food was delicious! Will def be coming back!

Z-nGhUxUdmtvsSsWslKSTw.text: Nice place to go if you Uber or get dropped off. Parking is a joke and they don't care if you are a customer. I was there for under 3 hours and had my car towed by Maverick towing company. I will not be coming back because of this.

vnNPMgFIpBCeHizIQKxbcQ.text: Food was delicious...portions ok...service was excellent...was a bit pricey for what I had ordered: chilaquiles and shared a couple of carafes o' margaritas with two other girlfriends...but a good experience overall.

46M8OuSZ4Mca6avDtp8CGQ.text: Guys. The pork belly. Get it.  They don't serve it 'til 11 am but they were super nice my first time in and let me order it as a side with breakfast, which was scrumptious. We got the Oaxacan tamale which is a good size and yummy with creamy goat cheese as well as the Mexican breakfast that comes with handmade tortillas. Yum! Plus they source local ingredients, which is always cool. Don't miss this gem!

Iud0RXiawej1xHX3KhenUA.text: This place is amazing! Every dish is amazing with incredible flavors! The service is spectacular. Kenneth is the best, listen to his suggestions they are spot on. We left camp social because the service was so bad and I'm glad it was because I'm not sure we would have found this great place just two doors down.

HnbQAwVRobWJoxMaKdqaTg.text: Best tacos in town. Great margaritas! The Sunday brunch and pancakes are fantastic! Highly recommend the chicken tacos(not your average chicken taco) with poblano peppers and mushrooms, and the carne asada tacos!

Dv6jot_6uzQqrJE3nnsOQA.text: Updated review:   We went in today and ordered the Sampler and a Yogurt Parfait. Everything was delicious. The band was really really great that they had playing. I'm changing my 5 stars to 4 stars because our server was awful (Reyna), but most importantly RUDE. We sat down and ordered right away. She asked if we'd like coffee and creamer and we said yes, she brought us the coffees but no creamer- we waiting 15+ minutes before asking for creamer and she was over a little dramatic and overwhelmed  like she had 20 tables and was super rude to my spouse saying she would get it when she can, followed by an extremely dirty look. She literally had 3 tables and half the restaurant was empty, but besides that, she could have faked a smile and politely said "sure, give me a moment and I'll be right back". Even after this, our coffee was now cold, and she still hadn't brought us the creamer. We had to get up, dump the cold coffee out, walk to the front waiting room where they had coffee to get fresh hot coffee and creamer. (About 30 minutes after initially asking for creamer, and after we'd have our coffee from the front (empty cups now) did she bring it- shoving it on the table and running off. Never checking on us, on until she brought the check. In the meantime we had to grab stuff off of other tables that we needed during our meal.   I'd most likely rate them 4.5 but because there are no half stars, it's their lucky day!  Stopped in for brunch today. We ordered the Sampler Breakfast, Muesli and a side of Breakfast Papas. BOMB.COM. The sampler was delicious, we ordered it with Chorizo and it had really great flavored, and was not overly greasy (as chorizo sometimes can be). It came with a flapjack which was good (but my husband makes better ones, so it's hard to compete), and mini tortillas which were really really yummy! We ordered a side of potatoes to go with it, and honestly they were the best! They were super crispy on the outside with some seasoning salt, and nice and mushy on the inside! They also make their own hot sauce which I ended up dumping all over the potatoes because it was freakin scrumptious! The red sauce I think was habanero and the green was a jalapeno tomatillo (normally I don't like tomatillo but it was sooooo yummy, more like a green chili sauce), both had a spicy kick with really great flavors. I'd like to bottle both up and take them home.   The muesli was good, not my go-to item on the menu because I wanted carbs and I'm pregnant LOL. But it was much better than I expected, with some great fresh/crisp fruit.   I'll be going back again soon! I really want to try the breakfast hirr

ARxmAp3NOFF9Xh9Xa4koOw.text: Try the ceviche. It was pleasantly spicy, was in a fresh and tangy gazpacho with generous chunks of cucumbers. And no olives. Nothing against olives, which I love. But I don't need ceviche to be briny. I'd rather it be tangy, spicy, and fresh. The other two places in the area where I tried ceviche put olives in their ceviche.

wRLPn1SUcCgp7HVTwbEF2A.text: I was visiting a friend this weekend and he suggested we go here for breakfast on Saturday. It was probably the best decision that was made all weekend. From the outside, the restaurant looks whatever yet when you walk inside there are so many little details that just make the place amazing. The place was packed yet we were seated within 5 minutes. Our waiter was amazing and was attentive without hovering over us so we could enjoy our meal and time together. I got a margarita (I know, for breakfast, right?) and when I asked for a second, the waiter laughed and told me that it's "highly encouraged" to get another which was funny. I got the Mexican Breakfast without the beans and used the in house hot sauce. It was some of the best hot sauce I've ever had. I'd put it on everything if I could. The vibe was great and casual and after eating, there's a mural that you can go take a picture of outside. I'd definitely come here again. I couldn't stop thinking about it after I left.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

l0xMHk-b0Gbm_3llWQFr0w.text: Delicious authentic Mexican food.   Lots of delicious options to choose from on the menu.  Came here for lunch which looks like may be a different menu for lunch and dinner.  I was recommended to try the Naco Torta by a co-worker. When i reviewed the lunch menu I couldn't find it. I asked my waiter about it, he checked to see if they would make it for me.  Luckily they did!!   So I decided to take in the sunshine and sit in the patio since the day was so nice.  The patio area is newer to the restaurant and I thought it was a great space.   My Torta came out.  The meat was beef, marinated in a delicious sauce. Not spicy but sweet marinade.  The bun was nice and soft which was smeared with guacamole. Lettuce and a fried egg on top.  The sandwich was fairly large. Don't expect any sides with this.  This sandwich took over most of my plate.   I tackled this sandwich by taking my fork and knife and cutting pieces off.  Yes the egg yolk ran down the sides of the sandwich.  It was heavenly.   Definitely going back to explore that menu thoroughly.     P.s. if you want chips and salsa you must request and pay an additional charge for your order.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Soo sinfully good
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Naco Torta with a fried egg on top
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Patio area

esKXImlCmb4BP4iq5vK0Nw.text: We decided to come here on our last night for dinner. The hostess was very nice about accommodating us. Our server was really friendly and funny and explained everything about the menu and answered our myriad of questions.   I got an al pastor burrito, I was worried it would be pineapple heave and too sweet, but that was not an issue at all. The sweet pineapple actually played well with some of the onion that was in there. I also like how they grilled the burrito. My husband got the enchiladas and the mole sauce was delicious, a very traditional mole with a great depth of flavor.   Or server did seem to disappear towards the end of the night, however I think he was the only server really. I really wanted dessert, but I guess they were closing and he just brought the check without asking if we wanted anything else... Kind of a pet peeve of mine but I was too tired at this point to say anything.   Good food and a fun atmosphere, I would definitely come back.

IUK8EqpM58YpZj0Rb9o7Ww.text: A Phoenix gem. Great atmosphere.  Great food. My favorite is the pozole , Tacos de carne asada and agua fresca. Mmm. Deserts are amazing too.  Service is too notch. Our waiter Jesus,was great.

jpmS7Q5bMRplvsEl4YtLiw.text: The carne asada torta is one of my favorites, the rest of my family had ordered different things such as the posole. We also ordered the guacamole which came with a lot and was also good. The waiter we had was very helpful and gave us good opinions about our food options. I would definitely go again.

HF7QNbyK9tVVXay731TIfw.text: This restaurant has a nice modern interior, but a somewhat limited menu, at least for lunch.  My wife settled on the Cochinita pork burrito, sans the flour tortilla, and I had a grilled fish burrito (with tortilla, which I left on the plate).  The ice teas (one green, one black) both contained passion fruit flavor, which is not our favorite.  We were not offered chips and salsa.   Our total was $31, which is a little more than we usually spend for lunch at many of the excellent Mexican food places in the area.  Although the food was tasty, I left hungry, since there was at most 3 oz of fish along with some chopped greens and a bit of guacamole, but no beans, in my burrito.  The service was good, but we will probably not return.

fc1_RGZGJIp7pyeEIQCXxA.text: Best frittata i've ever had - fresh combo of veggies on a light eggy crust. Loved it. Server was not attentive, an ageism thing, talking overloud and briskly to a couple of us oldsters, to be done with us quickly. Then at tipping time he came around..

3HE6sE_M46emWPj0Gn2tMg.text: I love LOVE love the food. The service is fickle. Depending on the day & who you get. I've dined in & carried, & had this issue on both services. My most recent trip I sat at the bar & ordered my favorite dish. The restaurant wasn't extremely busy but I decided to take my order to go. After waiting over 30 minutes & watching other customers not only order but receive their meal before getting mine. Finally the waitress "found" my to go box & it was cold. Nothing was said or done. No apology for the long wait nothing... the service is what detours me from wanting to return.

K0MdTK7_uMl-zEEzro_13A.text: Breakfast here rocks.  Dynamite (huge) pancakes, excellent coffee, chorizo and eggs that make you happy, solid vibe from the staff, and great service.  Gotta remember this for that killer breakfast too, not just the usual awesome lunch & dinner.

IozKtaI60ypdzzNdB_NKOg.text: We have been here several times on our way home from the Uptown Farmers Market. We have always had great breakfast meals here. The buttermilk pancakes are delicious. My husband has had Huevos Rancheros at many restaurants and Otro's are the best. I have had a taste and have to agree. Otro uses local farmers. The place is very clean and comfortable. Our service has always been good. Everything is so fresh and well prepared.  Last night we finally went for dinner. Great service from Rick! I had the pollo asado. I asked if rice and beans could be substituted for veggies and mole on the side. Rick said no problem! What a fantastic dinner!!! The chicken was so tender. The rice is like risotto!! 6 delicious house made flour tortillas are included. I built tacos from my meal and they were some of the best tacos. Best mole ever! The Aji Aioli is delicious.  We also had the guacamole and street corn. Yum!! The Tres Leches is the best too!! Our next visit we are planning on paella and I can't wait!

IF6R91XWT7zKM47DguZ8pw.text: Staff seems human. The guy we got to serve us breakfast brought us a delicious frittata and burrito using what had to be his real hands, which seemed a little too clean.  Seeing no blemishes, scars, or defects on our waiter's hands at all, I distracted myself with trying the house red sauce (which is the best hot sauce you will have in a while) and sampled some of a friend's huevos rancheros, which were done perfectly. I left there fixated on perfection, completely satisfied, and totally empty. I realized while I was there that I have never truly known simplicity, or else I have forgotten it. I wondered, " how can I get some of that damn house red sauce?". Maybe that's the answer.

AREjj--Trx5WhlEfnc3Pnw.text: One of my favorite brunch locations. The food is great, but the pancakes are my favorite. They have fresh flowers which they purchase from the flower shop next door. The only negative thing is when we went for dinner-ordered food with NO cheese and it arrived twice WITH cheese, I do not think we will return for dinner, but definitely for brunch.

Q6D8PqSHeIF1zzYQ7pIWdA.text: Oh. My. Lord. This place is the BOMB! Their tacos are probably the best I have ever had. Their iced tea is really good too (I'm kind of a tea snob). I've been here a few times since discovering it a couple of months ago, and it has NEVER disappointed. My server, Colin, was on top of things, including my frequent need for tea refills. (Btw, it's a busy place, but don't be discouraged by the sparse parking in front - there's a pretty big lot behind the building.) I put Otro on my personal Top Five in the Valley list!

dxNpT76Sa7jd4ViJMpDfQQ.text: Cute ambiance! Great tortillas. Unique little spot. My friend loved the chicken soup and their pancakes are outstanding. I will be back!

OnPM_TYXyslKPtim9LgwCg.text: First time visit. Pork belly tacos were so good. We ordered one  apiece and should have ordered more. This bodes well for next visit for the other meats on the taco menu. Wife liked the beans but I did not. And these reviews on the rice were so off. The rice was bland, needed salt and pepper. Should have been cooked with some kind of spicing in chicken broth. The queso fundido/mushroom appetizer was so good, served with those amazing little corn tortollas. The chips served were really good, the two sauces were good with the green the best, the red was too spicy for us. We ordered a trio of chicken enchiladas to share. Red,green and mole. Wow, the white meat chicken was so dry and tasteless, no flavor at all. We each took one bite of each and had the same reaction. Drinks are served in small glass glasses and they have so much condensation, leaving puddles all over the table. You had to wipe glasses each time or have water dripping all over you. Will be back for another taco experience.

gMeTDXJD1sk_PDmtl84xhw.text: I have been here twice, had dinner the first time absolutely loved it... went to breakfast this morning, Ordered two breakfast entrees one had a huge black hair in the eggs! AND my rancheros had a big shard of plastic cooked into it! Chewing on plastic was not fun! Ewwwwwwww! So disappointed #helathcodeviolation so gross  UPDATE! It's been 30 days since my AWFUL experience and NO ONE from management has even seen this review! They obviously don't care what comes out of their kitchen! #awfulbusiness

d_po4cK7zy8YFjAAvvQQXg.text: On here and on their website they claim to do take out. I called several times over the span of 20 minutes and the phone was busy the whole time. Like the staff just kept it off the hook so not to deal with calls during lunch. It is a good local spot for food, but this puts a real bad taste in my mouth

cmlCzZU20UZlmM0BMb_vSg.text: Disappointed! This was my fourth time. The live band was terrible. The recommended dish, Mexican paella was more like Mexican stew. the burritos were good as was the cheviche. The table next to us asked if the guacamole on their table was ours.The waitress forgot my elite order and never apologized.  I am sorry to say this will be my last visit.

lVgx2BIVGk8TB1d8YgzSmA.text: It's more than Mexican,  so that is a bit confusing to the brand.  I like that they serve grass fed beef.  I think they could kick it up a notch. They have a decent food concept here but may not be executing to their potential. Something just isn't right about the space. Get some design help. My steak salad was good,  but not great. Skip the gorgonzola cheese. Goat cheese is a better ingredient for that salad.

zOezuT2VNksOGw3xP99PTw.text: I LOVE this place!! However, the service is horrible. I get takeout often. Always the same couple of items I crave. The Otro salad with shrimp is so so good and refreshing! I just can't get over the crappy service. I ask for extra salsa because I order their chips but also want some for my dressing on the salad. I was given 1 red, 1 green. This is extra?? When you eat there you get an entire squeeze bottle for crying out loud!! Ugh! Not to mention that I am often treated like I am bothering them. I have had takeout orders messed up before and always go through to make sure I don't get home without something I paid for, they seem annoyed. They always seem put off by the fact that I am there to buy their food at all. I don't eat at the restaurant itself because the service is always poor. I am close to giving up on this place and their good food. I can't continue to give my money to a place that treats me bad. There are too many great places in central Phx to frequent. I will have to go elsewhere.

ORKM7w9URuc0V4ba5f-q3g.text: I have been to Otro twice.  Upon arrival I am very clear with the server that I am vegan.  I ask for recommendations and I also read the menu very carefully before ordering.  On both visits I have been served dishes with cheese on top despite stating that I am vegan and making necessary modifications when ordering.  This is very frustrating and requires sending food back even though I am very precise with my order to avoid having to do so.  People with dietary needs should be accommodated with no problem

itJI9RMY96XTvv2Zy3Aw6Q.text: Went there for lunch yesterday.  This place is a home run.  We love Gallo Blanco, this is more intimate and a great addition to the neighborhood.  Tacos were amazing as was the paella.  Great beer selections.  Waitstaff was fabulous.  Can't wait to go back, will be a regular stop.

40o-nCxyDkkNjyAGVD7clw.text: I really enjoyed this restaurant. The food was fresh and unique! We'll def be back!

jeg84Dko9C5nxhfOFQ-aQQ.text: Has become my FAVORITE neighborhood cafe.  GREAT salads! The new shrimp and grits are the BEST I ever had. The Lime Tarte is like tasting heaven!! The servers are great and know the menu well.  The chefs..the BEST!

kWefjaod_G-4mLKcVrdPUQ.text: This place has great food, we do tend to wait for a table so if the make reservations I suggest that!

YKoujKXc-V8KlfAhvtYZgA.text: Extremely slow service; forgot half my order. Food was not worth the wait.

xiAsDr22ym5E-pm3WWMg8w.text: I should have taken a picture of my yummy lunch.  So sorry for that.  This was my second visit.  The first time, I was with new co-workers and didn't pay too much attention.  Well, I noticed enough that the waiter was handsome and very friendly.  :)  This  time I was alone and felt like some breakfast for lunch, plus I wanted to get some reading done.  I had the huevos rancheros with a side of bacon.  I'm generally not a huge fan of Latin food, but this place is definitely changing my mind. I didn't even read as much as I wanted cause I was focusing on the meal. I was full half-way in and had to command myself to stop eating.  My food came out quickly, nice and hot and served with a smile by Valerie.  I definitely will be back for Happy Hour as the menu looked very interesting.

on0bCSKY8PCvYrkFeJX-6Q.text: Great food so flavorful and fresh. The atmosphere was relaxed and service good. I really enjoyed everything and the guacamole was amazing. The Inca salad was delicious so fresh! I am excited to return for Happy Hour.

LqcV4WdQNLZH9N2st0X73A.text: Otro was a pleasant surprise.  Their food is high-end and a pleasant mix of 8/10 authentic Mexican and 2/10 modern.  The outdoor eating area was also a  treat.

YOTU3f5lOOBERZC3_qzRvw.text: Had been meaning to get here and finally made it last night. Excellent fare and solid service at reasonable prices. Party of 6 of us - man I love summer when the tourists leave and you can get seated right away anywhere. So nice to have craft beer on tap with my Mexican food - Four Peak Hop Knot IPA. Started with the chips and guac which I thought was very good, although I would have preferred it with the cheese on top. The elote, on the other hand, was wonderful -- as good as I've had. I ordered the "paella", which was a ittle thicker than a standard paella and seafood-less, I believe (Chicken, sausage, ham, root veggies). Very nice, and although I had plans to save some for tomorrow, it didn't happen. Wifey said the chicken mole was good, but she still prefers the version at Pepe's Taco Villa. OK, to each her own. Split an order of the coconut pudding (meh), and a key lime pie/tart/square/something that was phenomenal -- creamy and super-tart.  Only downside was that it was pretty warm in there. Don't know if they had A/C problems or were using a swamp cooler, but it was borderline uncomfortable at times. Crank up the A/C guys.  Great place. Great location. I'll be back to try the Al Pastor tacos, and can't wait to try the chicken soup everyone seems to be raving about...

sCroIBbr8XTMx_cN965TOw.text: Came here with my family for Mother's Day and it was perfect! The portions were excellent, food was great, and the server was very friendly. A unique take on Mexican food that blew me away! Very intimate setting and great atmosphere. Highly recommend the shrimp tacos and the green salsa mmmmmmmmmmm!

s1zuTBPXk30y1Gq8UDm_8w.text: Good food consistently poor service, slow, no one checking on you, no water refills very frustrating.

Jc4JvO4TZS6Z6fgVGxNNxw.text: My first time at Otro I was not wowed. It was very solid but nothing special. I wishing I was just at Gallo. The second time we went for lunch and everyone at the table was raving.

xZnggCioeAXBlw4PodDsxg.text: The chilaquiles are one of the best I have ever had! This comes from a legit mexican too lol. Great atmosphere and servers are great. Tacos al pastor are also a must! One of my favorite restaurant for breakfast.

9GqUll10_75t7Wqz3fx16Q.text: Great food, great margaritas and a solid beer list. I like the tacos al pastor and the cerviche. Nice to sit outside on the patio and enjoy central phoenix. The owners are really cool and personable.  AWESOME ADDITION TO OUR CENTRAL PHX REVITALIZATION!

8aPVHxPseW058YDTCnKRxQ.text: Found this place on yelp and really enjoyed our dinner. I had the small inca salad with shrimp and could not finish it. I wasn't a huge fan of the Cadillac margarita, but my husband thought they were great.

ap1mcegGH11bsOpIhApbAA.text: Food was pretty good. Service was really bad. Cost them a star. Servers were really nice but we had to ask for stuff over and over and over and over. Food came out not together which was awkward. Servers kept coming by our table with food, but it wasn't ours. Then they were going to other tables with our food. We often were asked if we ordered stuff. They seemed  uncoordinated like it was everybody in the whole place's first night on the job of a brand new restaurant or something. Don't get the "rum cake."  It is actually chocolate rum but doesn't have any flavor; neither chocolate nor rum.

lxDIUXSjX7s2Vbl7pwBaaQ.text: A Mexican veggie option other than a veggie burrito/ taco is that too much to ask for?  Thankfully Otro has two other unique offerings. A veggie torta and the real reason to come if you are vegetarian the veggie paella.   Many of the basics here are similar to their sister location (gallo blanco) the thick quarter round chips the green and red salsas how ever a bit more sour.   The paella was great full of flavor and textures from the various fresh veggies, it was very hot from the nearly nuclear iron skillet it is served in so take your time as it will burn you. It is served with a few token corn tortillas which are good but few in number.  The value was decent I will be going back.

uABwWKaR2mYBdc-oo_KVBQ.text: This ended up being a second choice because the first choice was closed. I was not disappointed. They have excellent food and great decor. It can get loud at times but the food is amazing. They are also good for vegetarians and the portions are large. Their guacamole was excellent. They bring over a bottle filled with water and it's not tap water which I really appreciate. Definitely recommend.

qCTRUwPpP12mld1r__zQyw.text: Disappointed. I walked in and attempted to put my name on the list, but was told to please wait. There were several people waiting and plenty of empty tables. After 10 minutes I asked if I could finally leave my name for a table. The guys says sure "there's a 45 minute wait". I explained that I had already been waiting and questioned why there was even a wait when half the restaurant is empty. He stated that all the empty tables "are for reservations". Well shit, I've never had to make reservations at 6pm on a Tuesday night and I've never had to wait 10 minutes just to be put on a wait list. I remember the food being good, which is why I went back, but the service really lacked.

lLaGETZ2AIiDbA7M0LS4Xw.text: Been here almost a dozen times; always satisfied and no complaints.  Service is always good,  the food and drinks are  always tasty,  ambiance is kick back,  today(Sunday late  afternoon) they had a two- man band that is awesome to listen to, and it's never over- crowded or too loud like their sister restaurant,  Gallo Blanco.   You can't go wrong with their menu, it's simple to understand and well thought out! A must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Paloma(pink) mixed drink, pastor taco, chx taco, veggie taco(I&#39;m a meat eater,but the veggies in this r delicious) and guacamole

xYCWh5zo-LOjELT021EhTA.text: I'd like to give them five stars, but the service the last time made me go down to 4. The waiter seemed in a hurry and rarely checked up on us.   Other than that, their food is really good. I love their tortillas. Very much similar to Gallo Blanco. Gallo Blanco's guacamole is just much better. Last time I went, their michelada was watered down and warm. :( I love my micheladas and was very dissatisfied.   Would go back! Please keep your glasses cold for the micheladas. And the chips! Please keep them warm. No one likes a warm beer and cold chips.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Torta...sooooooo good
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carne Asada tacos
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish tacos

3JKWQOrbwC_2q8Ha_zG1JQ.text: Excellent food, service can be slow at times. It does get crowded on Saturday afternoon. It is a little more than I normally spend but totally worth it since the food is so good. I would highly recommend the guacamole!

eY1n5kWOAe4NS0BkAW5Fkw.text: Went in and it turned out to be happy hour. Which meant some menu items were a dollar off (yes!) AND kids eat for free (double yes!). We ordered the guacamole, chicken burrito, carnitas and shrimp tacos...the kids had quesadillas and chicken tacos. Listen to me. EVERY SINGLE THING WAS DELICIOUS. I'm a little sad we didn't order any drinks but I guess that means we just have to come back. ;)

he_bnMJlf0kZEYSkUQtoiA.text: This restaurant is a hit or a miss in service and food. We had great service and food last Saturday night. However, this Friday night was horrible. We ordered pescado veracruzana and the sauce on it was so salty that it wasn't edible. We complaint to the manager who gave us limes to cut the salt. It didn't help so we dump it in the caldo de pollo, which was bland. No apology from manager or waitress. We weren't happy and were still hungry so we left for another place. I later looked at my receipt and saw that they charged us something we didn't have. It was a small guacamole classic which was what the guy next to us was eating. If there is a next time, we won't go during dinner rush hour and we'll be sure to check the bill.

meFKnZL1TeVhMBkrQ6GhUg.text: The first thing I want to say about this place is wow! I would like to rate this place higher because of the amazing taste of all the food that I tried here but I have only been to this place once and I never even heard about it until my friends took me here this last winter. I'm going to straight up say that I enjoy the heck out of this place and I really like the laid-back Latin environment at this place provided as well in the area seems to be pretty cool with a lot of the restaurants and shopping. Always remember when I rate a place of five stars then I swear by it and this could be one of those places the more I go back and try it.   I only tried their breakfast burrito which I highly recommend it was very savory. I tried a little bite of everybody else's food as well. everything I tasted it was fantastic so this is definitely one of my places of choice for breakfast but I still have not tried anything else other than this so you never know it may reach the five star Someday. I would like to say keep up the good work because the Arizona restaurants are making a big comeback!

p6dRDzZdE9_YJJzgOzqV0Q.text: The place use to be awesome 6 months ago and lately they have lost their luster. The tacos have been  skimpy and oily the last few times we been. Also, they run out key ingredients frequently.They took the best dessert in the world off the menu too. The chocolate pudding was the best I ever had. In a town of great tacos they have slipped from #1 to 10. We have no need to go back.

MjK7NZWwwyGL6HrUgjRs0w.text: Went here expecting a Gallo Blanco - like experience. We were disappointed.  The famous Gallo Blanco guacamole with mandarin oranges was attempted, but the guac we received had just one tiny corner of one orange in it, and was missing the chunks of oranges that we remembered and loved from the Gallo Blanco days.  The veggie street tacos didn't seem as good as Gallo Blanco either, and everything was definitely priced more than it used to be at Gallo Blanco.

bTwpZEOMlyOdB41eB3b7cA.text: It's been quite a while since I've been so my memory is a little choppy, but I do recall being underwhelmed. I remember having had set very high standards at the time, when I learned that this a sister restaurant to Gallo Blanco (now Cafe Tranquilo) at the Clarendon near downtown, which was one of my absolute favorites. I recall everything being good, not great, on that note, I'm certainly overdue for a revisit. I do remember their Al Pastor being excellent, so now I have to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wall art next to the building, visible from the dining room. Art by El Moises
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pastor, Asada, Chicken and I think Fish, it was a while back

HU0QUF44COsZhaJ5405ZEQ.text: I was suggested to come to this place by a friend. I don't think I'd return. I ordered a carne asada burrito, despite the fact that it was $12, I was still optimistic. I'm not sure if the meat was seasoned with sweet tasting items or it just came out sweet, but it was disgusting. I could not finish it. I picked at the beans inside but other than that, I left the rest. Due to it being overpriced in my opinion, I would not return.

KnP_ezVoQwLYeI566OUfZA.text: I don't live in Phoenix anymore; I hate that I'm not able to frequent this place as much as I used to.   The guac is solid, the salsa verde is perfect, and the Wednesday night dancing is amazing!  What merits my 5* review and undying loyalty?  Their steak (and apple) salad is the best one in the city and it's inexpensive!

noJHhmrg4bc4-ivU4_sT9Q.text: I LOVE this place. My fiancee and I have come here a handful of times in the last few months, usually for breakfast and once for dinner. We are so impressed every single time. Consistently delicious with quality food every time. Service has been a little iffy a few times but we will keep coming back for the food!

UWVwKkcAyD5ewGNWSCmOWw.text: It was our first time here. The food was great and I loved the tomatillo salsa. Our tortas were yummy. I'm always a bit nervous bringing my baby to restaurants because you never know if they'll get loud and crazy. The 5 stars goes to our wonderful server who went out her way to accommodate our baby. Kids eat free and she brought out beans and a pancake. She kept asking if we needed anything and she was so pleasant and made us feel comfortable   Hopefully we'll come again soon because the menu looks great and all day breakfast, I'm all for it!

Mclbfm4v5O_8Bz-tIBrtdQ.text: Restaurant is clean also like that it has hint of modern touch. Tried brunch and lunch. Both were good.

cXFAycgXYAYv46Ov-2eq0g.text: The Takeaway: great ambience hipster Mexican place with food that's OK  I really like the ambience of this place. It's sort of has that hipster vibe all the Phoenix restaurants and bars are having now. It looks and feels great/ they have live music. Feels like a great date night place  Salsas were spicy and easy access in ready to use squeezable tubes. I'm a big chicken enchilada fan so I went with that and although they were crisp and tasty, the beans and rice that came alongside it tasted a little like dishwater which is kind of offputting. Maybe I just got the wrong thing. They also have breakfast for dinner which is awesome. And someone got something up look like pho (i think it's the caldo).

PEbmEYDtpQ-xMqtyZnGl3A.text: I have been to otro half a dozen times and it is on point each and every time! Great food, great service, great atmoshpere!! Don't forget the happy hour one of my favorites in the valley. Thanks for the delicious visit every time Otro!

rt8cclej17kxhN4MoslC0Q.text: We came here late one weekday when there were maybe 5 tables of patrons. It was perfect. Our server was super chill and we were able to really enjoy our time chatting.   We got an order of the guacamole, which was so simple and tasty. When it came to my meal, I had to get the shrimp and grits. I'd visited their booth at the Devoured Culinary Festival the year prior and have been craving those shrimp and grits ever since. I know, they aren't cheap and you didn't come to a Mexican restaurant for grits, but TRUST ME. It's worth it!! The chorizo makes those suckers absolutely phenomenal. I had plans to take half of my meal home with me for leftovers, but I couldn't stop eating. It was just too effing good.   I can't wait for our next visit. I'm dying to get my hands on that elote..... and eat more shrimp and grits, of course.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Admire this commissioned piece by El Moises from the window seat while you anxiously await the arrival of your meal.

toBughFQNUxc5XvetlEssQ.text: Friendly staff and lots of tables. The menu has some unique dishes. We ate there and really enjoyed the ambiance!

LGoCByJ95_PyKFRRXC8Ukw.text: We came here during brunch hour and the restaurant was packed!! Fortunately though, they were able to seat us right away, but service was really slow during our whole meal. I started off with a horchata, which came with a free refill. I wasn't a fan of the taste as it was quite watery. I like horchata where it's more milky and sweet. For appetizers, we ordered the small guacamole and callejero. For my entree, I got the small pozole because I wanted something to warm me up and hubby ordered the Pica Rico burger. The appetizers were okay- not sure if they are worth the price. The small pozole was pretty bland even with the extra items they included on the side. I ate enough to get me full. Hubby loved his burger, but I left somewhat unsatisfied especially when our bill was a little over $40 before tip. For that price, I expected a lot better.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pica Rico burger
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pozole

nZ59_2idmnPF1fPX76C1oA.text: I love the food. I mean I love their food. Every time I've eaten here, I am always impressed. The patio is great and even if it's hot out, the misting fans make the environment cool and inviting. However, last Thursday night there was a hiccup--an annoyance that should be remedied.   I ordered the Torta which was heavenly, my guest ordered the Bistec al Carbon. It too was magnificent. My friend has a gluten allergy and asked to replace the flour tortillas that come with the dish ($24, mind you) with corn tortillas instead. We were told that they didn't have corn tortillas. When we asked the waiter he said 'we've been down this road so many times but we can't substitute it.' We pointed out that they served corn tortillas in the Enchilada plate. We were told no again. I asked to speak with the manager who gave us a weird and hard to understand explanation as to why they could not and would not give us the corn tortillas. They said they keep the kitchen separated as to keep gluten away from the other foods and that these were special corn tortillas that cannot be substituted. My dining companion is exactly the person you are supposedly creating these rules for. He was offered very hard corn chips as a substitute. A word of advice: make up a better, simpler story or go to Bashas' and buy a $3 package of corn tortillas and have them at the ready.

pz0o8TArQLFR-fb6m9o59w.text: Food portions are very small & nothing comes with anything.  It is expensive & not worth it.. They do not wear gloves, saw them touching food with their hands. They keep some cookies out & people put their hands on them. Do not remove this review, it is True.

DHEROn1elfFfJNz-F5QiKw.text: The food is fucking fantastic, and the service was just as phenomenal! I went in for breakfast today and was surprised as well that they had options for vegan and vegetarians as well. I can't wait to come back and try more of their menu. I would seriously recommend this place to anyone that loves a satisfying Mexican breakfast it's a perfect cure for a hang over!

VFAEXVBTBj4-Q1ncq0h3-g.text: I love this place, the only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is because when they're busy on the weekend the service lacks. Food is always delicious, but we try to go during the week because we receive better service. Sunday's are nice with the live music.

WtBI1dS3SY0306Psm2_Rjw.text: Excellent carne asada. Ate there 2 out of the 5 days I was visiting my family. I'll be back.

Km0LmUTpIpy0BYx18TKxkg.text: Bestest, freshest, hippest place I've eaten at in a long while. Had the pork belly taco & quinoa salad and all I can say is, "OMG! Soooo gosh darn good!" My friend had the Carne asado taco with her quinoa salad and she loved that, as well. So fresh and real, the food was presented with the most flavor possible. Great wait staff also... Collin is extremely knowledgeable AND good looking, to boot! We will definately be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Soooo flavorful!
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sorry, the pork belly taco was half eaten... couldn&#39;t help myself!!

IaplVz_IhzWF7Dj-zDPpZA.text: Amazing  gluten free menu, great staff very knowledgeable about the menu. I highly recommend it

mfCjAd2MwGavu0xTSpD2RQ.text: Raising my review from 3 stars to 4. Went back to Otro Cafe last night with a large party (10) to have a farewell dinner for a couple of dear friends. A few of us arrived early to have some drinks but as others started arriving we were seated early (it wasn't busy on this particular Tuesday after 7pm). Our server Gabby was friendly and attentive, took drink orders right away and let us take our time making our decisions.  Almost everyone ordered the elote. Delicious. This time around I ordered a single enchilada, chicken, with red sauce, and a side of fries. Random but sounded good. The enchilada was ok. The fries came with a side of aioli and both were amazing. This was enough to fill me up...I wish I could have eaten it all.  A lot of breakfast burritos were ordered, one of the friends we were celebrating ordered the lamb (OMG!!!). Everyone seemed to enjoy the food. We sat and talked and had a lot of fun for a couple hours, all the while, Gabby and a couple others took care of us.   Another friend had made and brought a cake for the occasion and Otro was happy to store it and brought it out with candles and plates when we were ready to serve it. Thank you so much!!  After my first experience I wasn't sure if I would be back, but after this one, I definitely will be. Thanks so much for making it a good one Otro!

JzW7JT3--XFJ3dXkpN2ASw.text: I came here twice in two days with more than 8 people each time.  The first time, we called in an hour before to say that a small army of fast metabolisms were going to be coming, and could you please get a table ready if possible? We waited about 30 minutes for an outside table, and we waited another 45 minutes for food. At this time (10:30 AM) about half of the tables at the place were empty.  The second time, we didn't call in beforehand. We waited about 20 minutes for an outside table, and we waited about close to an hour for food. This time, more than half of the tables were empty, and the restaurant actually turned away another party of 8 because "the kitchen was too busy." What?  Other snags: no burritos or tacos before 11 AM, and you have to ask for chips (I think they're free?)  Why 3 stars? Why, the saving grace of this place is the food itself. The breakfast burrito is good, albeit small. I got the Mexican breakfast, and the chorizo was pretty good! I also got their take on a BLT, with guac and eggs. This was quite tasty and very filling for about $10. The horchata was pretty good too.  Service was good, bathrooms were clean and unisex.  Overall: good food, but don't come here expecting to eat in a hurry!

g4htoUddX7UuaKoOl98cPA.text: Took the ladies out for valentines. Service was a little slow at first. But I think or at least it appeared to be because they were short handed. Otherwise the dinner was great. And cocktails were even better. Hands down one of the best Old Fashioned I've ever had.

UJaRExD3dkYPaVErQecxKA.text: It's too bad that my wife won't give a restaurant a second chance if the first visit isn't good. I think Otro might be capable of being repeat-worthy but they blew it on our first visit.  First, here are the misses: They brought me a chicken taco instead of a veggie taco, my daughter got chocolate chip pancakes instead of regular pancakes and my wife ordered an over-easy egg on her tamale and got one fried hard and brown.  The tamale was also a masa brick. More masa does not make a tamale better.  The mistakes were corrected but nothing was offered to make amends.   There are some good points to mention. My tacos were delicious. The tortillas tasted fresh and homemade.  The decor is nice and I like the small size of the cafe.

VFZJWlFsuxl91dZZTmlZDg.text: Food here tastes great every time. Great happy hour deals, awesome options in general. Never disappointed at the end.... However, waiting 15 minutes for a menu at the bar when a manager, chef, bartenders, and whoever else, passes you by is unacceptable. A server making funny faces while looking at his phone in the server area. Seriosuly? Somehow you end up winning my heart with the food, but please step up your service game.

Uhi0hBherG-PGjgQkV3hXw.text: I first laid eyes on Otro Cafe and mistakenly dismissed it. I KNOW the best places are unassuming and I KNOW not to judge a book by its cover but sometimes I just can't help it. Parking was no problem, and when I got inside I was shocked at how cute it was! The hostesses were super friendly and walked me to my friend's table. We started out with The Maryland and the Oaxaca Old Fashioned to drink. The drinks are made with fresh squeezed juice so be prepared to wait a little for them. The Maryland was light and refreshing, the Old Fashioned was totally different than a traditional recipe. The mezcal giving a more exotic smokiness.   For appetizers, we opted for the Queso Fundido with veggies and chorizo as well as the guacamole. The guacamole was tasty, very lime-y (which I like!) but could have used a little more flavor, good nonetheless. The queso was awesome, but honesty I am addicted to cheese (preferably melted and served with warm carbs) so I could just be easy to please. The chorizo was a great addition but the veggies didn't add much so I'd probably skip those next time. We decided tacos were a must, so I ordered the grilled shrimp taco and the pork belly taco. I loved how the tacos were so simple, not a ton of extra crap on them to distract from the main flavor. There was plenty of grilled shrimp and it was cooked perfectly. The pork belly was just the tiniest bit dry on the ends but otherwise awesome. I would get both again!   Service was good- she wasn't super friendly and outgoing but she did her job well. No complaints there. I liked how she explained about the drinks taking a bit longer because of the preparation involved.   Overall- just a few small things were off about the food, or maybe I'm just being nitpicky. Either way don't gloss over this place like I did and check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Queso Fundido with veggies &amp; chorizo
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Guacamole
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Maryland

8uIzZ-Y6GQi3smpKQTW8aQ.text: Breakfast burritos all day, people. Breakfast burritos all day.   Not that I actually got a breakfast burrito--I was all breakfast-ed out by the time my dinner at Otro came around. But man, if you can get breakfast items all day, it's worth noting.  I was all about the Trio Enchiladas. That's three enchiladas (I opted for chicken) in three different sauces. I wasn't wild about the mole sauce, to be honest, but the ranchero and the verde worth definitely delish. I scooped up the sauce with the rice that accompanied the dish, and ended the feast pretty satisfied.   If I were to go back, I'd take a long look at the specials, or perhaps some of the more esoteric, uncommon menu items. I saw the soup come to the table, and that looked pretty great. And even though it's a Mexican restaurant, the best looking dish we saw was a steak. Looks like they do a 10oz steak with a Mexican twist (peppers, served with tortillas) and that could make for a change of pace.  The space was super cool. Remarkably casual, even though it's very well appointed and the servers were on top of things. We had a large group, and there's plenty of space, especially with that patio now open.  It was just what I needed after a long day of travel. Enough swanky that I feel like the trip was worth it, but comfortable enough (with comfort-esque Mexican food) that I could still relax. The strip mall looking location belies the comfort and class inside, that's for sure.

UWwZiZIKr_Qk0O2SzLkuew.text: This is by far my favorite place to eat authentic, flavorful, fresh, and beautifully prepared Mexican food.   I should actually use the word cuisine because the food is on such a higher level. It's obvious they use fresh ingredients and make the dishes from scratch. My husband and I love to share a big bowl of the Posole. So tasty with all the fixings,  just like abuela used to make. The tortillas have that salty tinge of homemade that is identical to the homemade tortillas I ate as a kid.  But I'm getting ahead of myself.  My husband and I had a bit of a rough weekend so we were looking for some deeply satisfying comfort food. Otro was perfect! Despite the fact it was over 100 degrees out, we asked to be seated on the patio. No one judged or looked at us like we were crazy. Just the opposite, we were made so welcome, they kicked on the misters and fans and we were in heaven. Our own private patio. It was as if we had the place to ourselves. The staff is so friendly and accomodating.   We began with the Tuna crudo which were paper thin slices of sushi grade Ahi tuna swimming in a tasty citrus vinagrette and red chile peppers /jalepenos dotting the plate. I could eat that every day of the week, 3 meals a day.   In the past we've had the pork belly taco / burrito but this time we arrived too late and they were out of pork belly so we ordered the rib eye taco /burritos. We were not at all disappointed. So tender and seasoned to perfection.  We enjoyed our meal with a couple of tasty cocktails, the Maryland for me which is a light, zesty lemon gin beverage that tastes like a bubbly lemon drop in liquid form due to the addition of proseco. My husband had his fave, the bloody Mary which has several veggies for the garnish.   To me, Otro is a special don't miss kind of dining experience. If you want to try authentic, clean, fresh and beautifully prepared Mexican cuisine, this is YOUR best bet!

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beautiful homemade tortillas. Side of frijoles with Cotija cheese.Otro does it right!!!
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rib eye taco with chunky delicious guacamole on top.
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rib eye burrito with the beans outside the burrito instead of in. :)

7MEnIX0i9LXTNk8ov2X01A.text: Loved the Otro Cafe breakfast burrito and what is better than kids eating free. Love these family friendly establishments. Oh and it is just a quidge down the way from a great natural vitamin shop. Definitely will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Otro Breakfast Burrito is well worth the extra calories. The quiet patio is just a quidge down the way from a great vitamin shop.

ajpNHXEiuYc4n6lNSynh4Q.text: We have been coming here for quite awhile and we love the fresh posole and side order of quesadillas. We also love the pancakes and the syrup.  We've had the chilaquiles in the green chile sauce and wasn't too pleased with the sauce so on our next visit we got the chilaquiles with the red chile sauce and it was so much better, we just not a big fan of the tomatillos in the green chile sauce. Over all the food is very good and authentic Mexican food

Mkon0E3kgZan_2cYzeP9Mg.text: I went there because I crave the veggie tacos.   I ended up with the guac, which is delicious and the chicken soup.   It came with lots of fresh herbs and it was the perfect thing that satisfied me.   It is a Vietnamese influenced soup and very tasty. So, tacos another day.

R0a7m4mYS9TXIFzLMVChFA.text: I've been here a few times since opening.  The guacamole is good but I have to say I've had the Chicken Soup and that's what brings me back. Simple but AMAZING!! Sit at the bar, have a happy hour drink but be sure to try the BEST soup ever!!

fmLgKv7u7cti3O4WBWEPJQ.text: Fifth time here, so I am really getting to know the menu and I usually insist on sampling from my guest plates. Chips and salsa free, but I also automatically order the guacamole which is chunky and rustic. My new favorite is Paella and at $8.00  a perfect meal The Al Pastor tacos get 6 stars, the best in town. A strong recommendation; The Inca salad with Quinoa as the main ingredient is a must order item and great for sharing. The space is beautiful as well, very clean and contemporary lines, uncluttered and a beautiful view of the kitchen where the magic happens.

dTzAlvdCvKvzt1-JxG1kLQ.text: The food is great, but it's very noisy.  So are most places, to my despair.  If you're young and/or fond of loud and lively, I think you'll enjoy this.  Menu is small, but the salads we chose were very good.

xQDekY2T91hDudKmnjX_jw.text: I eat at Otro once a week. Their carne asada tacos are to-die-for. And who could pass up happy hour prices- They just added a chicken taco too, and the marinade is delicious. The chips are crunchy and the guacamole appetizer is worth the price. My dad is pescatarian and he loves the shrimp and veggie tacos, too. If you are looking for a quick, modern Mex bite, go to OTRO!

0QBkIckMtK1VyAW7b6cVTw.text: Perhaps a 2.75, I felt the food was in imaginative, the menu was small, and the service was slow.  I love all Mexican food, but this just felt like it fell short

Oy2Ke1waC3-z7uTXGjEr2w.text: Veggie tacos and quinoa salad are REALLY good - wood fire grill, local & organic ingredients, open kitchen, good prices, and nice people !

3t4Wa_nFyQuPNtrYI-zeEg.text: Cozy place. Old brick Arcadia type building. Delicious michelada. Small portions but tummy. Tiny little tacos. Will have to order more next time.

bGRNmtZQAipS9aOhWJzJ5w.text: Someone said the drinks overpriced??????  HAHA a five dollar DELICIOUS pear mojito is overpriced???  Same person said the menu was limited.....well as a chef myself, i would rather see a small menu perfectly executed than a cheesecake factory menu where everything is blah....... the food here is awesome. We had guac, (very nicetouch of orange), the Inca salad is very unique and to die for! My favorite salad EVER. Tacos were very good, and where to begin with the fresh , locally grown, non gmo, and organic vegetable???  Three local farms featured, three sampled......how do YOU think they were??  Right........FANTASTIC!  We shared a torta, the torta Noca, with carne asada and an over easy egg and guac on it, the bread was light and airy and the flavor excellent. We had no room left for the coconut pudding, but got and shared one anyway.........light, fresh and again spot on delicious. We will be back if they keep it up......to you haters out there, STAY AWAY from here! I dont like to wait for a table!  All that and two Negra Modelos, and a pear mojito, and the bill was well under 60 dollars.........well done Mr Robson, and Mr Robson, well done.

bKaOfkTv70ej15k2-u3x8w.text: didn't really live up to the hype for me.  Menu was somewhat limited.  Drinks seemed a bit overpriced.

3pKX7L_eLzis8RwT-iiwAw.text: You've had chilaquiles before.....lumpy corn tortillas mixed with eggs and cheese.  You won't get them at Otro. Otro's are light, layered with shredded chicken and cheese but the sauce is the best part. I would have drunk it from the bowl. Great breakfast, lunch or dinner with an Inca salad. Prices are reasonable, friendly atmosphere.

RWUuHUfoeC72tbwbu4zwYA.text: This was the second time have ordered take out. I had the Caldo de Pollo con Fideo Chino and I loved it. Try it!

TffqKicApQQLlXtgV79yzQ.text: Got the carne asada & shrimp tacos. Carne was juicy and flavorful. Shrimp tacos were topped w/ kale, interesting twist! The corn tortilla was very thin which was a bit strange but still tasted good. Go at happy hour & the tacos are a dollar off!

hlNQ178brvg9o5TH699zxQ.text: Food was good. The service was disappointing. Your better off going to Gallo where people actually care.

kXAn9D7wtUg1eWrhtYDK4g.text: I love taco shops but this place takes a taco to a whole new level. Amazing!!  Shrimp, pork and carne are the bomb.  Have to try the corn as well. Definitely a must and many return visits.

cXUPeCi7fsUm-tj2EVH6kA.text: The food was delicious!!! I sampled three tacos; carna asada, al pastor, and tilapia. All the meat was cooked perfectly, tender & juicy! The homemade tortillas were so good...unusually soft and melt in your mouth. Definitely recommended!

e0N2DnKM3qstf4vC18YO8w.text: want to love it...not very busy Monday night...took a looog time to be served the dinner although the chips kept coming...plates lacked garnish ..my girlfriends margarita was very tasty but for $8 they should actually pour some hootch in..nothing to rave on....some music would be good on the patio...I think its coming soon

qSZKH9BST_moV1FNekE2_Q.text: Excellent food it is very fresh and light fare. The street tacos are fantastic, and the guacamole should be illegal.

zhF7sjW77CDd1uIHGTFOTg.text: Hit this place up last week with my boyfriend. First of all, I love that they're open until 10pm on weekdays. Most restaurants like this are closed by 9pm. First impression on menu items is that they're fairly cheap. Items are around $9 on average. Chips and salsa are free! Score. Since it's the same owner/chef as Gallo Blanco, the food is very similar. But I think the prices are much more reasonable. I had the asado chicken salad - portion size was good, I couldn't finish it. It was extremely tasty and I promptly inhaled it. Boyfriend had the pollo asado. Also quite tasty and he ate the entire thing like a fat kid. Our server was extremely pleasant and pretty funny too. Overall, we had a great evening and intend on returning!

y39AFFJ0ibzcq28XJz2r4Q.text: The food we had was very tasty and reasonably priced. We had in house specially cocktails that were delicious!  I did try the mole and I've had much better but everyone has different opinions on mole,  my wife liked it. We enjoy the food at the Clarendon downtown and I was glad to hear that this is owned by the same people! Definitely worth trying

p24Zg6cvz3CzVCXbMm9sdQ.text: So I'm a huge fan of Robson's other spot (yet I get the irony) Gallo.  The menus are basically the same as is the high quality of food.  And coffee is from Lux so if you need a little caffeine with your chiliquilles (my preference is the veggie option slathered in the green salsa)  then don't hesitate.    This is a little quieter than Gallo but it is also a little more sterile feeling.  There is a warmth to GB that isn't here with the white walls and massive windows but that said the parking is far better, the food is the same high quality, and the hours are a little broader which makes for big appeal.  I'm just happy to have multiple locations to get some of Robson's yummy creations. :)

taeLevhT10sLgonV8gZHRQ.text: I seriously can't say enough great things about this place. Otro cafe is one of my favorite restaurants in all of Arizona.  The drinks are unique and delicious.  All fresh made ingredients.  Try the Green Bloody Mary!  The chiliquiles are unbeatable... and I grew up on them so this is saying a lot! Start with the El Espanol ... it's a "salad" that makes you want to lick the plate! Serrano with avocado, lime, red onions, olives, cilantro drizzled with a dressing that makes your mouth water! The vibe is artistic and they even have live music and flamenco dancing some nights!

qfkDvrHpNw6iOfJUpqealQ.text: I ordered for pickup over the phone. I was told my order would be ready within 10-15. I was only about 5 min away so I decided just to come in and wait for the order. I came in and sat in the seating area for 15 minutes without one of the employees even acknowledging that I was there. At first I thought oh maybe they're busy, but the girl who had taken my order over on the phone had actually told me verbatim, "we're actually not that busy right now." This is not the first terrible experience I've had with Otro and at this point I can't justify going there for horrible customer service and average Mexican food.

Ogpv0is0ls5iQM0wOgqqHw.text: I eat at Gallo Blanco regularly and recently tried Otro.   Customer service was impeccable and the food was incredible, as usual.   The guac and chips here are different than Gallo. The guac is more spicy. I actually prefer it over Gallo.   Excellent burritos and enchiladas. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. And I love that they get their in house coffee from Lux.   The owner, Doug, is an awesome guy and made for a pleasant experience when we went.   Definitely a staple!

M7MafvD4pO0rvQCZZg7vbA.text: Decent food (had the breakfast burrito, which was delightfully pressed on the grill and crispy), great location, but some of the worst live music I've ever heard in my life, right up there with some wedding reception noise!  The restaurant was full and ONE person, an employee who seemed to be the singer's girlfriend, applauded.  Dead silence from everyone else.  For several songs.  It was really bad.  I actually had the waiter change my order to takeout, but thankfully the "musician" packed up soon after that.  The poor server apologized, and said they're working on the noise level, but I think they need to look at the talent level instead.  If I hear/see that awful LOUD caterwauling they call live entertainment again when I enter here, I will immediately turn around and leave.  This experience was actually from my second time in the restaurant.  My first time I walked in I was ignored, there was no one at the hostess stand area, and there was a bored looking waitress rolling silverware and pretending I wasn't looking at the menus.  I walked out after a bit.  Two strikes means I've yet to go back, since Los Tacquitos on 16th Street and Glendale is just as close, much faster, and the women working there (owners?) give great customer service.  Their quality probably isn't as high as Otro, but neither are their prices.

XWc-ahWYXW5ec1xq1mhA3g.text: This place is great! Wednesday night flamingo and tap dancing performance. Food is delicious. Good spot for a date. The food is a bit pricy though. Over all a good stop!

hEXh6NOh2c83likzFIt4sw.text: The tacos are excellent!  Loved the veggie & shrimp.  Our server was new and didn't know much about the menu & drinks, but he was nice enough to get experienced staff to visit our table to answer our questions.  When we visit Phoenix we'll be back.

kRoU-ZayurhHncPlxsi5mQ.text: Took the wife and kids there for brunch ., Service was amazing we spent no time waiting the food was absolutely in saying I had of the original Mexican breakfast , supreme attention to detail

VYGQw7kk0NxrcEZri4JduQ.text: Happening restaurant, filled with all ages, and tasty food. Ordered their guacamole and chips, along with the Mexican Paella. Everything tastes great! Admittedly, upon arrival, I had expected the paella more Spanish style with shrimp and other seafood, rather than chicken and chorizo. Regardless, loved the space and large sliding door that opened up, along with the sky lights scattered around the room!

F2tpFJNwyoFJYLFm9LQNUg.text: Music is way too loud inside to chat with your companions. Unfortunately on Sunday it was too hot at the outside tables (sure, not their fault) but without any misters or ice in your water. Also, empty unclean plates sitting on other tables for a while collected flies so when they finally cleared the plates a ton of flies swarmed around multiple tables and you couldn't comfortably eat. The guac was tasty but can't comment on the rest of it because I had to get it to go just to escape the flies and ended up tossing it by the time I got home.

TxQtKXLnm96ONHbi4CfW1w.text: Very impressed with this restaurant. Excellent food , amazing flavor and it had live music. I would def come back!! I had the pork belly burrito and it was very good!!

NJ99A7-TwLr4L2HN0ibVcQ.text: This is my second visit to Otro Cafe and I wanted to love it. Delicious ceviche and agua Fresca. The tacos and margaritas  were tiny, mole horrible, elote overpriced, the avocado in my guacamole was not ripe, rice undercooked and had a weird flavor and I love saffron. Won't be back super underwhelming. The service was AWEFUL tonight.

CIqpqmYwaVL6tHSKaJReTw.text: Otto has very good food. We were eating there this morning. They were having a manager's meeting. One of the managers got up to greet a guest. Our waitress Anna was literally called away to seat a single person (no joke) in the middle of taking our order. I mean my mother in law was mid sentence and Anna walked away. She tried to stay, but the manager insisted. Instead of seating the customer himself this manager decided it would be more important to seat a single customer. Later we had to ASK for a coffee refill. A red headed waitress came over and we requested decaf, she said she would be right back but never returned. Great food horrible service and management. PS They have a bad flu problem in on the patio. Part of it could be because they had a lady mopping the back patio WHILE we were seated with a rotten mop. Enjoy!

Z-q6wfgMVHugS46875NJJw.text: Great service and beautifully prepared food pleased our party of four. Everyone was pleased with their food: guacamole, taco al pastor, posole, camarones, ensalada con pollo asado, ensalada de la casa--really terrific with the serrano ham.

RhziMZ_1R7hGtNxhj69VxA.text: Elevated Mexican food is what you get here. No, its not your typical style fare that comes with beans and rice (only two breakfast plates do). The food here is good and full of flavor, but not the same flavor you're used to if you were brought up eating Mexican food. For example the huevos rancheros come with two small quesadillas, usually a treat, but the problem lies in that they used small flour tortillas for the quesadillas instead if crispy thin toasted corn tortillas. What you get is two think flour patties with melted cheese.  Where they get it right is with their chorizo and beans. This place is best if you are on a casual date or out with friends who didn't grow up eating Mexican food.

jicgaMcZi2vcS9x6HwEiEA.text: We came here tonight for dinner.  Excellent Mexican restaurant, but not your typical Mexican place. I had the chicken burrito and my wife had the chicken Apple salad.  We both loved the food.   Good service too.

5xnrAijoYJV-IxxSU6x_ug.text: One Spanish Word: Michelada.  Not many Mexican places around town do the Michelada justice (or even know it really), which is pretty funny considering our neighbors to the south are all about it. And with good reason. A Michelada is Mexican beer and lime juice, with or without tomato juice or clamato, and a salted rim. It's delicious, and Otro's includes the awesome touch of red pepper infused salt on the rim for that extra kick. Normally I wouldn't lead a review with a drink, but that just tells you how excited I was about it.  Now, the food. I like meaty Mexican food, so I've stuck to the tortas and burritos here, both of which are really tasty. I recommend the carne torta and the al Pastor burrito or torta. Portion sizes are OK, not insultingly small, and not too big either. A burrito is about a foot long and you can wrap one hand around it, and a torta is served on a standard size torta roll. I like to eat, but I have never been known to have a gigantic capacity, and I have always finished everything on my plate but not left hungry.  As others have said, the guacamole is legit. Plenty of citrus flavor that makes it pop. I would also recommend the queso fundido if you like cheese and don't care about calories.

Smn2qyr1ud_EuFZZ4ZN2lg.text: Always get the weirdest service here. It is strangely slow for how busy it seems. I am writing this review because I attempted take out and received awful service. My order which I viewed on the line sitting for 11 minutes was finally given to me after the guy realized that he "effed up" and yes he actually dropped the f bomb. Apparently abandoning food isn't worthy of taking ownership in an appropriate way. Manager please reach out. I know you spoke with me that night and referred me to this foul mouthed individual with a beard handling cold food.

FuM0ZcNW3G0H2-g7p6sicQ.text: Really chill place with some great food. Went there close to closing and they gave me no hassle and didn't rush me. The servers were very laid back and friendly.

MW38cQm4LBrJh3Ny1Yr9tA.text: I'd like to give Otro 3.5. The food is very good. Service, service needs work. Our server was somewhat short with us, and appeared overwhelmed by the situation.

Jo05qLPXDGePcSiVq8tDtQ.text: Met some friends at Otro Saturday night.  Even though our table was set--we waited almost 15 minutes to be seated and this was at 6:00 pm.  Otro is just okay--nothing knock your socks off about anything--I had a trout special--the fish was good but not outstanding--five people at the table ordered the paella--and to the person everyone said it did not have enough flavor--it was just okay.  The highlight was the lime pie--yellow like it is supposed to be and puckery.  All the prices are very reasonable--I was just hoping that the food would take my breath away.  I will probably go back to Otro--but it will be for the company  whoever that may be rather than being drawn to the food.  One more thing--the service was just off--either it was too much or not enough--but it never hit the sweet spot.

7MNHcdk2XttgP77Q-Tjhqg.text: The food was amazing! Everything we got was fresh and full of taste, the ice tea is really good. I was a little disappointed with being charged $3.25 for my kids soda even thou the minute said $2.75 buy kids eat free so I didn't mind at the end. Once again the food was amazing. The service needs a little work we were a party of 11 and the server was really nice but seemed scared to death of a big party. We will definitely be coming back with our kids!

MKQ4isw_GOwrRilygMXkgw.text: Don't come here for the Mexican food. Come for the booze, burgers and amazing service!!!!
