z8YKzsil56geqQgOydrLKA.text: Still my favorite place in town.   I just cannot eat enough of the pork tacos. Inca salad is fantastic.  Recently fell in love with the chicken soup.  It just a solid spot.

MGnY-iimO1hBrBAVDX-kMA.text: Tacos were good. Especially the chicken. Husband had carne asada burrito and I had the huevos rancheros and both were good. Tres dessert was dry but banana cream pie was good. Service was slow.

PC9N6dNsA8qyTskKFEwTRA.text: Stopped in instead of fighting 5pm traffic.  Nice place and happy hour specials makes it very happy indeed.  I think Gallo Blanco is bit better which puzzles me since it is the same people.

Fs_E7EYfJN5VEMHYkQXhlg.text: I ordered the breakfast tamales. The ingredients were fresh and flavorful, but the cornmeal was underdone and the eggs were overdone. The patio is pleasant and quiet, a welcome alternative to the bedlam inside. The waitstaff were pleasant and professional.

7kNwfeqfmzfKvq29mM0R9A.text: I really miss Gallo Blanco, and Otro is a decent alternative.  I really hope that Gallo opens back up somewhere else, only because I miss the feeling of the old place.

worA-Y2AJXLAO7LZUTbjCQ.text: Went here a few years ago when it was more tapas style for dinner and thought it was ok.  But now that ive relocated to phx went back to try the brunch.   Let me start with - i really enjoy Gallo Blanco. Id say that spot is one of those restaurants you can always go to and be satisfied. So i like the pedigree that Otro comes from.   Two words describes my experience: amateur hour.   Went with a party of 8. Called ahead and when we got there the restaurant was maybe half full.  Server didnt seem with it.  For example. A majority of us ordered coffee. We would finish. Then one of us would ask for a refill. He would then refill the one cup, then disappear.  Why didnt he ask if anyone else needed more? Another example. One of our party oreered hot tea. Brought a dirty mug. Told him - honest mistake - came back with a copper mug for a moscow mule.  Welp. Hot drink. Copper cup. Not possible to hold. That information didnt really register with him when we tried to explain.  He was more focused on the fact that it was clean.   Anyways. We ordered chilaquiles and tortas and pancakes and huevos rancheros. Literally took 45 minutes.  Pancake came out undercooked and room temp. Not to mention a sad spot where a pad of butter USED to be.  Huevos rancheros also room temp. Side of beans were hard crusted on top. Basically tells me it was sitting in the window for awhile. The chilaquiles were fine. Torta was ok.   Overall a dissappointing experience. Server was more work for us. Food was a bummer.   Oh well. I dont recommend this place.

fxcjhoCXBHs0gAnR3xj6rw.text: Otro easily had the best food overall of any restaurant I've been to since I've been in Phoenix (granted only 2.5 months, but we've eaten out a lot!).   We started with an order of guac to share in addition to the salsa verde and spicy salsa that I think comes with each meal. I could drink the salsa verde, and the spicy salsa was also very good. The guacamole was like what I'd make at home (so amazing:). Chips weren't out of this world but they were decent.  I ordered the Naco Torta which was delicious! My friend hates eggs and didn't want to try it even with the eggs removed, but I convinced him and he downed an entire half (which is gargantuan) in a few minutes. He had the pancakes - sooooo good. Another friend had the chicken soup which she thought was a bit too salty but liked.  I also liked the dark wood for the booths and the atmosphere. I've been to Gallo too (same owner) and liked it, but thought the service was better at Otro and the lack of a wait was a nice bonus.

cdxJvDOjmFja1JpPY4rmfg.text: Great new Mexican restaurant in Phoenix!  I had high expectations since I also enjoyed Gallo Blanco.    Nice space, friendly service and delicious and reasonable food!  I tried the al pastor and the shrimp tacos with a side of rice...super tasty.  My husband and friend tried the paella and were very pleased...it looked and smelled delicious.  My husband started with the chicken soup and it was amazing too - big chunks of chicken and noodles.  Definitely check out this great place!

LTuzZL4ikXza9pwT1qioMQ.text: Nice place. Food was outstanding. Salsas were great.  My Naco Torta unique, delicious. Mexican paella nice take.  5 Star but for one service problem. Two of us faced the front door. As the sun set a very strong sun hit us face on. ABSOLUTELY NO EFFORT was made to block the sun.  Service people seemed amused but what was needed was something to block the window for about 20 min until the sun set. Has To be a recurring problem?  Still will return for the excellent menu, but now know what seats to avoid in the early evening.

7z9GU8rsvPX_laX6z5LpoA.text: Their spicy Bloody Mary is simply amazing. My fiance got the prickly pear margarita and that was good too!   Their house made guacamole and chips was really tastey.   Service was O.K. Fair prices.

VPYLpEfJU2fV_8UnvcEZTw.text: Had the Inca salad to start and then had 2 tacos (shrimp and pork). Everything was very fresh and tasty. I don't remember having quinoa before, but am now a fan.  They were out of fish for a taco, so I dinged them a star.  Their green salsa has just the right amount of fire for me. I didn't try the red.  Will be back and recommend to anyone who likes fresh, non-fried Mexican grub.

c3tczA3yyGoNiH1NOtolbQ.text: What a WONDERFUL place to dine.   Not just eat-- but DINE.   THE ATMOSPHERE had a urban charm to it and was cheery and inviting.  Very clean and comfortable.   We had friends recommend it and we are so thankful.   We had chips and salsa to start off until our meal came.  Our server's name was Austen and he was wonderful.  Very attentive yet not overly friendly or fake.  Sincerely and genuinely a very good server.   My husband had the pork  burrito which was so flavorful and I had the shrimp and grits. It will be very hard not to order something different it was that incredibly good!!!!   We will be back !!! ( probably tomorrow and the next day and the day after that.......).

UOO-oKHQtkYYQbhqsMi92w.text: Outstanding food. Fresh. Tasty. Great flavor profiles. Excellent chips and guacamole. Terrific salsas. Homemade tortillas. The mole sauce was outrageous either as enchiladas or on a half chicken. The standard rice and beans were also fabulous. Full bar. Nice drink recipes. They even Serve breakfast all day!! The only downside was spotty service. However, I would gladly return to eat and drink even if I had to serve myself! I have been dreaming about the mole for several days.

AkDF0bP_xaY_g3R8-peLMQ.text: I miss Gallo  Blanco but when  tried this place I was hooked! i don't eat rice but when I tried there I was in love. The chicken enchiladas are my favorite and I love their guac!

uX3UuoRIp7lzIBQXbZ4XDg.text: Best Pancakes EVER! Perfect combo with my Lux Coffee that they have.

b7SbLEWRRo6ihwb-boFqDg.text: I have only tried this once, and that was takeout at 4pm in the afternoon.  So, the jury's out on the service in the restaurant.  What I can tell you is, having had the carne asada burrito, I will be back.  The flavor was otherworldly!  That charred ribeye flavor, juiciness, heavenly, spicy red salsa...the food would make me come back alone.  But I also enjoyed the service of Katie at the front desk.  She was very pleasant and efficient.  Thank you!

SfRip-WicTW3vX0qEL53ag.text: Spot on service. Wait staff was incredibly friendly and never even let us get to a point of need. My friends and I Arrived too early on a Monday morning but knew it was worth the wait so we returned for our late breakfast.  They recognized us as the early birds and thanked us for our dedicated patronage by providing us with a complimentary elote. Otro is my top go-to meeting spot for friends and family. The newbies that I've introduce to their menu are always complimenting the choice.

QD-tZGY0e5DpaPxYh8Nj-A.text: Deliciousness!!!!  Breakfast burrito with locally made chorizo, eggs, beans and potatoes in a homemade tortilla.  We also ordered and devoured the huevos Rancheros, a house specialty.  great atmosphere and shouldn't be missed!  Serves breakfast all day but also a full menu with lovely outdoor patio

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

KR7hIJ9SEvp3rDLDdb2XLQ.text: One of the best spots for a flight of super tasty tacos! Affordable, nice presentation, and they never disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

6wAZg2cFPJ0gxBef1I3uhw.text: Good old 7th street, home to some of the finest restaurants near Uptown Phoenix. Otro Cafe is no exception. The staff here is pretty attentive. My buddy and I came in on a great Saturday. There was hardly a crowd but our food did take awhile to get to the table. I could see why they offer chips and salsa while we waited. Some will say, good things take time and I would agree with them here. I ordered the naco torta and my friend had some carne asada tacos. We both agreed that the meat is superbly tender. Marinated quite well. The decor here is lovely just like their sister restaurant, Gallo Blanco. I also love their menu branding, colors always do it for me and this place has it all. Food for the masses, designers, and everyone in between. For sure, I would bring my friends here again.

9HPDWOU06jVsoOt7q0PwAw.text: It was busy for lunch on a Saturday.  But that's a good thing, right?  Not if it takes 20 minutes just to get a simple Chardonnay. Burrito was okay.  My daughter had a quesadilla that looked like a hockey puck. "Kids eat free", the menu said.  But it doesn't tell you that you pay an extra $4 for the chicken on the "free" quesadilla.

Tj0O20HVGdrXk85Y7fs44w.text: Otro is so good! I went here a couple of years ago and have been meaning to go back ever since, so I'm so glad we finally did :)   First of all, this place has an A+ patio lol. There are lots of seating options and cute lights and plants everywhere, and I just loved the atmosphere out there.   They also have great happy hour deals, so we were able to get a lot for not too much. We each started with the happy hour margaritas - they were really tasty! We also had chips and salsa, and their chips are SO good. They're the legit kind that aren't just out of a Tostitos bag. I like how the salsa is in little squeezy bottles, too. But *watch out* because if you think the green salsa is spicy, the red salsa is like three times spicier lol. So maybe try green first ;)   We of course got the Queso Fundido, because I knew from the first time I went here it's amazing. I like the chorizo kind, which is super cheesy and has lots of tasty veggies in it too. They serve it with soft, homemade flour tortillas and it's amazing. Idk why more places don't serve queso with soft tortillas, but they're messing up if they're not.   Then for dinner, I had the Grilled Shrimp and Grilled Fish tacos, which were delicious. I would've had more, but I was too full of queso lol. My boyfriend had three others that he really loved, but I can't remember which ones they were! We'll definitely be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Queso Fundido
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled Shrimp Taco and Grilled Fish Taco
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House Margarita

mAAOvzZ8pnwaPH36CgCDsg.text: Otro is a fabulous place for quick meals and full blown dinners. Never disappoints. This place is consistent, creative and flavorful. Been going since it opened. Nice staff also.

GsUVGMjnHLDPpln6CzuBrg.text: Best tacos in Phoenix! Everything I have eaten here has been amazing. It doesn't look like much from the front but it has a nice atmosphere inside and always a nice smell as soon as you walk in, kind of like a wood fire stove. Dog friendly patio in the back.

t8HEHp-Aaa5vqrRNlmvTtA.text: I am still blown away by how great everything was and I dined here 2 days ago.   First off, the flowers and the plants are super inviting and I wish every restaurant would get their act together and display fresh flowers. I know they cost a pretty penny, so I appreciate them very much!   We were seated in a nice booth and waters were dropped off promptly. We were greeted by Jesus and since we were slightly in a rush, he got our order right away. Food came out fairly quickly. We downed everything in like 10 minutes it was so good. Huevos rancheros, steak, shrimp and fish tacos, side of rice and of course the pancakes. I slurped it all down with a bomb Paloma. The cocktail had real juice in it, not that nasty mix most places use.   I haven't been out on a breakfast date in months because we just had a baby, and let me tell you, it was mouth watering and savory and delicious and I wanted to cry it was so good. Thank you thank you thank you!!!

LsnZM_-tFLWnyW15vUvb2A.text: My favorite place for posole. Not terribly sure how authentic it is , but it always hits the spot.  My jam is: Sunday afternoon, before i get my kids i order a bowl of soup and three tacos.  I put my head phones in and eat. Savoring my last moments of sweet freedom.  The bartenders are very attentive.  Knowing that I'm there and choosing my last few moments of freedom to be in "silence" and isolation.  Their pork belly is top notch.  Their drinks are amazing.    Almost as good is their brunch.   The French press is legit. The pancakes are to die for. The edges are crispy but the center is fluffy.  This mom, can't even get her pancakes that way.  Maybe it's the lack of time due to the calls of the kids but Otro never disappoints.

LQxh8hiX79egRo6YHtdLUQ.text: Happy hour tacos were awesome, had one of each but the pork belly was unbelievably good.

_JMdoPenCRw8AkU0M-hrLw.text: So far this is a horrible establishment. The waiter is very slow and he has no other table to serve. He took our drink order and went and served himself a drink at the bar and just walked around until we called him to the table, he brought my 4 yr old water in a lid cup but brought her a sprite mistakenly in a glass cup and said oh well... this place is not a Mexican restaurant and the food isn't close to being authentic Mexican. My daughter in law ordered shrimp ceviche, no tostadas so we had to order more chips. My little one ordered a flapjack not a flapjack it was a not very good pancake all flaky and falling apart all mushy. We should've just gone to Denny's or ihop! So disappointed. I do not recommend. Everyone in this place was blonde with blue eyes no way they know what Mexican food is and the service was horrible.

uShxccDuYNNnJKTjbYBbRg.text: The food is spot on here with fresh ingredients and great flavor. I love the home made tortillas. The ambience is casual and kid friendly with a cool vibe. We have gotten the queso, ribs, tacos, posole, elote...the list goes on. All have been satisfying. Everyone can find something they like here.

ypSyCSzybWuw6rV8uPPgsw.text: This place is discussing and nasty I got sick eating their carne asada burrito. So for all my yelpers save yourself and your body from consuming this sickening food.

-lBJLIBunKnt_SUA7V9Y6w.text: First let me say that I have high expectations for Mexican restaurants, saying that this place is pretty good. The green and red salsa are delicious. The red is super spicy but that is because it is made from Chile de arbol. The guacamole was also very tasty and you get to enjoy with some home made chips. The server was very nice and attentive. My husband had the carne asada burrito and I had the cochinita they were both good but I'm not sure if the beans were made in house. They had a can like flavor but since they claim they make everything from scratch it could just be the mix of flavors. Restrooms are cleans and they accept all major credit cards. The best part is they have coke products as well as jarritos  Price is higher than most places but the fact that they do taste better than most places makes the price worth it.

AkufTBXLe6FgWfIeFVDkCQ.text: Great atmosphere, always superb service. We love the chilaquiles which are not traditional style but are amazing! They have other vegetarian options and everything we've tried has been excellent.

9HmNCatUnYqwbat4jHEWlw.text: My friends and I came here yesterday for brunch and enjoyed ourselves. 3/4 of us got drinks. 1 bloody mary and 2 white sangria's. The sangria's were more tart and very refreshing. For brunch we had: Chilaquiles, Barbacoa and Eggs, Tamale (not sure which one) and Vegetables tacos. My husband wanted the Barbacoa tacos but they don't serve tacos with meat until 11 and we were there at 10:30am. I got my veggies without soy sauce and they had an excellent flavor to them. It's hard to find a good veggie taco (they can be too greasy or too bland...this one was great). My friends seem to really like their dishes. My husband wasn't thrilled with his dish but we would go again(after 11).   It's a really cute place. At one point a live band started playing music. The great part about that was that it was the perfect volume. It wasn't too loud so you could still hear everyone at the table. Our waitress was attentive and really sweet. I'd definitely come back.

huk06Zl0VTT8hlvHbGiWVw.text: The place looked amazing. Great atmosphere and welcoming staff! The chips and salsa was superb. The classic guacamole is good but nothing to rave about . Although, my family enjoyed their carne asada burritos, fish of day, I wasn't impressed with the New Mexico enchiladas! The chicken was very bland with no taste. The charro beans were awesome and the rice was different for me but okay. I give this place a 3 stars because it's people and atmosphere! My family enjoyed their food but as for myself I wasn't impressed! I guess I expected more with New Mexico attached to the enchiladas. I'm from New Mexico so I expected the enchiladas to be off the chain, but they weren't ! It's our first time here so maybe we will be back to try other entrees!

rnQcTo36fjpfZqV_-FZXCQ.text: Loved the pork belly taco and the papa fritas. Only wished their papa fritas came with more pieces!

bCpscg_GChs_NX5H1GvojA.text: World's best chilaquiles!  Not made with pieces of leftover tortillas, but rather whole toasted tortillas.  I order  mine with the freshly made green salsa.  They add succulent shredded chicken, Oaxaca string cheese and top it with perfectly cooked eggs.  The brunch menu is available all day.  Seventh Street in Phoenix is crowded with good restaurants and this one holds it own.  I came here after this restaurant's sibling the Gallo Blanco at the Clarendon Hotel in midtown Phoenix closed. Gallo Blanco's owner  is Doug Robson, a chilango by birth (Mexico City native).  This is my favorite style of Mexican food.  I have tried various things here, but always come back to the chilaquiles.

gxWPrCtB6iLzPtOQ2xfOzw.text: This place was such a pleasant surprise. I had never heard of Otro Cafe but when I told my dinner buddy I was in the mood for burgers he suggested Otro. Located in a tiny little strip mall off of 7th street and Bethany Home, I was immediately taken aback by how busy it was for a Sunday night. We ordered the chorizo burger and the cheeseburger with chips and guacamole for the table. The guacamole was good and chunky- just the way it should be. The cheeseburger that I had was delicious and cooked perfectly. My favorite part was the fries that come with the burger. Can't compare it to any other fries I've had before but they were perfectly browned and seasoned. Would definitely like to come back and continue to explore this menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheeseburger
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheeseburger Guacamole Classico

u-OthXUyiNlQu1RIjbQ7bQ.text: All day menu not available all day as advertised on their website. Extremely poor service and they were rude. Came in around 11:30am and menu featured all breakfast items except for tacos, burritos, and tortas. I ordered a carne asada burrito and it came on a plate with nothing else. No sides, no chips. No chips even when they sit you down at the table.   Complaint to manager and only gave 20% off the check and one free dinner menu item next visit (I don't want to come back).   This place doesn't deserve the good yelp rating it has.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carne Asada burrito wasn&#39;t good. No sides came with. Tried to force myself to eat it but couldn&#39;t go more than halfway.

AjyRcjYU5A1TIip_xoEtqw.text: Food is amazing!  We come here a few times. Month.  Food is outstanding.  Best guacamole and Taco's.  The only issue I did not give 5 stars is the service on every visit is horrible.  If they can fix that, they would be perfect.  Once again service is so bad..  no one checks on you, refills your water..  shame food is great but so frustrated.

6DmIyK4xRxLmlUB_aiQY3Q.text: I appreciated finding this jewel in the middle of the road. I just happened to be at a event nearby, and was in the mood for a walk when we came across it. The staff was welcoming. They kindly explained everything my friend asked about the gluten free items, and she was not even ordering any food... I was the one with an appetite. But I enjoyed their ambiance, their glutten free chips, the green sauce, and warm service. I want to be back to try more of their menu items. Plenty of options for my gluten free friend whenever she's ready for a bite.

ppR_AqzRBKLUjPiNCsdXSw.text: The service was really bad .   I finally had the time to come to this restaurant! I follow them on IG and I was really excited to come here . Although ,when we got here it was not great at all we waited 5 min to get acknowledged that we were waiting to be seated in the lobby . Then a person just tells us to sit where we want so we choose a table . We waited for another 2 min until the waitress just throws us out breakfast menus and doesn't say anything and walks away to go back to flirt with a customer and eats his food . We waited another 8 min until a lady tells us if we have been helped  and I said no so she just goes and says let me find your server , she comes back minutes later and says " I can't find her " . We got waters and just decided to leave then and there . Many people passed at us and looked at us but didn't wanna help us . It was not even busy to begin  with more servers than customers

R6MVByeIwtW86OE4bQe25Q.text: Date night doesn't happen enough for my husband and I, but when it does, we like to try restaurants that we haven't been to before.  So last night, after a quick shopping stop at the Crafeteria event hosted by Frances, we headed over to Otro Cafe for dinner.  We were not disappointed!  I used the Yelp app directions to find the location (duh!), and were psyched to find plenty of parking + no wait to sit down when we arrived without a reservation around 8pm on a Friday.  All of the employees that we encountered were extremely friendly and personable from the hostess and our server to Heather, another staff member that we recognized from another local cafe.    Our server, Randy was attentive and offered recs on the menu when we asked.  We ended up sharing an order of the Guacamole Classico as an app.  I ordered it with both chips and raw veggies.  I love that the veggies are an option.  (Veggies are chilled just right and include carrots, celery, cucumbers, jicama and radish).   The guac is chunky and includes avocado, cilantro, serrano chiles, lime juice, salt, white onions, tomatillos, orange and cotija cheese.  We each had a beer from their selection of both Mexican and local options, and then shared two entrees: the Pescado del Dia and the Mole Negro.  The fish came with veggies and the mole chicken came with fried rice and tortillas.    The ambiance is casual and features art on the wall from local artists.  The prices are moderate, especially considering portion sizes.  There is something for everyone on the menu too... and it's worth noting that Otro opens on Saturdays and Sundays at 8am for breakfast.  They get their coffee from Lux as well!  We'll definitely be back to Otro, and hopefully pronto!

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mole negro
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pescado de dia

xFpDJKyLRMiIF-Qm_kHOmg.text: This sister restaurant of Gallo Blanco didn't have to work hard to earn a warm spot as now one of my "go-to" places for breakfast, It wasn't too busy on Saturday morning, which was very surprising to the hubs and I. I guess we were early birds getting there a little after 8 because the place started to have people trickle in within the hour we were there.  To no one's surprise, I ordered the Chiliquiles Rojas. To this day, I still crave the Chiliquiles Verdes from Gallo Blanco, so I was just dying to find out how different or similar the taste would be. To tell you the truth, I couldn't really tell much difference, because I really loved the Chiliquiles Rojas. It definitely had some spice to it, but not the type that you can't handle. It's just packed with the right about of flavor and punch.   The Huevos Rancheros had a similar sauce but different enough that if you wanted to try both, they'd almost complement each other in a way. This one had no meat though. I personally like having protein, so I ordered my Chiliquiles with chicken.   We also ordered a side of Quesadilla Synchronizada, which is actually just a cheese quesadilla with Oaxacan cheese.   Funny enough, even though I took Spanish for so many years, I am embarrassed to say that I asked what the Verderas Crudas was. My particular menu did not say the translation directly beneath. The waitress just looked at me questioningly and politely answered, "Those are fresh vegetables." Ah, but of course! Of course, I wouldn't know what veggies in Spanish was. I am a meatatarian. Veggies only get in my way! None of that green stuff for me! Perhaps it was just the scrumptious Bloody Mary taking hold of me and made me forget, but regardless, we enjoyed our brief time eating here. (Yes, I mean brief as in, we were hungry and ate quickly and the service was efficient and great!)

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oaxacan cheese quesadillas
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chiliquiles Rojas
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Huevos rancheros

oRHnCHs-BrOGVa3ymtkCkA.text: Perfect lunch. Three awesome tacos, one awesome chilaquiles, two great salsas, a nice basket of chips, two iced teas, a flan and a key lime pie and we are in heaven. Everything was fresh, fragrant, delicious and made with love. Very happy with our lunch! The space is comfortable, clean and well lit. Plenty of parking. Good music. Great service. It's a no brainer. Eat here!

3vS7X332GMClg5LVZFXS6w.text: Otro Cafe, what is not to love!! Otro gives new meaning to great Mexican food executed flawlessly.  They are definitely more of a modern Mexican restaurant, but they stick to the basics from Tacos to burritos. The flavor is on a whole other level.  The Carne Asada Taco is one of the best I've had with Ribeye meat.    Portions are small, but pack some serious punch in the flavor department.    Great atmosphere, excellent service.  Go here and thank me later.

d_tItRn4afORAzaVmppsFg.text: So good.  This is a must try.  I've become a regular.  My favorites are the chiliquilles, the BLTA, and the number one thing you have to try, THE PANCAKES

ouA97q2yABhYUdDs_hOSAg.text: Ok, as we all know, it takes A LOT to get me to write a bad review.  It normally takes things like bad food, bad service, and an overall bad experience.  Well DING DING DING, we have a winner.    I went here for breakfast with my normal group of "Dining Friends".  We go to restaurants all over the valley just to try something new.  The service can best be described as untrained monkeys aimlessly running around.  There was no organization, no method to the madness.  Our orders were messed up not once, not twice, but 3 times!! As a matter of fact, I am the only person that received the correct meal.    Tim received the wrong thing.  He ordered oatmeal and got a parfait.  Then when his oatmeal came out, it was piled high with parfait items that he didn't want or order.  We got this fixed.    Jessica's meal was super spicy.  Nothing abnormal here except she specifically asked if it was spicy because she has issues with too much heat in a meal and was told no.  At this point she ate part of my meal because we were so disgusted by this time, no one wanted to order anything else.    James's meal came out wrong.  He ordered the meat version and got the veggie.  Not the biggest deal, but with strike 3 we asked for the manager.  Here comes the best part....Our waitress is the "Head Waitress" and the one in charge.  No other managers.  So we explain to her all of the issues and she walks away to get James his meal. She comes right back to explain that it wasn't her fault, the runner grabbed the wrong meal.  She spent SEVERAL minutes blaming everyone except the cable repair man for everything that went wrong.  Now again, mistakes happens and can be forgiven.  What can NOT be forgiven is the way we were treated.  The waitress went through great lengths to blame shift all of the issues on other people.  Never once did she apologize or try to really make the situation better.  It was all about her being in the right.  I guess I feel a little better knowing we were not the only ones treated that way based on one of our neighbors hearing our plight, striking up a conversation with us about a similar experience.  We could also hear random conversations from other tables.  NOT a happy day.  Perhaps a dedicated front of house manager could solve some of these issues.  I have made several jokes since then about trying this place again. I just find it hard to believe that EVERYTHING could go so bad in one sitting.  However, I refuse to spend my money at a place that obviously does not respect the people who show patronage.

9CksVsMr2toQxSi489QRyA.text: My sister moved to Phoenix a year ago and I've heard claims that "there's no good Mexican food in Phoenix" which is ludicrous, even for somewhere who's never lived here. So in my latest effort to prove her wrong, I brought her and her friends to Otro Cafe, where I hoped the upscale take on the local cuisine would change her mind.To be sure, she seemed to be impressed by how the chorizo and vegetables made a typical queso fundido a little more interesting, and did I see a glimmer of jealousy in her eyes as she looked at my Inca salad, a wonderful quinoa mixture of Mexican flavors that was healthy and fulfilling? Or maybe the green-eyed looks of jealousy at my pork belly or al pastor tacos? Did she appreciate how the chicken soup was a Mexican interpretation of pho? I don't know, but there wasn't many leftovers.

H1bybRbFxq-IPVP84iQVJQ.text: This is one of my go to restaurant of all time. You could never go wrong with eating here. It's a spin to modern Mexican cuisine!! You can taste the authenticity and quality of ingredients used in there cooking! I love eating the tacos, I've tried every kind and they are amazing. The vegetable Padilla is fantastic! And not to mention they serve pancakes made from scratch that are to die for. The salsa is used for chips and salsa are perfect. There is sometimes a long wait, but worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

I28DaeN35Q1QcYfzoIWcng.text: It's good to know that the cuisine of the now defunct Gallo Blanco can still be experienced in this cafe. It's also a great place for happy hour. The atmosphere is casual and relaxed and the staff is friendly and efficient. I think my main grouse is that the tacos are made only with (wheat) flour tortillas - which is a shame because a lot of people, myself included, prefer street tacos with the traditional corn tortillas.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Inside the cafe

1M8uCPmZSAAYaOEyDwTXsg.text: Love, love, love this place! Been eating there since it opened. Honestly, one of my favorite places to eat breakfast EVER! Killer Mexican breakfast plates (couple of fried eggs, beans, chorizo and fresh tortillas) and their pancakes defy logic...divine really! They are just so good! Some of the best pancakes I think I've ever eaten at a restaurant.  Weekends can be a little crazy and sometimes, AS OF LATE, I get the feeling they are running short with waitstaff. Servers aways appear to be running all over, cant seem to keep up and having done the whole server thing myself in college I feel for them. I know that look :/  Management: You guys need more servers on the weekends or expos - food runners, anything to make things run smoother and less "the sky is falling" for the clientele. Been there 2 Sundays in a row this month and felt service was slipping a bit. I truly love the restaurant though and the quality of food is top notch!! The ambiance is cool and the location is on point. I will keep eating there no doubt...just get more servers already!

5Nz50POVL-EU47GDutQx5w.text: The food is SO good, and unlike anywhere else. BUT every time we have been here the service has been terrible!  A couple of months ago, we found a piece of plastic in our burrito. Of course they offered to make a new one, but both our waitress and the manager made us feel like an inconvenience to them. No apology, no nothing.  The wait staff is not friendly, rude sometimes even. We would come here so much more often if we didn't have to be ready to accept that we would have bad service.  Fix this issue, guys. Match your quality of service with the quality of the food. (Minus the plastic burrito)

4Xqg33kr7gvcbloR9g3MUQ.text: BEST tacos you'll have in Phoenix. Drinks are always good and service is friendly. One of our Go-to places in town.

pkTZL6LC4jb5edEHW0ZN_w.text: Exquisite food. Also when I told them I had a gluten allergy the head chef came out to tell me exactly what I could and could not eat!!!  Awesome. That and so much is made in house. You will never find a better Mole sauce or vanilla ice cream!  I highly suggest trying them. In addition to that they use Lux's coffee!   You will be sad if you don't try it!

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

LMdXlNYDbbaDefV_l-xVeg.text: Otro, as in visit "otro" (other) restaurant. Cute place, but so disappointed with the "authentic" Mexican food.   AZ Margarita- a short glass filled with lots of ice for $9  and not particularly tasty    guacamole - eh, I can make tastier guac at home. Nearly $8 for a small dish  Ahi Tuna Agua Chile- $12 enough to share for two as a light appetizer. I was excited for this one... but was completely disappointed after the first taste. I had to ask for a side of limes an doused it with salt to try and give it some flavor, but it remained insipid. We didn't even finish the dish because it was not worth eating.   The Carne Asada Burrito-  UHHHG. My plate came to the table and I could smell the distinct scent of that plasticy processed store bought tortilla. From the get-go the store bought tortilla smell was going to start this burrito at mediocre level, but then the taste ...:( It tasted like a chili-cheese hot dog. $9 and I didn't finish this dish either.   The only thing that I liked were the chips and salsa, and those were free :)  Although the chips and salsa were good, nothing else would lure me to vising this establishment again...not even for Happy Hour.

ftuI5Yru4pQw_SfdSa2nqQ.text: Four stars respectively. Second time going to Otro and this time the time in which we got our food was longer (25-30 min) with it being at maybe 60-70% occupancy (inside more than outside. Outside was about 4 groups of people including me and my guest). Had an interesting experience with the GM. Other than the wait and that occurrence - the food is on point and leaves you feeling satisfied (not STUFFED and not hungry). Perfect portion size plates. I had 2 different plates size coming to Otro, the consuela del sur and the Chilaquiles. Both very delicious. I haven't had their cocktails, but have a good selection of spirits and wine selection. Being a beer guy, the draft menu could be improved.  Take a trip here! Worth it!!

0NA4BoubY2frbeaopCvoWQ.text: Hugely overpriced and overrated "authentic" Mexican food. Service was awful. Waitress hardly came by our table and had an attitude when she came. We watched our food just sit there for five minutes without anyone noticing it was ready.  Ordered the chilaquiles with chicken and the chicken was extremely disgusting. They gave me the worst piece of chicken meat ever, I literally gagged and spit it out. Even more appalling was the price I paid for a simple Mexican meal I can make for the same amount at home and feed four people. I seriously wanted a refund after eating that shitty chicken.

rOW6GcQn4h2s6tfZ6tbgfg.text: We used to really love Otro Cafe, but it's been steadily declining and after our last visit, it's unlikely that we'll go back anytime soon.  The service was absolutely awful.  We waited as several servers passed us by and I had to ask to order my son's food and all of our drinks.  We waited again and had to flag someone down to order.  Our drinks and food took an excessive amount of time to arrive, and something came out with an error.  The manager held a staff meeting during the breakfast rush, and we watched as an entire staff of folks gathered by the hostess stand while we were waiting for our food with empty drinks.  Not once did a manager visit our table.  It was a very disappointing experience to say the least, and sadly I will not be recommending Otro Cafe anymore.

REP1qDbQQjhQ00O-6SVlSw.text: We sat at the bar and the food and the service were amazing! The chicken in the tacos was fabulous and the trio enchiladas were delicious. We will return!

iU_xw4U8Giy4o5p7IqMhqA.text: Fantastic margarita!! Seriously amazing and fresh...no crap ingredients like sweet & sour mix.   The food though...meh. I had the Del Campo omelet and it was nothing to write home about. My husband had the breakfast burrito and said it was decent, but he wasn't overly impressed. The food took a while too...like a long while which was annoying b/c we had already waited so long for a table. It was around noon on a Saturday and we waited like 30 mins for a table. Funny thing is, no one was ahead of us. We were next to be seated, but no one was leaving the place. Not the restaurant's fault...just annoying. Overall we were at Otro Cafe for like 90 mins. We just wanted brunch and to be on our way, but instead ended up hanging out way longer than we wanted to or planned on.

wHhpoDA4fYNeJrcorttWxA.text: We dined there last night.  Ordered two glasses of wine and it took forever and they brought the wine with our food and that served cold.

iTJDfp1wwy2FKhOXKOMlFg.text: I've been a regular customer of the Otro Cafe since they opened and have always enjoyed their food and the customer service was typically spot on. As of late, the customer service has gone way down hill, so much so, I will no longer eat there.

wr2FH96QginiIgGLlAOIJQ.text: It's hard to compete with Gallo Blanco (my wife's favorite restaurant in Phoenix) and Otro, the sister restaurant, doesn't quite live up to its predecessor. But it's still a solid choice and a good substitute if you live in the north central area like us.   So far I've had the carne tacos, carne torta and chicken enchiladas. The first  two feature very tasty and well-cooked carne, and I especially liked the torta. The torta comes with onions, guac (more of straight up avocado really), and a killer aji aioli. Simple and perfectly executed.  They also have very good chips and guac. Again the guac is more chunky with solid avocado pieces but I don't mind that at all. The margaritas hit the spot and I would expect nothing less from the Gallo Blanco's "Other."   More recently I tried the enchiladas. After I ordered, my wife reminded me that she had gotten them before and wasn't a fan. I have to say that I must agree. There's no cheese on top, which perhaps is the more sophisticated way to go, but I could barely taste the cheese on the inside. The tortilla itself was kind of soggy. The sauce is more of a salsa, somewhat spicy and fairly tasty, but nothing to write home about. The side of black beans was my favorite part. They were very good, but the beans should never be the best part of an entree in my humble opinion (Latin Americans, including my wife, may take offense to that though).  Otro doesn't have the funky charm that Gallo does, but it's coming along. There's a mural on the outside wall of the adjacent building. I noticed on this last trip that they added booths, which makes it feel more put together.   Overall, a good place to get some good, fresh Mexican food and a well-made margarita.

PT4cwFj6ap29L2iGoqTwlg.text: This place has some pretty good authentic mexican food. We had the pork belly, Carne asada, and conchita tacos. The tacos were very good. The only reasons I can't give five stars is because the tacos are a little over priced and the service was slow and unorganized. I would still recommend going here though because they have great food!

EwjL7xJiMRCi5GXgRn29gw.text: Love this place! The Otro salad is one of my favorite salads. The chicken soup is also delish! The Paella Mexicana and the Pollo Asada are wonderful too. Tacos are street tacos and yum! Have a Poloma to cool off in the Phx heat.

E3XHWOlf_7IWs3io3GyPZA.text: Had the pork burrito, the flavors were nice but the pork itself was not tender and also bit into some grisly fatty pieces 2 times.

dz0OocU7-moXaZLXPycu3g.text: This was a great place to stumble upon for breakfast with a modern Mexican twist. Busy place, lively atmosphere and friendly wait staff. Will try this for dinner as the dinner menu looks very good.

SzHfPR-fbFTy7iOO0tvIHw.text: Best taco al carbon i have ever had! The tortillas even speak for themselves! The atmosphere is relaxed and its located in a culteral part of town. I also recommend the bloody mary.. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fun culteral views!

XksuzIJb5TkrQwYJ296JXw.text: just so everyone is aware...otro is not responsible for towing any cars! the landlord of the complex is doing so. i  over heard the customers in the lobby talking to staff. I enjoyed my dinner and will be back.

fZL1LvTMKoWTnIXBVQNH8g.text: Authentic Mexican Food w a organic twist!    You can always judge a Mexican restaurant by their salsa & tortillas- this place makes both from scratch!   Doesn't get any better - stop by and enjoy some real Mexican food in the valley.

eHuJiY2f2OdDkhCtIiXXFg.text: Loved it!  Service was fantastic, the patio was pleasant, and the food great. I got the chilaquiles rojos.  They are spicy, which I loved. One of the best I've had.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chilaquiles Rojos

ExkmJontRZQHKigKvp65Vg.text: Had breakfast on a weekday with my 2 year old.  The service was fantastic, and the food even better. I had the BLT & A and my little boy had some banana slices and a cheese quesadilla.  He is a brain cancer survivor and is learning how to eat again (is fed through a G-tube) and is extremely picky.  He loved the quesadilla!

uPc51AcwqMDwt8ELGvTvWg.text: If the food wasn't so excellent I would've gone with one star. Your best bet is to place an order by phone, wait an hour, then go pick it up.  The service here is TERRIBLE!  We have dined in here four times.  Two of the four times they messed up the order and had to redo it.  One of the four the server didn't even put out order in for over an hour.  The last time we were told 10-15 minutes for a table, which was acceptable.  The patio was completely empty, which I asked about a few minutes after putting our names in. The host rudely responded, "You've only been waiting 6 minutes, I will tell you in ten minutes if you have a table". 25 minutes of waiting and we got a table.  When we got seated the host commented "See, I told you ten minutes".    Generally the staff is very kind, it just takes forever to get food.  I would highly recommend the food. Either order it for carry out, or bring a board game to pass the time.

hqNEz7M8s6NSGD6xn4TPAA.text: Food with flair and flavor, good atmosphere, easy parking, overall a good experience.  First of all, it's a very comfortable place.  Lots of natural lighting, an open design, large booths, and plenty of space.  I brought my tablet with me and ended up staying for quite a while.  The staff were friendly and attentive.    I ordered the half serving of the guac and chips.  Really nice flavor overall and the chips are the harder, fresh kind that I usually get at a local Mexican grocery.  The ice tea (can't remember the name, but similar to passion fruit) had a subtle taste to it which I like.  Sometimes people go overboard with flavoring tea....  I got the carne asada taco and the carnitas taco.  The carnitas came with pineapple which had a nice balance to it.  The carne asada was good as well and the fresh, hot tortilla made everything kind of melt in your mouth.  One note:  The meats weren't particularly hot so I'm guessing it was scooped from a bin.  It probably could have used 30 seconds on the flat top.   I went during Happy Hour and each item was reduced by $1 so the total damage was $12.06, or $15 with tip.  Plenty of food (and refills) for a very lazy lunch day.

dX8tzhXdjhT2S9YGG8ZrNQ.text: Holy Moly! My dream breakfast turned reality! Great menu and cute decor. Very good service.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy!

3CILGCQLpcCzaO8AO_9Qow.text: I saw it listed as one of the neat new restaurants to try in one of those Phoenix magazines and figured it might be tasty. And besides, as a southern california native, I'm no stranger to good Mexican food. Let's just say I was blown away.  The chips and salsa at a buck is a damn good deal, but you may opt against it if you have a small appetite and are worried about filling up.   Before you correct me, I'm well aware that this is not traditional nor authentic mexican food. Infact, it's pretty obvious from the moment you walk in that it was never the chef's intention to be traditional or authentic. It is truly the work of a visionary that produces such culinary magic.  On our first visit, my girlfriend opted for the Inca salad and a carne asada taco while I went with the chicken paella. The salad is delectable-- the many greens and herbs dance on your tongue and the satisfying crunch of the quinoa keeps you wanting more and more. The carne asada tacos are phenomenal-- better than any I have ever tasted from the most authentic taco stands you can think of. Salty but limey....i dont know how but it was just amazing.  The chicken paella is excellent. The many vegetables, the tenderness of the rice and the perfect amount of seasoning make it a very savory and satisfying dish without being greasy. Just. Damn. Good.  That's not to mention the cool vibe here. Servers are friendly, (if not a bit frazzled at times) and the artwork is neat and modern. Just come here, it's worth the trip from anywhere in the valley.

x1vrUhXyI1BTn0omK93LvA.text: I'm from LA, where the Mexican food is top notch, so I'm always a bit skeptical... They did give our party that had reservations a weird set up of tables, but wow, food, servers, and atmosphere were great. I had their tacos and horchata, and both were good- the carne asada taco wins out of the three I got. Also, most of the group got prickly pear margaritas, which were a fun color and a good kind of interesting 8) on the small side, but still worth it.

yp9zZrSbMyPGb3KpVSq5lA.text: The service was great along with the food.  The breakfast burrito was huge.  Will be back for the paella!

4hD33byTdGee5qow3jeR1g.text: I haven't had a thing on the menu that hasn't been seriously tasty.  Their take on Vietnamese pho is great, the salads are super fresh.  The fact that so many of the ingredients are seasonal and  locally sourced is a plus.  Keep doing what you are doing!

UQifx-tEd_jElwiX5tPJ9w.text: I work around the corner at sun devil , and I have to say this place is absolutely amazing!  The food is so tasty and at a great price. The only problem I am having now is what to get for lunch when I go there everyday for the next month haha!  Great staff as well !!!!!!!

4U4jB-dnlswufU27i3pR5A.text: OMG!!  So very happy that we stopped here!  The seafood ceviche is delicious with fresh avocado, cilantro and a good portion of shrimp!  Everything tasted so fresh!  So did the fresh peach tart which I took home with me! Loved it!  Everything , bar none, was amazing from the service to the atmosphere to the food and beverages!  I do not have one negative thing to say...the pork belly tacos are divine and the red snapper was good too.  The carne asada tacos were also amazing.  The young man who served us, Tikka,was so pleasant and very attentive.  He knows the menu and was able to guide us in our decision on what to order seeing it was our first time there.  Thank you Tikka!  You are so right about Otro Cafe being a "gem" because we felt lucky to have found you!  The music was awesome and everyone dining in there looked happy...so did all the staff!  Tikka is definitely a keeper!  A great experience; worth every cent.  We will be back!

JoDzCLWqCAEH3eDCR4_mnw.text: A friend told me about this place and so I tried it.  I had two tacos and chips and salsa.  The tacos were very good.  The service was very friendly, I sat at the bar.  The interior was very open, clean and very cute.  Looking forward to going back.

1s9Ccy4w_d9-iTm8lwJbDQ.text: Great service tonight. This is one of our go to restaurants because the food is consistently awesome, but the service is usually hit or miss. Thanks to Reyna for making it a hit tonight.  As for food, the guac is on point and the burritos are perfection. We will be back again...and again.

PVI4rFAS5fj80vZrQonkCg.text: I really wanted to like this place... But there are so many things wrong with this place, as well as the ratings I saw here (which led me to visit the place and be disappointed). The service is so slow. The waiters left me sitting there for at least 15 minutes before they even came to ask if I needed anything. I get they're trying to do a modern take on Mexican food, but seriously the food isn't all that. The rice is too crunchy. Like extremely. But I guess that's what "modern Mexican" cuisine is. The mole is far from tasting good. I would say that the tortillas tasted very good and freshly made. I like the ambiance of the place, but I expect more bang for my buck. Sorry

j3E89PumiUgxqddoioe55Q.text: Second time in a week we had problems at Otro.  The first time was lunch when chicken was added to a salad.  The chicken was like rubber and had to be taken off the salad.  The second time was last night, June 11.  Ordered dinner for 4 and only 3 dinners showed up.  A salad was also ordered with fish.  The fish was ice cold.  Our server in both cases took the inferior meals off of our bill to Otro's credit.  However, as one of my favorite places, I hate to see what appears to be a disjointed effort resulting in substandard meals.

pnRqHO1b4X5hHmWQSzkLoA.text: Love the carne asada burrito. This place offers a great assortment o Mexican style food with a bit of a twist. A definite must try if you are in the area.

cmjYYR-65fwjYVbcERjw0w.text: Went there for breakfast for the first time. Our food was so good (except they forgot the escabeche from mine and I asked for it especially).  Would love to try lunch and dinner next  it got busy and our service slowed down they could def use more help  Although very friendly overall

XnbJr6smlIemlkSvUBYHCg.text: Brought a large group for lunch.  Had high expectations based on Blanco.  Food was good, service was a let down and overall experience was disappointing.  Start with good - Food was original, tasty and plentyful. Now the not so good - No soda.  I am not a big soda drinker, but most of my party was.  Only tea and water was available and refills were slow and without ice.  Food took over an hour to be served.  Chips and salsa helped, but the crowd was hangry.    Product, service and decor were lacking which are usually signs of a new business.  These guys have be open for a while and have experience with other restaurants.  Disappointing.  Won't return.  Sorry.

htQbwYJe8AHQUB0uEN5qxw.text: Delicious, fresh food and very friendly service. I've become obsessed with this cool little spot since discovering it a few months ago.

TWVE94CGAutuK6VFCN3Kyw.text: I love this place, I came here for breakfast and lunch, my favorite places for delicious Gucomole and tacos and torta.

xe2LBNs0oQxIElScilHQJw.text: A friend showed me this place. Just far enough from the craziness on Central to not be crowded but still has the same vibes. Love their cocktails and their fish tacos are quite tasty. Also have a great carne asada burrito. Solid guac. The servers were very helpful. I will be going back very soon. Love that this restaurant is going to be a part of the development of Central Phoenix's restaurant scene.

5pW_6R_Xc4EX-WDlMXViGg.text: Very dependable, great local place to eat.  With all the new paces starting to show up on 7th Street, it is so nice to come here.  Always good food and service.  The guac is great!  Get a large order to share at your table.

KfNeV3PuYNeEwJOCgPd5pQ.text: This is not your run of the mill Mexican restaurant.  It is along the lines of Cocina del Sol in The Quarter--meaning chic and upscale.  All their dishes are done with flair and I would say that the quality of the food is a cut above basic Mexican food.  We had the guacamole and it was excellent.  I was disappointed that the chips were too thick and not that tasty and they didn't have the kind of salsa that I typically want with chips.  There salsa was creamier and came out of two plastic tubes.  The margarita was good but not outstanding.  If you want a healthier, higher quality version of Mexican food then this is your place.  However, there are times when I simply crave plain ol' Mexican food and this wouldn't hit the spot.  You decide!

crInQIAMkKHfdxadC0epuA.text: HH  daily from 2-6 several menu items are $1 off including the very tasty carne asada tacos and the guac

lwInYPtM4M2jfAftXk-xlA.text: We've been to Otro many times. Stick with the tacos or the chorizo and egg dishes.  They are consistently delicious. The margaritas are good.  The guacamole is good and sometimes excellent and the chips are crisp.  We have had one bad experience there but the situation was immediately addressed by a manager and the bill was graciously adjusted.  Service is usually excellent and the atmosphere is cool. Sit at the bar and watch the bartender make drinks - it will give you an appreciation for how hard thy work and what goes into some of their drinks.  Didn't care much for the paella but on the whole we like just about everything else.   (Sit away from the west facing windows in the late afternoon as it is hot!). This is a perfect place for a casual dinner. The background noise is low so you can enjoy conversation and the food.

C411dlr-kAiX6BZVVPuR7A.text: Good spot for a late night weekend dinner. We came at around 8pm. Cool vibe, lovely decor. I love that they have the same elote corn on the cob appetizer as Gallo Blanco, it is the thing that I crave most from their menu. Hubby was very pleased with his torta, which I believe was stuffed with barbacoa meat, and I had the ensalada de la casa, without the meat, because I am a vegetarian. No problems there. The only problem we had was the service - it was a bit lackluster. For a restaurant featured in Phoenix magazine I would have expected a bit more, but it won't stop me from coming back.

3Vh-klXnDq24l1Tl8GBEkw.text: I met up with a friend after work over here at Otro Cafe. We sat outside since it was so beautiful, since the hot summer days are no fun to sit outside! We shared their quinoa salad and it was so light and refreshing! We each had a 2 tacos and I had a carne asada and one shrimp taco! They were both oh so very delicious! We had some chips and guac and I loved how their green and red salsas came those plastic squeeze tubes! :) I would recommend people to check this place out!

QL33qbx5saKN40q3KY2ILA.text: I just don't get it. I had the pastor taco and it was the worst taco I've ever had. I've had street tacos much better (and cheaper) than this. The quacamole was okay  but I can make the same thing at home. The chili releno was ok, nothing special. If it just tasted half as decent as the pictures, it might be ok. Again, I don't see the 'draw' here.????

meYm6an20vVwF5IcPbYgsg.text: we started at Gallo Blanco but the place was packed so my friends suggested Otto as they are affiliated. I was not impressed! I keep a list of restaurants to try and based on Otro, Gallo Blanco is still on it but has slipped in the ratings for sure! I don't like when everything is a la carte I figure the chefs knows the menu and should pair things it also greatly increases the cost. I think it's decent but I think they think they're better than I do for sure

rwB98iYxoF2We0KzWTmvuw.text: This was an unplanned Smunch venue as we gathered where we expected to find food trucks that were not there.  It was on several folks lists to try so off we went.  Walking in with a group of twelve we were able to secure 1/2 the patio.  Most of us had been to Gallo Blanco several times so we had some idea what to expect.  Otro is quieter.  General consensus was the food was just as good if not a bit better.  I think they have a bit more freedom with spices not being a hotel restaurant. I had the trio of enchiladas with rice and beans which were all excellent with the only exception of I didn't care for their interpretation of mole.  I had to take my rice and beans with me for lunch the next day.  Because we were starving by this point I had already eaten the enchilada with the verde sauce by the time I remembered to take a picture so I didn't post it because it looks funny.   Not everybody has found Otro yet so there was no trouble getting seated at midday on a Saturday.  Service was good the entire meal.

aEkmQcdeuiqFKUAN8VXB_Q.text: The only place that compares is sister restaurant Gallo Blanco which unfortunately closed down a while back. Best Mexican food in town.

Ex5cSfGMInchKMdGZrJ1lQ.text: Cute place.  Clean and fresh looking. Went there for lunch with a colleague. Ordered the table guacamole. It was good but I prefer my own home made. Also had the shrimp tacos with vegetables. Both were very flavorful. Service was prompt and friendly. My one criticism was that although we ordered an order of the guacamole to take home to my colleagues husband,  the order want 1 placed and we didn't have time to wait longer. I will definitely be back

AXydCZCDuN6_D0kRB-rtbQ.text: LOVE IT !! Inca salad and Asada Taco thats all I got to say !!!! Best Asada in town because they use rib eye meat so dam good !! And the Inca salad is one of the most amazing salads I have ever had!!! Service is also very good !

F_UsVPmSZHnHlqo85XogDg.text: This place is very noisy. You can hardly hear the conversation you are having with the person sitting next to you. I ordered the carne asada torta. Very good. I've never had such fresh, soft bread ever. The meat is prime rib diced with a hint of sweetness. A good serving. The chips are delicious and the salsas are amazing. The red salsa is smooth with a roasted flavor, with a bit of kick to it. The green salsa is spicy and so tasty. I like the idea that they are served in a bottle that you squeeze. My husband ordered the carne asada tacos. Also very delicious but too small. He had to order another serving of two. The service was exceptional. Wished they had this restaurant on our side of town (Peoria, Az)

_YMY9-ax78qUyunIDU22_A.text: Not only is the food delicious, this is the kind of place that will happily cut your corn for you. Literally. I ordered the paela, even though some cranky old bag wrote a review that it was 'subpar'. Personally, I think it was the best paella I've ever had, served by genuinely happy and efficient people. They were very busy, and since I'm not an idiot, I was prepared to wait. This is my new favorite place.

eK9IyPR89ooi5JqJZc2Ajw.text: I looked up the spanish word "cojeta" this morning because I read that Otro puts "cojeta" on their pancakes and I have been craving the flap jacks for weeks on end. Cojeta seems to be carmelized goat milk and in pictures, looks like one of the most delicious liquids on earth. So, I rushed over there to see for myself.   If you were to compare a pancake to fabric, these would be 100 % double ply cashmere and what a buy for $7.50.! I was worried when it said on the menu, 2 flap jacks, because while being a small female, I have an enormous appetite (so I'm told :)) But they filled the entire large plate and that glorious "cojeta" was crisscrossed all over the top and seemed to soak right into the pancake. There was a large dollop of creme fraiche on top with some cooked peanuts sprinkled about. Hands down, these were the BEST PANCAKES I have ever had! Melt in your mouth perfection!

qzMjUpp_dL0qZ6IW6dL7fg.text: I would have done 5 stars but service was lacking. Food was amazing! !!!! I will be back for the food with in mind the service needs some improvement. Nice people though....friendly staff...

l66mXW9neZ6qpVZ8V3I6oA.text: Good food, but inaccurate wait time and they need all their space for patrons (too small for live music, use the space to serve food!).

BJUZvPE3L0uT_TWC8gPVuA.text: Just ordered a takeout and things have deteriorated somewhat. Prices have changed. The Paella used to be $9 now its $13...the web site still says $9....but it has not improved 50%! I asked for extra tortillas....they gave extra chips. I gave them $20 and had to wait 10 minutes for change. Who doesn't have $6 in the cash register at the end of lunch? The last 3 takeout orders have all been wrong...check the bag before you leave! Looks like management is getting a little slack. Its lovely inside and convenient for Nth Central Phnx so I hope they get back on track quickly. When we eat in there everything is fine....they just drop the ball for takeout.

RBHTVbbFyRm8IpMatBLhgg.text: My husband and I loved this place!! We use to go to the Gallo Blanco in the Clarendon hotel but they close that one and this is suppose to be the sister restaurant to Gallo Blanco. We Love the food and the environment. I can't wait for them to open Gallo Blanco again!!!

t3Zrvl9b0T4TRDWNLEpn6A.text: Stopped in for lunch at Otro today and was very impressed!  We started with the chips and salsa and my friend had the Elote Callejero, which is a corn on the cob dressed in mayo and cheese.  For my entree, I had the Inca Salad with added grilled chicken.  It was delicious and there were so many flavors happening in the salad.  It was very refreshing!  There was actually too much chicken for my taste probably and I would have enjoyed more of the quinoa in the salad.  My friend had the carne asada torta, which she really liked as well.  We both ended up taking half of our huge lunch portions home.  Both of agreed we would be back!

X2a6ki4tb-7sdV5V8wo_qw.text: I'm very picky when it comes to tortillas. Specially flour tortillas. I was born and raised in Northern Mexico, so I have plenty of experience when it comes to "authentic" flour tortillas. I can honestly say that Otro Cafe's are the best I've ever had in Phoenix (in 10 years of mostly disappointments). Everything I've had in this place has been delicious: tacos, paella, queso fundido, chilaquiles, and... THE FLAN!  Service has been great and it's a nice atmosphere, will definitely come back many times!

6JzzJMHSLn1XvajJM8e_jQ.text: Food is excellent as usual, but the last few times we've been here I've noticed the service is slow and inattentive.  We had to flag down a waiter to take the drink order 15 min after being seated, and the restaurant is not crowded.  Understaffed?

_TgWoIauOPNN8ae1eV75WQ.text: the worst ever i had such high hopes. never ever again.  service sucked, guy was dirty from the previous evening*queso fundido failed*ceviche de camarron was 80%jicama super sad,  i wanted this to be our new spot. screaming kids running around out of control! ended the night apolozing to my date promising to make it up on the next

msTTHNbbsBUZestPAHvpWg.text: This, my friends, was a delicious surprise in a nondescript strip mall just north of Bethany Home on the east side (I like to know where I'my looking for a new place.) Just goes to show, you really cannot judge a restaurant from its exterior. Went there today with a friend and almost thoroughly enjoyed every Mexican morsel. The House salad was chock full of fresh lettuces, cabbage, herbs, carrots, corn nuts, dried peas, cheese, and eggs, finished with a ranch-style dressing. I could have eaten the entire salad, not wholly certain if that was a function of day after carb-laden Thanksgiving, fresh off a long hike, or it really hit the right notes. Followed this with the veggie chilaquiles and the sauce was a brothy, spicy symphony of flavor. Paired with crispy tortillas and perfectly cooked eggs and I knew I would be back. Solid five stars.   Not content to leave well enough alone, we ordered the coconut pudding topped with a generous serving of shaved chocolate and the lime tart. I like some contrast of textures in my food and these were too much creamy softness for my taste. Next time, we'll explore more of the appetizers and entrees.  But we will be back. Way to go Otro!

pMEY67FcqB_AzYKNMDWPmg.text: Awesome food!! Great service!! The huevos rancheros was one of the best I've ever had!!

lIfMlZclEIKy3hbi60JHyA.text: We came here for brunch.  The omlet I had was delicious, even though it had peppers that were not listed on the menu. The service was pretty hands off, but with multiple conversations going it wasn't too noticeable. Will try it again for some of the yummy looking lunch options.

OCJL6zP_XszlBDmUWzhcyQ.text: Mediocre at best.   Came here for a late Mother's Day lunch with my husband and son. The place was fairly packed so we took it as a good sign. I ordered the trio enchiladas and my husband ordered a carne asada Torta. We were craving tacos as well so we decided to share 3 al pastor tacos. Service was incredibly slow. Yes it was Mother's Day but we had arrived at around 1:30, a time when most of the crowd was dying out and the place wasn't even really packed to begin with.   We waited for about 30 minutes for our food to come out and were very disappointed. The black beans had no flavor whatsoever and the rice was also pretty bland. None of the dishes had enough meat. My husband said the torta was okay but did not taste like carne asada. It was mainly bread and hardly any meat. The same with my chicken enchiladas. They hardly had any cheese or chicken. I just kept cutting into tortillas soaked in sauce. When we tried the al pastor tacos.   We saw they incorporated pineapple chunks into it. Again, hardly any meat and most of it was pineapple. They should have been called pineapple tacos. I didn't mind the pineapples in there, but my husband picked them out.   I feel that sometimes, places like these try too hard to be different by changing something that really works into something totally different and disappointing.   Over all, I would not come here again. It's overpriced, bland, Americanized food with not so great service.

T-BCB4x699G7DcSAsLdmJg.text: Have been a big fan of Otro Cafe ever since discovering the restaurant an few month ago.  I have had the Steak and apple salad twice and it was excellent both times.  I was impressed with the quality of steak on an $11 salad.  Also, the guacamole is a must order every time.

ibC4C0HxmNlJ7fAdyb2rEQ.text: This was our first time here but I have been wanting to come for a long time so I had high expectations, unfortunately (or not). We had the chicken chillaquiles, Pork belly taco and the Mexican breakfast with a bottled coke and a mimosa to wash it all down. The best part of our meal was the pork belly taco.  I'll come back to it...  the chilaquiles were not traditional but more of a glorified layered light and crisp tostada.  It was ok but nothing  write home about. The Mexican breakfast was also ok-good but the chorizo didn't have the strong spicy chorizo flavor to it and the beans were just soso. If you're looking for less than spicy chorizo, then this is your place. Now to the pork belly taco. Heaven. If you're a bacon lover than this is one you will want to try. It was perfect just the way it came out... it was 80% fat but it was seared just right, and the flavor was awesome. I almost felt guilty taking a bite. Even with all that... I would definitely be back to try the other items on the menu. The atmosphere was busy, loud and lively... somewhere to meet someone and feel a part of the world. The most disappointing part was that the flies seemed to enjoy the meal as well. I'll write about our desert later as soon as I enjoy it!

jG8Jc69vZTqXREFo19IzUw.text: When I pulled up to this place, I broke my first rule of dining:  Never eat at a place with more wait staff than tables with customers.   I found the food to be between 3.5 to 4.5 stars, depending on the dish, enough points to earn my revisit. However, the customer service was below 1 star. I read similar reviews stating the food is great but the service sucks, which couldn't be more True. My interaction was with one waitress in particular who forgot our drink order, then forgot our food order, then forgot to bring us chips and water (4 times she mentioned she would get the chips before they actually arrived).   For food, I recommend the carne asada tacos which were delicious. I would pass on the nachos or anything that requires chips to eat since they are not freshly prepared.   For service, I recommend not coming at all. Maybe.. Maybe get it to go if it is offered. But I can't stress enough how bad the service is to warrant a 1 star review    Thank you for reading.

GdniSO0Ht5Mv9RGVIIeqdQ.text: Amazing food! Chill but Trendy Atmosphere. We had the elote appetizer which I still dream about, the guacamole and carne asada burritos! Everything was fresh hot and delicious. One thing to keep in mind if you don't like spicy things ask for regular salt around the rim of your margarita the chile salt was too overpowering to me especially after a few sips when the salt would fall from the rim into my drink.

b2qsBfp69JYRP3LG9uCDbw.text: A few months ago someone told me the best chips and salsa and guacamole was at some Blanco place at The Clarendon. I went there to find that it had closed. I was told the chef went over to Otro Cafe.  I eventually found it and went in to get some chips and salsa. First, they neglected to tell me they didn't actually have salsa. They had a green Chile salsa and a Chipotle salsa, but not the typical chunky salsa with tomatoes and such. Second, somehow the chips were stale, yet the bag managed to leave grease stains on my counter at home. The guacamole was good, though. Most people put too much garlic powder in their recipe, but this was just right.  I haven't tried their menu yet, but for the price I paid (like $8) for stale chips and not salsa, I'm not sure I'm willing to venture a night out with friends to overpay for  food that may or may not be quality.

MgIhEj80fosWBIN0wtFdKQ.text: Great atmosphere not the biggest place but the food and drinks are very tasty and unique. The tacos are excellent and so are the drinks. try the carne asada taco!!

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Elote corn with mayo cheese and spices
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos

9uUXk3lM9Ah2SayaVi067Q.text: four of us went there today for lunch. very bad experience. we were given menu's by our wait person.  we ask about drinks and prices.  we could hardly understand the wait person.  we ordered drinks which took a long time to get.  ask about daily specials. they didn't have any specials.  the menu indicated it was a brunch menu.  this is friday.  the menu was very hard to understand. this restaurant is supposed to be Latin, Central American or a combination of such.  I asked about Enchiladas for lunch and was told that everything is cooked to order and Enchiladas wouldn't be available. the wait person was trying to explain other items but she was to hard to understand. it was very exasperating trying to order lunch. so we just decided to leave. we had one ice tea, one beer and two drinks. $27.00. this is a truncated version of our experience.  We will never go back. waste of time and money.

6lrcMHXbSc8fHyDhEWNUZg.text: Quick rundown:  Friends, husband and I were in town.  We found Otro Cafe on yelp.  The pictures looked amazing.  Sat on the patio, it was beautiful in mid-March.  Everyone loved their food.  There was a quinoa salad that my husband couldn't stop raving about.  I found my most perfect combo on the menu; egg, steak, avocado in a torta.  I don't think I've ever been so happy at a brunch spot.  Server was nice, even though she kept forgetting the guacamole that we ordered as a starter.  Problem was quickly resolved when she took it off the bill.  Next time, I need to partake in the drink selection.    Overall, a great spot with a really diverse and well-done menu.  I will definitely return if in the area again.

ObT72FJ030YCpkRUETgFSw.text: I'm really loving all the local businesses that have popped up around this area. My brother had us go here for dinner with the family to we had a chance to check it out. We went in on a weekend and sat right down. I loved the interior and had a nice modern Phoenix vibe to it.   I ordered the enchiladas trio and after a couple bites I could tell the similarities to Gallo Blanco. Turns out I'm NOT a fan of Mole winch was one of the 3 enchiladas but the rest tasted good. Oh almost forgot, ordered the guac with the chips and salsa, such a good idea their guac is so delicious!! Of course just like Gallo Blanco they have the squeeze bottles of red and green salsa and of course my wife and I emptied a bottle.   Overall good experience, quality cooked foods, and good prices for a local trendy restaurant.

N_eD_QfKUgNxS_w05jNSog.text: Great food & cocktails ... Really really slow service & they forgot our appetizers  *had the quinoa salad w/ seabass ! Yum.

NWZ-fB0v2OMYSrVvNflRnQ.text: Best chilaquiles in the Valley, so much flavor. Diverse menu with many selections to satisfy a broad range of pallets and dietary restrictions. They are happy to modify dishes to meet diner's need's, and if they cannot due to a allergen they recommend alternatives and substitutions. I'm so happy this gem is located in my neighborhood.

5yYSDgISBb4_jUtMQT-RMg.text: Food very good, cool design. But, the place echoes loud, music to loud and its super hard to have a conversation with people your dining with. Major flaw in this cement box.

or19AXQC0yI8Y01LdF162w.text: You know that feeling when you go to a restaurant and you don't want to give it a bad review? Well, today is one of those days. The food was sub par. We had ordered the guacamole which was pretty good. My fiance ordered the carne asada tacos which were better than the al pastor tacos I ordered. Mine were bland and dry.   Our waitress however was on another planet. She was one of those waitresses who tried to impress you by taking your order but not writing it down. I have to admit, I do get impressed when waitresses do that, but I'm not impressed when they swing by 15 minutes after taking our order to make sure she remembered it correctly (this was done throughout the night). I also got annoyed how they would offer to bring chips but never did and we also waited forever for our food that should have only taken 10 to 15 minutes to make. FYI: the restaurant wasn't even busy, 8 people were there max on a Monday night at 7:15pm.   Being a foodie, I really dislike writing bad reviews but if I hadn't had such crappy service, or didn't have to wait forever for food that I had ordered, I think I would have had a better experience.

aubG5IosGItsiIqbwm5znw.text: I think their flapjacks are my favorite! I highly recommend. Chorizo is good too. Bloody Mary is satisfying although I'd prefer spicier and less dill.   This is my go to place for margaritas. Friendly service, clean and trendy environment.

toDIkjHSA9Ja0iRDczGrCw.text: Came here after a recommendation of a friend. It's nothing big, I ordered a burrito and got exactly that. It's not your typical Mexican restaurant like those you see in the corners. You can tell that the cooks and staff take time in preparing great and unique Mexican dishes. Came here on a Sunday not knowing they had a happy hour plus our kids ate free?! Guacamole was perfect and their care asada burrito was like nothing I've ever had. Will definitely be back.

jv81vXoxLYDDJQmJhoHIyw.text: Always can count on delicious food even when I try something new on the menu. My favorites are the chorizo burrito, shrimp taco, vegetables and margaritas! The margaritas are tasty and strong so don't plan on having more than two.   Service is excellent. I'm a huge fan of the server Ashley- charisma for days!

QSeXtYlbip_hNVEv-xLRaQ.text: Not a bad place for some chic Mexican. Cool atmosphere and the food was pretty good. Ordered a regular margarita, nothin mind blowing but tasty nonetheless. I ordered the enchilada trio and my advice is to sub the mole third for ranchera or verde instead. The mole sauce is so overpowering and there really is no way for me to explain it. It almost ruined the rest of my meal with the lingering taste and smell. It comes with a side of beans and rice which were both not your typical Mexican sides. Had fresh veggies and mushrooms.  Our waiter was either hungover or new. Would definitely go back to try something else or would be a fun place to grab drinks and tacos with friends.

ClsUiHTv57lwIrB7YD_riA.text: Good food, but not great. Gallo Blanco was better. But the problem with this place for lunch is that the service is really slow and inconsistent. And it appears that the issue is the servers, not the kitchen. I would recommend going if you have no time constraints and want better than average nuvo-Mexican fare!

IHHs-GBSx0exW6MnWhq_GA.text: This little place has turned into a local haunt as the food is consistent,  fresh and delicious.  Try the fish or shrimp burrito and it will knock your socks off!  I have had other breakfast type foods such as Nortico and the smoke salmon is fantastic.  Each time I go here I leave, feeling satisfied and looking forward to coming again.  Give this little place a shot.  It is worth your time and money!

XbJ5EpOHsnG5qh_W_ARyNQ.text: Love love the atmosphere and food!!!!! Such a great place to come with friends to catch up! Deff recommend

5iF9KZJAeYgmduf14NpgaA.text: I've been here a couple of times already and I love it.   Otro is a Mexican food restaurant they have everything from tacos to burros to favorite Mexican breakfast dishes. They are more modern, but still stick to the basics of Mexican cuisine. The atmosphere is really nice I love how open this restaurant is.    Their customer service as always is great. Hostess is very nice and waitresses and waiters are nice and helpful well.
