Last time I came here I brought my in laws for some good ol dinner as they were visiting from home (California). We ordered guacamole as our starter and they loved it. For dinner I ordered the black mole which WOW! That dish is amazing and huge you can totally share it with someone. I am SUPER picky with mole (I was surprised I even took the plunge and ordered it) this one passes the test lol. If you love mole please order this!   My in laws ordered the steak plate and chilakiles and they both loved it. "This hit the spot" we're their exact words. I also ordered the spike watermelon drink (highly suggested ladies lol) all of their aguas are super delicious! A must try if you love authentic Mexican aguas.   The only downside I had on my last visit was how long it took for us to receive our dinner. They did apologize and I notice they added a discount on our receipt with out us even complaining, so thank you for that we highly appreciate it.   All in all great place to stop by and grab a bite and a few drinks!    PS: flan! If you love flan do me a favor order one you can thank me later!!!

z8RHhMQmpnrhMkSBsDcuRg.text: #OtroCafe is an amazing restaurant. Their food is usually top notch their customer service is fantastic.   This time around the pinto beans were served a Luke warm and the eggs were a little bland. I gave my honest critic to our server and she apologized and comped the dish I ordered without us knowing until we looked at the check. We didn't do that to get a free meal, but she went above and beyond what was expected. She got a pretty nice tip.  All that to say, Otro Cafe is Awesome! We highly recommend it. Make sure to try their flapjacks and the tres leches cake. You won't be disappointed. God bless!

smpJSR7YoHaGMx18ZFALVQ.text: The smell sucks you in. The service and food keep you coming back. Good menu with huge selection. A go-to place for me.

HvSFdqEMeNwpqP48nh8PqQ.text: My brother and his girlfriend took us to this place and told us the food was good.  I left saying the food was amazing.  I had the best thing I had ever eaten on my trip here.  A pork belly taco.....  I wish I had only orderd these, it was that mouth watering.   When we walked in the place was busy, not an open table in the joint.  We were greeted with a hello and a smile.  Within minutes we were seated and ready to order drinks.  I had an awesome mexican michalada (like a bloody mary mexican style)...  They had crafty cocktails to choose from or several craft beers.  We had the fresh gaucamole and chips for an appitizer.  We all orderd tacos.  I had the Chicken and fresh mushrooms which was great.  Then the ultimate taco ever.... PORK BELLY....  this is a must if you have never tried one.  Im in love!  I am already planning another trip to this place, but this time for a 6 pack. Great atmosphere, cool vibes, friendly staff, great menu selection, wonderful food.  This place is killing it.  You are foolish if you live anywhere near here and have not eaten here yet.  Im coming back and I live in Wisconsin..... Best thing I ate on the whole trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork belly tacos are the best ever and chicken and mushroom
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Me n my bro
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Drink on playas

0eJNL3k8f17An5PAf0nRMQ.text: I just found one of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix. We were recommended here by two different friends and it did not disappoint. We started with a local craft beer and the AZ Margarita (no salt) which was yummy. We then tried the Mexican street corn which was sweet, flavorful, and I was tempted to lick the plate. Then we ordered some street tacos; the carne asada, cochita, and chicken. All were very good but we liked the sauce on the chicken best of all. From there we tried the pork belly taco which was amazing! My Fiance ordered a flapjack because hey, why not, and it was fabulous (reheated nicely the next day too!). The featured fish was sea bass so I ordered a fish burrito which comes with their amazing guac inside. As if we hadn't ordered enough food we took home a slice of the banana cream pie that they had on special and devoured that later. Great service at the bar, wonderful happy hour menu before 6pm, and delicious and fresh food options. LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this place!

WntJ9KrvfKoIY6oMVbCCuA.text: I was looking to try new breakfast spot And I have been to Gallo Blanco but they are only open for brunch but they have this sister restaurant, So I thought I'd try them. I ordered the Chicken chilaquiles With both red and green sauce. Also ordered a side of beans. The Chilaquiles were more of Tostada, Two layered hard shell tortillas with chicken in the middle and eggs on top. It was very good and my only complaint would be that the BEANS were from a CAN, they were awful. Those were NOT fresh beans at all. I would NOT order the beans at all unless you like can beans. The Agua the Sadia was super sweet. It was some type of watermelon syrup at the bottom of a glass with water on top. The syrup and the water stay separate so it looks cool, but you get a mouthful of SUGAR from the bottom of the glass through a straw. I would not order that drink either. Too many other spots in the Valley I would go to before this place again.

7I7Jd-7O7m_gRVEDoCmi5Q.text: Otro cafe had absolutely the best chorizo and eggs in town. The pancakes were absolutely amazing as well. Best breakfast platter! The service by Collin was outstanding as well.

1V9vB1qzjwIh6n4RAaY4og.text: I am hoping this was just an off day. Waited about 15 minutes for a server to come over, 20 minutes for a mimosa. After an hour food came  and  the waiter didn't seem to care in the least bit. Plan on terrible service if you come here.

4KoBwO5t-0moEtszzcpvgA.text: This place is near our house and so we have tried it 3 or 4 times. We've never had a good experience - stupid us kept trying. Last time, we walked into a restaurant that was about half full. Several groups were waiting. We stood at the hostess stand for slightly less than 10 minutes. Practically every single employee walked by, yet not one acknowledged us. Perhaps they could just post a sign that says: Customers NOT welcome.

l7-vcdgZ8KIfqXnkYkpNJQ.text: Great food and wonderful service!  Our waiter Rick was terrific!  Between al of us we ordered the Guacamole, Pica Rica Burger, side of chorizo, Bistec Al carbon, Paella, another burger with bacon, and salad.  Also got the Tres Leches for dessert!  Everything was delicious!

arltnBTmbxAYc6fvRxB5hQ.text: I loveeeee Otro!  The carne burrito is to die for. Like, so good.   The pancake is the best I've ever had. GET IT!  Love their street corn and guacamole as well.  They used to have a pork belly burger that was amazing but I think they took it off the menu.  I don't love their happy hour or drinks. We got a Margarita a couple times and its literally a cup of ice with a tiny bit of margarita. My boyfriend drank his in three sips.   Service can be spotty or slow- but if nothing else, order take out!!

e69WbmtD1z4Tzy0O-_Zjtw.text: I came to this place on a Saturday nite, and I was really looking forward to dining @ this place since my girlfriend was bragging about how good it was. Well, overall the food is tasty but not much of it has been served. The portion are small and everything seem to be ordered a la carts. The price are reasonable and the service is good, but I'm still hungry. They also run out of couple brand name of beers and when I ordered desert, that was also out.  It seems I have to stop somewhere on my way home for take out.

Bys4WCm4f0YrnxAx97tlwA.text: When Gallo Blanco closed my boyfriend and I were totally bummed as we would go there at least once a week. Then we heard about otro cafe also having the same owner as Gallo Blanco so we decided to check it out. We were very pleased. There are plenty of healthy options on the menu in addition to the usual Mexican style fair. Miss the fire roasted salsa they used to serve at Gallo blanco but many menu items conveyed over.

cq2tMnEOFG0W_psR9l-EGw.text: Saw the billboard on south east corner of 7th street and missouri and decided to try the brunch out. Have driven past the place many times but thought it was a True cafe and there is little curbside appeal that drew my attention. Walked in and to my dismay the place far from a little cafe!  It is big and spacious and buzzing. 15 minute wait to be sat at a table so we slid on over to the bar. Greeted by the bar tender and drinks in hand within minutes. I did not know a thing about the restaurant or its theme so bar tender filled us in. Same owners as the amazing restaurant that use to be located at the Clarendon hotel called Galo Blanca ....  Otro cafe has a great feel and neighborhood vibe! Food was great, service was great and experience was a delight! Put this on your list of places you must check out!!

E4jv8dTTj4gsq-UTv3i-IQ.text: Delicious!!  Started with homemade tortilla chips and two sauces--orange (?habanero) spicy and green(?tomatillo) mild. Loved the squirt bottles for each (chasing salsa around a bowl with a tortilla chip has never pleased me. Only issue is salsa dried and crusted on tips of squirt bottles is unappetizing and possibly unsanitary, and should be cleaned off. Also, server could have been more attentive about clearing plates.   Guacamole was clearly freshly made, chunky and delicious!  Pork belly Burrito was stellar. Crispy not-too-fatty pork with beans, cheese and picked onions. Wonderful grilled tortilla wrapper.   Try the al fresco dining in the cute back patio!!

fpfEhzPdeMHEAtlHD7IeoQ.text: We came in for a late night date night after working. My fiance and I had only been in once before separately but neither of us really remembered the place! A co-worker recommended it as a great place and then I recalled being there for lunch years prior. First, we came in and the place was Happening! Live music, dancers, large groups grooving on the music & entertainment!! Our server was polite and courteous with great suggestions from the menu! Our drinks and food came quickly with attention to presentation as well! Amazing flavors! Fresh ingredients and a enjoyable evening! Thank you Otro! Job well done!!

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tasty beans too!! But not too many!! Ha Ha!
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best Rice I have ever had at a restaurant!
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My fiancé enjoyed a trio of flavors!! I had bites and it was a party of flavor!

IzNXfscPiPsbxXinDv7cIg.text: Hardly worth the effort... Stopped in after hearing a number of recommendations. Post lunchtime on Saturday. Came in through the back patio. A quick survey: 50% capacity in back, inside the bar was practically open 100%, the inside was about the same. Decided we would hang in the back. Asked Toots to grab a menu. My brother asked the gal in Spanish which table we could sit at. She said to check the front. We thought 'no problem, there is no one here'. Then some angry Beta male came in and told us we were out of line and that all of the tables were reserved except for the one right next to the exit. Which I would call BS. We decided that this place is worthless as it seems they want people of a 'particular appearance'.  Don't waste your money here, go to Harvey's Wineburger and get a real Man's meal. Besides, the ambiance is way better.

6s6snTmHSlEigtngqlr3eA.text: I refuse to give high ratings to any Mexican restaurant that charges extra for their chips and salsa. The chips were good the salsa average. If I go again I won't bother to order chips.  That's the bad. The good is I had a chicken taco and a shrimp taco and they may be the best tacos I've ever had. Absolutely delicious. Then we had dessert. I had banana cream pie. Outstanding. My sister got the flan and it was delicious too. Never had flan that good.  If they gave chips and salsa like most other Mexican restaurants I've been to they would get 5+ stars. Really good food.

XbXCBHoXYc5ZNj54Mqguqg.text: A little bummed that we went here at 9:30pm and I was half-asleep and not hungry.  Green veggie enchiladas: pretty alright. The texture wasn't quite perfect - it probably should've baked in an oven another 30min or so - but this is the first place I've been where "vegetable enchiladas" were literally enchiladas containing vegetables, not a tube of cheese with sad spinach bits.

5GMrS1hzw5OuD0qc239iOw.text: For a couple of years, Otro Cafe was sort of a "holdover" for my girlfriend and I until Gallo Blanco reopened back up - considering the two restaurants are practically adjoined at the hip. The food is similar, although not quite identical, as she is always quick to point out.  Honestly, I like Otro. Yes, service can sometimes vary greatly, which will probably impact your overall enjoyment. And based on some of the reviews I see, it seems to be a common complaint.   But in terms of the quality of the food they serve here, I feel that Otro is a respectable little restaurant that offers up tacos that have a nice balance between traditional and modern. My favorite being the pork belly, while my girlfriend swears up and down that the carne asada isn't anywhere near the level of what's served as Gallo. I don't think this is a quality issue though, it's merely just different preparation methods.  Starters of guacamole and elote are both decent, as well as beans and rice. In fact, there really isn't anything I've ever had here that I'd call even remotely close to "bad" - which says a lot.  What really surprised me about Otro, however, is their burgers. After spotting their pork belly burger on a recent "Best Burger" list, I decided to give it a try. I was actually very surprised, as the quality of virtually everything in the burger completely threw me off, despite being fairly simple. In terms of finding a good burger, who knew that I'd find one here of all places?  Otro's flapjacks, which can either be ordered in dessert form (cajeta-style) or as a side with syrup and butter, are pretty much identical to what you'll find at Gallo. They come off more like crepes than they do pancakes, having a very eggy texture to them. Me? I like them. My girlfriend? Not so much.   Okay. So, I still think Gallo is better. But guess what? If I can obtain a well-rounded meal of starters, tacos (or a burger), as well as a flapjack for dessert, I see absolutely no reason to not give Otro a solid four star rating.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Flap Jack

tLgnLJhlBrtuEyYK3FkqoQ.text: Everything is fabulous here! My favorites are the chorizo burger w/papas fries (best French fries ANYWHERE) and their shrimp burrito. I'm buying a pint of their red sauce because it's over the top AWESOME!  Any restaurant that can hold onto their employees like this place is a good omen  It's always busy, even in summer! That's the mark of a great restaurant.

UIZl1Lyt80aTf53cxozm4A.text: Fantastic ribs, yes, I said ribs. This is a Mexican restaurant serving up some pretty good ribs! Fall off the bone, goodness, right there!  Hubby got chicken pho! Hahaha, yes, ribs, pho, spring rolls, enchiladas, tacos, and tortes, are just a few of the menu items! Evidently the owner is  Vietnamese, and  Mexican, needless to say, you get the best in both worlds!  Service was great. Our server was awesome, and gave us those great recommendations!  We were served tortilla chips, with no salsa, so we ordered some guacamole, the chips were thin and crisp, guacamole was fresh and flavorful. However, they do not have salsa or pico to dip your chips, However you do get a really good Verde, and a spicy Chipotle, served up in squeeze bottles, to squirt onto your chips and food.  The drinks were really great as well!

cKinlRLgXYkJPV1Cz_TmDA.text: This is such a wonderful restaurant, the food is excellent- on point!!! The staff is great, the ambiance is perfect.  Seriously the food is great!

9skFiD8lJBW04Kh3briyZQ.text: FOOD: the food was super yummy. The carne Asada tacos are good and the normal barbacoa taco was really good! I was not a super fan of the fried barbacoa, it just lacked flavor in comparison. The chips and salsa are also very good.   SERVICE: the service was very good as well, the server was attentive and made it feel more authentic.   ATMOSPHERE: it is a very romantic atmosphere, it is a great place to go on a date!   I would definitely recommend going here, idk if I would've stopped in randomly off the street if it wasn't suggested to me, but I'd definitely give it a try!

XOG7anrbRIhvAaIUim0kCg.text: This is a pretty mainstream nouveau American cafe. Not a greasy spoon or family style Mexican. Healthier cooking practices and newer interior. Spacious seating. A little loud for talking.  Food good but nothing special. Prices are reasonable.

ahDa8AAomZXIumfJgv7tBg.text: Ours was a large Fathers Day brunch group, 13 in all. The food was very well prepared but the service was a mess. Lengthy waits and food delivery mis-coordination were experienced throughout the meal. We ordered chips & guacamole and the chips were delivered 15 minutes before the guac. By that time most the chips were gone. Two in our party didn't get their brunch order for at least 30 minutes after everyone else were served and done eating. My granddaughters were splitting an order of pancakes, something I wouldn't think could take 30 more minutes than the chilaquiles.  Most of this rests on the kitchen, but at some point I would have appreciated it if our server would have been a lot more determined to get the rest of our order out. I would have also expected the front management to have taken notice at some point but that never happened.  All in all, food not good enough to outweigh the service experience.

ru8RkuUVZiKC_AhTsLaB4Q.text: Been a little while eating at Otro, but nothing has changed.  Food was perfect.  I had the carne asada burrito. My friends had tacos and ceviche.  Perfect.   Chips and guac were great as usual.   Love the ambience as well.   Cool place inside.  Would never know it by looking at the place from the outside.

From the outside, you don't really know what to expect. But once you walk in, it's like an oasis; The lush, green foliage all around the entrance, is very inviting. There is amazing artwork from local artists, available to purchase as well. Great spot for food and drinks with fantastic service!! Highly recommend

pCZNT3eo5WGyY_9a_LfIhg.text: I love this place I usually only go for the breakfast and they make the best steak and eggs Tex Mex style..  great service and friendly atmosphere the staff is really personable and always take time to greet you upon entering and speak as you leave.. I recommend this place if you haven't been yet

QeZAfkrhiAugs4vRdw-GeQ.text: The food and service are becoming more lacking each time I go. Typically both get 5 stars but not lately... where was Reyna she is the best!

h_xpmvAFtbpQq4OUYhW7DQ.text: Okay, so I'm Mexican and to expect chilaquiles or any other dish to taste like your sisters, or grandma is a tall order. However, this place is pretty good, it's nice and clean, service is fast. Food is really tasty, well presented. My husband order more and more of their home made tortillas, gosh! So I had no other option then help him out with a wonderful surplus of HOME MADE tortillas.  We like this place, it's nice, and the food is great!  Definitely coming back, and bringing friends.

i79raKlWhi8DLWdkc_qYGg.text: Not what I expected, but way cool! Low key atmosphere, outstanding food. We go for tacos, which are phenomenal. They use a wood fire grill, mesquite I think. All the meats are flavorful, and the tacos are unique. Definitely want to try more of the menu, but it's hard to say no to tacos.

-A9dRlpJxp1A0H5bZTpUYQ.text: Always consistent and offering their deliscious offerings! Breakfast, lunch or dinner, all worth the effort and very satisfing! Wednesdays comes with live music! Enjoy!

f7AhISLvvgwT2SB0epXEfw.text: Not my favorite. Service was super slow and no one really owned us,  which didn't start us off right. This is not authentic Mexican but more Mexican with a twist. I prefer the authentic Mexican. My enchilada had red sauce on it, it almost tasted like Italian. The spring rolls were good, but the queso is advertised as GF, but is served with flour tortillas? It was more like melted cheese than a True dip.

9PdDrv9K2zy15esdxv-GZA.text: Great brunch menu and options.  Service was good, our waiter offered suggestions and was knowledgeable about preparations.

l9g782PTBzDKSIshD_gEBQ.text: Best carne asado tacos ever, omg I'm genuinely confused when people don't order those tacos.  I also love their drinks!! I've tried most and their az margarita is awesome!! I also drink their micheladas pretty often as well Of their apps, I would get the guac and elotes. Both so good! I prefer sitting outside there, they have the pretty lights so it's nice at night!:)

v4UdDfLNmsELxYSK4oVvMg.text: The food is really good however not sure if warrants the price compared to other nuevo cantinas.  I had 2 street tacos, a side salad and club soda for $16. I love the feel of the restaurant. I was in for dinner at 7 PM and it was really cold.  Almost need a jacket kind of cold. The music was really loud and a bit much for the evening.

y0bLqWiKsrp4NpsdSUYNIA.text: No Mexican servers or diners was a bad sign for a Mexican restaurant.  The guacamole was very good but the taco? I had 3:  The chicken had a tough texture. Just about edible but not good.  The Barbacoa had no flavor at all. Not horrible but why bother?  The Carne Asada was actually sweet. When I asked the manager, he confirmed that it "does come up a little sweet". Except, of course, it shouldn't!  No idea how this place gets good ratings. Awful, inauthentic food.

UuZj1ZJRQaKODzQeR2hV3A.text: Not much to look at from the outside. Otro Cafe sits snug in an older, mostly rundown strip mall in Central Phoenix. Inside proved to be more aesthetically pleasing and the aromas from the kitchen peaked my senses. We were greeted & seated quickly in a booth by a window  with a view of the alley in between buildings. Phoenix street art decorating the adjacent wall.   Upon opening my linen napkin which held my silverware I found 2 dirty utensils, dried food still attached. Our waiter apologized and brought me a clean set.   Our food was delivered promptly, Huevos Rancheros, my husband's favorite Mexican dish and a pair of street tacos; fish and chicken a la cart. The Huevos Rancheros were generously sized as apposed to my petite tacos. They were also tasty with all the right spices also not like my tacos. The chicken was scarce and had an odd, boiled texture and the fish tacos were very fishy and had little other flavor happening.   I had a draft beer & my husband a Bloody Mary which brought our bill to $40 not including tip. Bottom line? Definitely Not worth a $40 lunch.

XR72FcYBi9QVNyOVW3Lyxw.text: Nice chips and both red and green sauces to start.  Had the slightly sweet chicken mole enchilada, tried the paella that seemed to have more veggies than rice, nice flavor from the chorizo.  The star of the night was the pork belly burrito, having that crispy porky flavor was great.  Nice house margarita.

vnRlspTSqR81mDo5McO4JQ.text: Solid contemporary cafe right off of 7st just north of Bethany home. This is my second time here for Sunday brunch. Both times I ordered the Ceviche to start and Huevos Rancheros for the main course. These Mexican style dishes were good both times. Definitely more of a modern style Mexican dish for both items. The customer service fro the hostess to the weigh-tress makes everything very pleasant. I highly recommend his spot for anyone in the area. As an added bonus kids eat free and the kids plate has plenty food for any child hungry. Don't forget to order the tea!!

KdoNDt9GXcqR1noWp5ciQg.text: ** Add another restaurant to the rotation **  Wow! Stopped in last night and was delighted. We decided to just share a bunch of stuff. We had guacamole and chips, steak tacos, pork tacos, bacon torta, goat tacos, roasted turnips, mexican style rice, and roasted beets. The guacamole was fresh and filled with citrus overtones. Very tasty. The roasted beets and turnips were all locally sourced. They were a mix of sweet and tart. Never really had anything like it. Darn good.   The prices were reasonable and the service was top notch. I would highly recommend a stop at Otro Cafe. I will be returning shortly and bringing some friends.

HkPjWM1qPGSjX3NK4DmVgg.text: Otro is on the east side of 7th St in between The Phoenix Flower Shop and The Healthy Habit.  The inside is fresh and sleek with colorful art and sleek counters and tables.  They had a family opening last week and a pre-opening this week.  So the menu is limited.  The real opening starts next week.  Chef Robson is once again using his childhood experiences to create an excellent flavor profile that shines.  There is also a full bar with wine, beer, and liquor.  I ordered the al pastor torta.  My waitress brought me out two salsas and a bowl of chips.  The tomatillo salsa was excellent.  Perfect amount of lime balanced with a bit of heat.  The other salsa was red and had a great flavor as well.  My torta came out next.  It was just the right size.  Big enough to fill me up but not some gigantic gimmick of a sandwich.    The first thing I noticed was the pork was shredded with a beautiful bark to it.  The next thing that stood out was the pineapple relish that blended in the aioli and lettuce perfectly.  Sweet and savory.  I've eaten pounds of al pastor and am very familiar with chopped up pineapple and cilantro and onion garnishing but this was something much better.  It was a sweet juicy blend that was married together to compliment each other.  I added some of each salsa to give it a little heat.  The bread was soft and wonderful.  Probably the best bread I've ever had a torta with.  What really stood out is how the food tasted different than Gallo and more than held its own while at the same time you can tell it came from the same palate.  I am looking forward to trying more.  This place is about to blow up as soon as word gets out.  I say get in while the gettin's good.

7Kzv0TEc-0N8wSr0lmbr9g.text: There is no sign on the building yet, but the doors are open and the friendly staff at Otro will happily feed you!  I went some co-workers yesterday for lunch, we were one of just two tables, but I don't think that will happen again once word gets out that Otro Cafe is open, and is the sister restaurant to Gallo Blanco, a Phoenix favorite.   The interior is crisp, open and highlights the buildings natural architecture, with exposed beams and brick.  There are a mix of booths and tables and a huge patio out front that will be perfect for sipping margaritas.  After sitting down we were given a huge bowl of chips and two salsas, a red and a green.  The chips were warm and slightly salted, they were on the thick side, but still tasty.  I prefer a thinner, crispier chip, but it is really just personal preference.  The green salsa is bright and tangy, and the milder of the two, while the red one is thicker and robust with chile flavor.  My group went through about 3 bowls of each during our lunch, so they are definitely memorable.  The menu is limited right now, but they plan to double it after things get rolling.  It has a unique blend of modern Mexican dishes along with familiar items, like tacos and guacamole.  We tried the Mexican Paella, which had great flavor, but the chicken was a bit on the dry side.  We also tried the El Pastor tacos and the Tacos el Carbon.  The tacos are served on homemade flour tortillas that just melt in your mouth.  The pastor was very flavorful, and I loved the addition of the pineapple for a bit of sweet, it really elevated the flavor.  The el Carbon tacos were served with a chimichurri sauce that was also flavorful.  We also orderd a small side of guacamole, which for $3 was huge and some of the best I have head, definitely the best value on the menu.  I really enjoyed my meal and can't wait to see the menu expand and grow.  One of my dining companions said that they prefer the tacos at Gallo Blanco, he liked that meat selections better there...but I pointed out that these are sister restaurants and not the same....so they had to change up the menu a bit!  I think Otro Cafe is going to have great success, the food is delicious and it is located in the hot 7th Street corridor...I will definitely be back.

tDWDL7JOyEmESwCT6CphKg.text: Okay, so you walk in and you can just feel the similarities to Gallo Blanco. The only difference really is the atmosphere is a bit more "evening time" and a hint more romantic. I have been here about 5 times now and each time I go I enjoy something new. The menu is varied to the point where I feel like I have room to breathe in all the excellent smells coming from their expo kitchen. I have tried the chicken, the salmon, various tacos and a few specials. The food does not ever disappoint. The only issue I have is sometimes i like being spontaneous and on the weekends, this place can get busy and you have to wait... and wait... and wait... if the bar was more than 8 seats it would make things a bit more relaxed. But that's how he likes to do it... small, casual and cozy... so I'll still go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

LQQa8_Te3WQ4TM1AYlFSmA.text: USED to love Otro. However after an awful experience with service I'm done with them. I emailed the owner to give him feedback on my poor experience. He promptly responded. His response was apologetic and positive. He offered to send me a gift certificate for which I was very thankful. Great way to redeem yourself and your business to a regular guest! Well..... Not so much. A month went by and no gift certificate. I contacted the owner again and was told "sure! We'll get that right out to you."  A few weeks later and nada. As I scroll through reviews there seems to be MANY issues with service. Get it together Otro. You've lost someone who loved your food. Too bad so sad.

lm2EDWgsuVwsyTOuGtD1MA.text: I've was needing a couple of margeys and some delicious chips, along with some sibling hang time with the brothers.    We got there early (before 6) and were greeted warmly.    The drinks were tangy and cold and the chips showed up quickly.  Fresh, hot, salty chips were just delish.  Love the green tomatillo sauce but the other sauce seared my tongue.  I am no lightweight when it comes to spices but, holy cow, I had to give up!    We ordered the corn and the guac and they were really fresh and yummy tasting....mixed together, they were just sublime.  I had the shrimp tacos, brother 1 had the veggie torta, and brother 2 had the polla asodo.  We had great service and, even with a very generous tip, made it out of there at about 23 bucks a person with drinks.  Some suggestions:  (I won't quibble about wait times...I know you're getting up and running).  Bring a variety of sauces to the table.  We all agreed that our food was kind of naked and this is a great opportunity to expose diners to more of your delicious recipes.  I didn't get any sauce on my tacos and distinctly remember that as being the best part!    Expand the menu a bit to include more appetizers (sorry, but I just dig the Chicharron de Queso for the novelty alone).  The neighborhood is starting to fill up with Mexican joints so this will help you stay competitive.  Lastly, do a little sound dampening; you won't need much but this will help since it's heating up outside.  We'll all be back,I'm sure.  Smooches!

1GTk_2ptZnmAqNqE-22SGw.text: Chiliquilles were very tasty. Fried corn tortillas moist chicken with 2 fried eggs on top. Coffee from Lux. Quick service,  a good mix of people.

7dwUqdUbpajRhZJv6DrlwA.text: I love that more and more empty storefronts in strip malls are being re-purposed. And especially when a new eatery goes in, right?   Otro is the brainchild of Doug Robson of Gallo Blanco fame (another awesome restaurant in Central Phoenix) and showcases his amazing talent for preparing Mexican cuisine; but don't expect Otro to be a clone of Gallo Blanco. The space has a lot of exposed brick, and lots of windows/skylights. The kitchen is open to the dining area and there is an atmosphere of urban energy, yet comfortable and unpretentious.  A friend and I met up at Otro for lunch, and we both ordered the Asado Chicken Salad. This is not your average greens with sliced chicken breast....boring. This salad was packed with flavor. The spices on the grilled chicken was so flavorful, but not overpowering. The greens included spinach, shredded cabbage and romaine. There were chunks of apples which added a great texture and complimented the chicken. The dressing was a peanut vinaigrette which added another layer of flavor.  This is definitely a place worth returning to, either for a weekend breakfast, happy hour or dinner!

87vry2lixZUv_hVpSn14ww.text: This was our 7th or 8th time here and it was great again. The bistro al carbon was perfect. Just the right temp and oh so good. The vegetables were also perfect. And no complaints either about the homemade tortillas. Sorry there was no room for desert. It's a ride from where we live but oh so worth it!

eEwsvwOAMuG6lEH_Eo7Rhw.text: Any place that offers vegetarian tacos that utilizes chef choice vegetables laid over hand made tortillas wins!! The tacos were remarkable in flavor and the prices were excellent!!

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

uiLSzlV5O84etZVganRRZg.text: I called the restaurant at 500pm and made a reservation for 3 at 800pm. We showed up at 800pm and they said they did not have a reservation for me. the hostess asked "are you sure you didn't call Ohso?" ummmm yes i'm sure. I showed them the number i called and the hostess said that it was correct.  She then said "well sometimes my manager doesn't write down reservations if we aren't that busy." (okay....) They were not busy at all so they were still able to seat us. We sat on the patio, which is pretty standard for a restaurant patio, but there was no music so the ambiance was a little weird.   We ordered drinks and an app to start and the app came before the drinks. we also had no silverware or napkins. i asked the waitress but she never returned with them so i just stole them from another table.  We had the queso fundido with chorizo which was good.  I ordered enchiladas, husband had mole, and my friend had carne asada burrito i want to say. my enchiladas were really spicy, which was unexpected. i had the red sauce (red or green you can choose). i ate half of one and some of the rice and beans. Way too spicy.  Husband said chicken mole was okay. my friend liked her burrito.  The waitress didn't keep up well on drinks, water, clearing plates, but she seemed like she had a lot of tables. I had the flan for dessert which i thought was pretty good.

vxwNLiBhdPv4lAB2fXVZwA.text: We went here for brunch today. My husband and I shared:  * Chilaquiles Rojos Chicken or Vegetables layered tortillas , Oaxaca cheese, red ranchero salsa  Inca Salad - Single 5 / Share 9 Quinoa grain, fresh corn, dried cranberries, pepitas, Yulu seeds, tomato, arugula, mint, basil, red onion and lime with a herb vinaigrette  Plus got the guac.   Fresh and delish! I don't normally post on Yelp, but this place is new and we want it to stay open! It was one of the New restaurants listed in the Phoenix NewTimes magazine.

XZZJ5XUn4gCe8E8i85i43g.text: The mole chicken was so disappointing I would never return to this restaurant for anything else.  There was a half bone-in chicken stacked in the center of a very small plate with rice and vegetables on either side.  The chicken would have been hard to cut as it was stacked in pieces with no room to put part of it on the dish- it was even harder to cut as it was tough.  Cutting gently the vegetables and rice went flying off the plate. The mole was more like a heavy glaze painted on the chicken after it was cooked and it was hard to tell what flavors were even in it; it probably would have been better to cut the chicken in small pieces and actually cook it in the mole.  The rice was seasoned with spices I had not tasted before and had an unpleasant flavor- didn't seem like a Mexican food recipe to me.  The vegetables were mushy and unidentifiable.    We were given lunch menus at dinner time and it took about 10 minutes to get someones attention to get dinner menus.  The music was so loud it was not possible to have a conversation during dinner.  The server did an OK job but not good enough to give this place more than one star.

8cqGCrNxDGY1Te8ZjGpF_g.text: Stopped by here last Sunday with the boyfriend for a late brunch.  I had the huevos rancheros and he had chilaquiles.  Both were amazing!  My huevos was served on fresh made tortillas formed into a thin quesadilla.  The sauce was fresh very well seasoned without being over powering.  The salsa they serve with the chips is fresh made in house daily, and you can taste it.  The V8 for my bloody mary was also freshly made, with a great flavor (not too tomato heavy, not too spicy, just perfect with lots of fresh herbs).   I am pretty sure they put crack in the food here. So yummy!  Now stop reading this a go EAT already!

ETxVpHvRqmh7RFqlobFFbw.text: Great food! I've been here several times and can't ever decide what to get because the food is so good! Some of the best dishes are the Naco Torta, Shrimp Ceviche and the El Flacco Torta, not on the current menu, but they will still make it for you!

TQjm9Wvm3T3LJW2hw8wQxg.text: Oreo cafe is great. Though I must say I believe the location at Clarendon may have been better.  But, this place has great food also.

nrfXNBAIh_lygP_2YHW-ag.text: I think this place has great potential, but there were a few things off during my first visit here.    A) Don't ask if I want a water refill...fill my water...all the time, we live in the desert  B) Veggie paella sounds amazing, but was ridiculously salty...see A.  C)Servers need to help each other out and operate full hands in, full hands out.  Don't come out with the check, then come back a few minutes later with box, then a few minutes later with the check.  I think you can multitask.  Apart from these minor complaints (constructive criticism)...  The inca salad was AMAZING, loved every bite.  Chips were fair, but the red and green sauces were really good, although not very spicy.  I will definitely be coming back for the elote and probably enchildas.  All in all, this is a great space in the neighborhood with a unique menu and excellent potential.

9tj23uiJ2NUN8a8frmNFsg.text: Cafe Otro is a cute, quaint local Mexican food restaurant. The guacamole is not to be missed! It has a citrus flavor which is a nice surprise. The chips are home made and delicious. The salsa comes in those squeeze tubes which I cannot stand! It makes me feel like my hands are dirty each time I have to put salsa on each chip. I like to dunk my chips into the salsa and I can't do that here. Therefore, only four stars.  There are ample vegetarian options available. They have good salad and daily vegetable selections. Their iced tea is also very good! If you like pop, they have Mexican coke (in the bottle, made with real sugar).

Dr3k2BJSKI_y3uIS57vE5g.text: I absolutely love this place! I wish I had a picture of the delicious food I have had but I always eat it too fast to take a picture. I LOVE their tacos!!   I have incredibly high expectations when it comes to tacos being that I was born in Mexico City and visit often. The tacos at Otro are different but so delicious ! The handmade, warm, soft tortillas practically melt in your mouth. My favorite are the carne asada and the pork belly.. I've also tried their grilled fish taco and it is delicious as well! Their guacamole is delicious and what really puts the cherry on top are the chips and absolutely delicious salsas... I haven't tried too many things on the menu but honestly you can't wrong with the tacos... So that's the food.  The service is also outstanding! Our waiter never let our drinks get empty, our chips were refilled, and our food came out promptly. 5 very well deserved stars

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork belly, carne asada and grilled fish

qz8y5bxWBO7UgPrZZc7SbA.text: Yesterday was my first time at Otro. Our waiter Samson was awesome. I had the chicken soup which is served like Pho. The salsa that is served with the chips was wonderful. Spicy. I will be back.

MXwhokI1HQCME_Bg80vnbA.text: This is a fantastic restaurant! Everything is good. They have the best pancakes in the state! We drive far to get here and it's well worth it! Easy to get to and great staff!

moabtYdXG3-WbV9Dx-yrUA.text: Have eaten here twice and really enjoyed it. Both times our waiter was friendly and excellent. Delicious Margaritas.

kifZa0jc4oXaaNNnDA8AlQ.text: Huevos rancheros con chorizo was outstanding!  Get it "Christmas style."  Don't order your eggs over easy unless you mean it.  Friendly service.  Full bar.  No TVs!  Reasonably priced. We'll be back.

JfmReGv51UmTOm5Y69QvYg.text: Yumm doesn't quite begin to tell the story of all the flavors bursting in this restaurant's guacamole, salsa, ceviche, tacos & cocktails. Great date night with my fiancee in Urban Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great date night spot.

dgWUuKBSmIEKfU_7A3y0Jg.text: Aye I really wanted to like this place. We were celebrating a birthday last night and my boyfriend is really picky about food (and also a vegetarian). I literally found this place by googling "Best Mexican Restaurants in Phoenix" then going through that list and seeing who had the largest vegetarian selection. Otro Cafe won with a large option of Vegetarian dishes plus they had elote and mole, both dishes I used to love growing up in El Paso that not many restaurants out here have!  It was a Wednesday night around 8pm, the wait wasn't horrible and they had a flamenco dancer performing so we sat inside. All the tables were completely full when we first sat down so the service was understandably slow, it took about 10min just to get our drink order then another 10min to actually get the drinks. In taking in everything and asking about what vegetables they use for the vegetarian dishes, they definitely gave off a hipster vibe. The veggie list changes slightly but they had a mix of Kale, Greenbeans, onions, chili pepper, mushrooms, sometimes carrots and asparagus, either way not a list that screams authentic Mexican at all. But thankfully my boyfriend reluctantly gave it a shot.   We started off with a small Guac, nice simple delicious, as well as the Elote which was AMAZING but not worth the $7 price tag. I still highly recommend it so if you give the elote a try, after they cut the corn off the cob for you at your table...take a look at that oh so delicious (but tiny!!) little pile and think, $7 really? That would probably not even fill a little white cup that you'd normally get back in the good ol days.  We were still very hungry and anxious for the full meal and that's when my fears that the other lesser star reviews on here were right...the service was SSSLLOOOOOOOWWW! But we'll get back to that.  The food arrived and looked great! However one bite of their "rice" and I quickly got a sour face, looking over at my boyfriend he had the same expression. Worried, I slowly cut into my Chicken Mole and it was...definitely an acquired taste. Nothing like what my Grandma used to make and she's from Mexico! I tried to describe it as a bitter charcoal taste, or like they tried too hard to make it unique and used every herb and spice they could find. I scooped off little samples of the paste for everyone else to try so they could share in my sorrow and they agreed. It was way to overwhelming to eat so I just tried to make the best out of this whopping $24 dish and at least eat the chicken underneath. Even that was trying. The chicken was very dry and unseasoned, I felt bad for the person who was paying for my meal as I couldn't even finish it. My boyfriend's veggie enchiladas didn't fare any better, it was like everything was completely overpowering, unbalanced and sauces/rice were flavored to hell.   We were left still very hungry :( So we hoped to order dessert for our birthday celebration and save the night, I mean how can you screw up dessert? From the time it took us to ask for the dessert menu, get it, and the waitress finally come back to ask what we wanted it had been 30 MIN! at that point we just said forget it, it was 9:30 and by the time we would have gotten the dessert who knows.  My goodness the efficiency of our waitress was horrendous. She kept saying "thanks for your patience" but after each time it felt disingenuous considering that at about 8:30 half of the inside tables were completely empty and stayed that way.  We sat waiting for the check, for what felt like forever, I was tempted several times to just go to the front and ask someone to ring us out. Comments from the party about just wanting to get out of there left everyone anxious and pissed off on the poor wait times for simple little things, I was as well. What a sad birthday, couldn't even enjoy a dessert because the service was extremely lacking. Usually most restaurants, at a normal pace, can easily have you in and out in an hour. We were stuck there for over 2hrs!  Overall I struggled to give this place even 1star, it was mainly just on the environment w/ a live performance and that overpriced addicting elote. But I know because of everything else we won't be back. I felt bad for recommending we try this place so good luck, you'll need it!

J_jO478op0GSe_osEyrO7w.text: Rustic mexican paella prepared in an iron skillet w/ chicken, pork, chorizo saffron rice & seasonal vegetables. Really really flavorful! I love the Mexican flare to such a great dish. The guac was incredibly fresh without to cilantro. It's a cute spot with a locals feel. It will not disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

2aw7Z_1XDhK3Q0all599oQ.text: Love otros food so so much!! The food is not an issue. The service however has got increasingly bad, to the point that if it doesn't get fixed I won't go again. Last night it took the waiter fifteen minutes to even acknowledge us, we ended up getting up and ordering our own drinks at the bar. It seems like they might be under staffed? I don't know. I just know that 4/5 times I've went the server was terrible. I don't know the fellows name who served us last night, but our other server was named "Lucky". I hope you guys can fix this because your tacos are delicious and I'd like to up your rating. Rooting for you!

A60W1bdiiEkoEwnyvx5fVA.text: Best breakfast around!  If I have to eat somewhere else I always hope that the chiliqueles or the huevos ranchero taste like otro, and when it doesn't I am so disappointed.

Ms_jF3tov29DHXRr0Aq20Q.text: Man this place was one of the best breakfast places I have been in phoenix. The waiter we had was extremely nice, we got our food fast. I ordered the banana flapjacks, with a side of bacon and coffee! Let me tell you! You will not be disappointed by these things every bite left me wanting more the savory thick bacon with the sweet banana pancakes was the perfect combo! This place deserves a 5-star review because the prices were not bad, the service was great, and the food was phenomenal!

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Banana flapjacks with a side of bacon!

rRLSSbB01EKmv1etM-VwPA.text: I came here this past weekend with family from out of town.  Food was good.  Service was not.  And no real apology for it.  2.5 hours for dinner at a casual joint is just tooooooo lonnnnnggg.   Especially with a kid in tow.   I'd heard good things about Otro, and with the family asking for Mexican near their resort, this sounded like a good spot to try.  It was Saturday night, 730pm and I was met with a 45 minute wait for a 4-top table... wow.  Okay.  Probably similar to the rest of town.  We were sat right about at the 45 minute mark. Great! So we sit with our menus discussing how yummy everything looks... and discussing, and discussing, and looking at the drink menu, and discussing.... Maybe 10-12 minutes goes by and a server finally makes her way over.  She takes our drink order and we also order the child's meal and drink (best to feed kids stat).  We go back to the menu and chatting.  Server comes back a good 7-8 minutes later with drinks ready to take our order. Forgot the kid's milk, so we reminded her.  We skip appetizers due to having already waited an hour, and just get right to ordering the entrees.  Ordering goes off without a hitch and the server goes to place the order .... Or so we thought? Approx 30 minutes goes by and the server appears with food ... Not our food though. She doesn't drop it, she instead goes to the correct table after staring at it quite puzzled. Another 15 minutes... Still no food.  She comes by and says it should be right out.  The manager comes over and says "the kitchen got backed up" ... This was just not True.  We watched 2 other tables and people who came in after us at the bar get their food before we did.  Finally one dish comes out and they bring 2 of our rice sides (probably just to put some food in front of us). Couple mins later the last 2 entrees appear ... About few more minutes later the last 2 sides of beans arrive.  I forgot I was even waiting on beans.  It was 930 by now and we were all pretty tired.  Its too bad they got all screwed up, because the food was good.  But all we could wonder was what really happened with our order?  You would think they'd offer us a dessert or round of drinks, but it was pretty unapologetic. Front of the house blamed the back of the house, and that's pretty crappy.  Questionable whether I'd return or recommend Otro.  If I made my way back, I would sit at the bar where I could watch my order be placed, and eat in a timely manner with my server never more than 10 feet away.

HQOo6IwyIn1gTfEaYxm8YQ.text: My husband and I went to Otro Cafe last Thursday at 11:40 a.m.  We had heard that the food was good, so when the hostess who seemed really stressed out said the wait for food was 30 to 40 minutes, we agreed and sat down to people watch.  People watching was at least good. We waited for forty five minutes as more and more people who came in before us were seated and served.  We were finally led to a table at 12:30.  The server was a pleasant young gal and she took our drink order.  I just had water; my husband ordered water and a diet coke.  Well, 15 minutes later we got our water.....the diet coke never came.  After we ordered, we continued to watch as table after table that had also got there after us was served and paid and left. WE asked the bus boy to please bring my husband's Diet Coke----he never did.  We ended up leaving without eating at 1:30.  We had gotten no diet coke and no food.  The manager spoke to us as we left just outside the front door and assured us that my husband's diet coke was ready----not that our food was ready---but our diet coke that we had waited 45 minutes for was ready.  She said that certain foods took different spaces to cook.  But my husband replied that all he had ordered was a green chille burro and, that that is a staple on any Mexican food bill of fair and doesn't take one hour and 30 minutes to prepare.  And he also said we had seen lots of specially and elaborately looking dishes already served, eaten and paid for.  WE were really disappointed and, needless to say, will not return.

7mYEVowJTCm0enJnntoRAA.text: Our favorite place to eat Mexican food in Phoenix. Ken and the staff at Otro Cafe are by far the best, great food, fast and friendly environment. If you eat here, try the street tacos you can't go wrong!

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

KnnqUHUmU5ZJ7J5SEEiFsg.text: This is my favorite place for breakfast because Otro makes the best pancakes we've found in Phoenix and chilaquiles are insanely delicious. Coffee is good and service has always been friendly and never felt rushed. Sometimes there is a wait to get a table. Wish they had more bar space for those busy times.  There's no blueberry pancake option (my personal preference), but we keep going back anyway. Breakfast burrito is one of the best in town as well.   The all day menu has pancakes and chilaquiles as well, however the pancake on all day menu comes with chocolate chips. Depending on restaurant volume, they may serve them special order without the chocolate.  Fun atmosphere and art as well. Lots of music in the evenings. Please keep it up!!

_PsxEycsZ-HcsPXOeb8iAQ.text: Nice and quiet restaurant with nice ambience.. Very friendly staff.. The food is plain and simple.. I had the chicken Burrito and it was good.. I ordered rice on the side too.. It was really good.. The best part of my meal was the George's Drink cocktail.. Amazing taste.. Loved it..

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Burrito
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. George&#39;s Drink

Ux08loDFXrghqv_mwCfAIA.text: We came for here for dinner and had several items on the menu. We had the  steak, steak salad, grilled chicken, shrimp and fish ceviche, guacamole and several different type of tacos. The best items we had were the ceviches which were very tasy and the guacamole which was great. The other items were ok as well just not great. I feel that for a Mexican restaurant they should have a more authentic flavor.  Drinks were tasty and dessert was yummy as well. The banana cream pie is outstanding.

w7KBhowHF4JeMY1VbBtJjQ.text: I love the food at Otro! Margaritas are great too and they have a small selection of AZ craft beer too.   The back patio is relaxing when weather permits. I also cannot say how nice it is that they open for breakfast at 8am (daily, I believe!).

9pfg21DSFsNR5m4wOBsysw.text: I have been addicted to this place for the last three weeks! Our most recent trip was this past Wednesday! I took my best friend here for brunch on her birthday and again, it was AMAZING!! Food is to die for! We had the posole this time, which was super good! The best thing about our trip was our server, Collin! He was absolutely awesome! So very kind and attentive. The best they have hands down! Thanks for a wonderful service experience Collin!

jfJisWB6umBfS5pFPYPOrQ.text: Hands down favorite restaurant for breakfast lunch or dinner. The chips and gauc, top notch. Tacos? No one does it better. The posole is really good. We are always happy with our food and can't wait to go back.

zVENiRVELxW0M0b5FIJZcQ.text: Amazing tacos with flavor a-plenty, So fresh and tasty I'd probably eat twenty. All were good but my fave was the chicken, After that one was done, the plate I was lickin'.  Our server was so "cool" I needed a sweater, Paella was good although I have had better. Cocktails were delicious! Great flavor combos, The draft beer list was also pretty darn bomb(-o).  Cool interior with a nice mix of metal and wood, Nice big patio like every restaurant should. Make reservations by giving them a call, Then come to Otro Cafe and have yourself a ball!

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing cocktails. Paloma was made with hot peppers.

GFHcw9rKcfs798aSuVAxBQ.text: I don't live in Phoenix but we were here visiting some friends. This place was easily the best place we ate for the week. I'm a chilaquiles fiend and these might have been the best I've ever had.   Really good coffee. Really good horchata. My wife ordered a mimosa and it was great too.   The service was also great and there was some live music at the time. Definitely will be back when we're in the area!

slqLRxRC511YJ2ss8NWLkg.text: Went here for lunch today after 1 p.m.  I am older, and wish they would put in a ceiling to dampen the sound.  There was a large party, 8 maybe, being especially raucous, at the back and the place was very noisy.  We weren't quite ready to order the first time the waiter stopped, but then we couldn't get his help when we were ready and asked another person.  One of our party had to leave and take her lunch with her, she had an appointment.  My spring rolls and shrimp tacos were good; liked the grilled flavor of the shrimp.  Will try a burger next time, reviewers say they are good.  It was a very nice surprise to be offered a free dessert in compensation for us waiting for our bill.  The Limon tart (?) was really tasty, could've been more tart for my taste,but a nice large piece and tart enough.  I've wanted to visit here for quite awhile now, I drive by it often and will come back again.

hKPFOFJtN9CKFnRRURSanQ.text: Went for lunch again today. Later this time about 1ish. Same great food but the service was lacking today.  Our waitress was nice but she appeared to be overwhelmed and the other waitstaff seemed to be confused. Twice food that was not ours was brought to our table. Three in our party. All ordered 2 tacos each. It took forever to get our food. Only about 8 tables occupied.   I will return because the food is good and fresh. But...waiting an hour for 6 tacos is really unacceptable for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Barbacoa and shrimp tacos

TMb0EBcs36wO5Wa4OYF_LQ.text: This place is dope   Ambience - 5/5 Service - 5/5 Food - 5/5  Ordered - Vegetable taco : this is the best taco I have had in 2019 so far. Add lil green sauce and you'll enter a food coma zone. Just perfect. Morning Mash: eggs and potatoes on a house special sauce. Tasted really great. This will definitely entertain your taste buds. A must try if you are here for brunch. Cooked to perfection and spice levels are perfect. Mimosa : was okay-ish but worth a try.  Quick service, food was served hot and fresh. Made my day.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Morning hash | vegetable Taco
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu

378YkSbQB6mHCi4TP5_KqQ.text: We had mixed reviews on this place. My husband voted a 3 and I thought a 5. We took the average and got a score of 4 stars. Our waitress, Shelby, was attentive and friendly. My husband ordered a Hop Knot by Four Peaks and the pork belly burger. I ordered the Sauvignon blanc and the ensalada Inca. He said his burger had good flavor but had weird "hard pieces" in it. My salad was interesting but tasty! The base of greens was made up of a bunch of different herbs including basil, cilantro, and mint. The salad also had quinoa, craisins, pepitas, cherry tomato, avocado, and corn on it. Each bite was different based on what herb you got on your fork! Overall, I would be back while my husband said he could take it or leave it. Maybe I'll bring some friends by to try out the brunch menu soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Inca Salad
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork belly burger, Four Peaks Hop Knot - Draft

Rn3pKzs1lca3VFFv-mI_mA.text: Otro Cafe is always consistently good. Service is on point and food is delicious. I love all the fresh ingredients and options. The coffee is the best!   The chorizo plate and pancakes were ordered. I had the salmon which was AMAZING!  Everyone at the table agreed my plate was the best. Just the right size to fill me up and share with 3 others.   No alcohol this visit but I do love the mimosas here.   This visit in we had a friend from Chicago. She wasn't disappointed!

c_8AZm_ww_yX3-QwXeA0Sg.text: A very cute and cozy restaursThis place is my Sunday breakfast/brunch why? It has the best modernize Mexican food ., it is authentic the chorizo is made in there they use noble bread and the salsas have flavor , their flapjacks are delicious, and the aguas frescas are handmade in there ., i just went this past Sunday and it was full and still they didn't make us wait more than 10 min., service always very attentive .   Still 5 stars if you want to avoid the crowd come before 10:00 am ., this time our server Kenneth make sure to always get our drinks refill at all time and our food was pretty good . This place is amazing they  have very attentive employees
