9y1HAWu7vvNItLm19atumg.text: We were really looking forward to this place. The new spin on classic favorites was interesting. The vegetable chilaquile although looked pretty, left us unsatisfied. My lunch date wasn't impressed by his chicken burrito, but the tortill was spot on. The red sauce was spicy and the best thing I had. The tortilla chips were good. Although the service was great, the food, subpar.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burrito
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chilaquiles

STwx-7CXekxOMJr9SiXDbQ.text: Came back to Otro after a few years, and I'm glad I did. We dined in for Sunday brunch and it wasn't too busy. We sat at the bar and ordered bloody marys. I ordered Morning Hash and requested for chorizo to be added. It was pretty good - there was a good amount of veggies and big chunks of cripsy potatoes. My boyfriend ordered cochinita and carne asada tacos. He was not a fan of the cochinita and preferred the carne asada tacos.  Service was perfect, and our bill didn't hurt our wallets. One might compare Otro with Joyride Tacos a few streets away; I could confidently say Otro blows Joyride out of the water. We will definitely be back.

edDH2UA4LaO9LyrNQbrp2A.text: Delicious food and decent customer service! The restaurant uses local ingredients and produce which makes it even better!

EYBqMpEbOT5TyEAkih5OZA.text: Was in the area and looking for a breakfast spot, and Otro had good reviews. A nice open space with several tables as well as a few booths. We were able to get a table for 2 immediately around 9:30am on a Saturday but it was pretty full.   The brunch menu has a good selection of options for different tastes, and the lunch menu is served after 11am. I ended up ordering the huevos rancheros and my girlfriend got the granola and yogurt plus a side of two eggs.    The huevos rancheros were great. You select which kind of eggs you want on top and if you want red or green sauce. I chose green and was very happy with the flavor. The side of beans was also awesome, definitely some of the best beans I've had. I wasn't too full but content with the portion size and thought price was very reasonable.   The granola and yogurt was a large portion and the granola was tasty. There were nuts mixed in as opposed to just granola and made for a great crunch.   Our server was friendly and made sure to check up on us. I enjoyed the atmosphere although it is a little loud (god I sound old!) because of the concrete floors and brick walls. Nothing too crazy though.   I would definitely return for lunch again. I recommend checking it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sauces on table
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Huevos rancheros with green sauce.
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Two eggs scrambled, granola and yogurt

ZuOzrIeCuBd8T--G1EgqLA.text: I ordered cheese burger for lunch with lettuce wraps. I was not very happy with it but my husband and my brother in low they ordered fish and shrimp tacos. It was amazing. I definitely recommend it.  Very friendly counter service. I love the atmosphere too.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheeseburger
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

WHaU2Kej09kOCt4ApqZjBA.text: Rick, our server is on point. Fast, friendly, knew the menu and the seasonal beer on tap like it was the back of his hand.   The food is outstanding and the atmosphere is out of their works spectacular...yeah....we'll keep coming back!!!

aoFBjyhVjcA2D1At-JB0lw.text: Still a family favorite.  Went while I was recovering from a sinus thing and I'm pretty sure the pozole helped. Delish.  And when the family members who love spicy and the family members who are total wimps are always happy in the same place, that's a win!

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mole chicken enchiladas.  DELISH.

0ENmOib8cMbJx81atAIQKQ.text: My local favorite!  Never disappoints.  I usually always get the same thing.  Their fabulous guacamole is the best in town!  The soft tacos are great, I particularly like the shrimp and the barbacoa.  Have also had the salads which are wonderful.  The service is great, the waiter always remembers us and is attentive and quick.  Very homey and comfortable place that can handle large or small groups. Decor is very pleasant with local artwork.

d9bA5oSxaWVqsQ4DdFyjKA.text: I just had THE BEST TACOS!  I have come here several times over the years.  We like the pancakes and come back for breakfast for dinner.    What's so nice about going here is the friendly staff.  I am not sure there is a resto with a friendlier staff.  The menu has the usual Mexico can suspects, as this is a Mexican restaurant.  I've tried a few things on the menu and by far the stand out has to be those tacos!     The bartenders make amazing drinks as well.  I like to drink cucumber gimlets at a bar with fresh ingredients (no Roses Lime for me!).  They make one of the best because the ingredients are fresh.  Amazing kids menu too.  Return Factor:100%

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

QBi9bMgtloQGhcwLA0U67A.text: Love love love. Food great. Service great. Atmosphere is perfect. We have gone here over 30 times! Always great!! We always recommend this place. Brought my in-laws from Guadalajara, Mexico and they were really impressed. Thats saying something. Its a twist on traditional Mexican plates and more. Pancakes are amazing!! Favorite dish is the Norteno for breakfast. However All menu food items are delicious!

wIlPAgn3mOG40iYS6IMbFQ.text: If you are a Mexican food enthusiast, then Otro Cafe will definitely be your jam!  I've come here twice now for brunch, and everything we've had have been stellar.  To the perfect spicy Bloody Mary (seriously, it was pretty perfect), the homemade tortillas (to die for), and very flavorful dishes overall, I really think you can't go wrong.  Two standouts for us so far have been the Barbacoa & Eggs (slow-roasted beef served with beans, guacamole, tortillas and salsa) and the Chilaquiles (baked layered tortilla dish - try it Christmas style with both red and green sauce). Both dishes were spot on for flavor, and just good hearty dishes overall.  Shout out to our server Seth to taking awesome care of us!  He was a great mix of personal, funny and really knew the menu well. His carefree having-the-best-day-of-his-life attitude was greatly appreciated and we enjoyed being in his section :)  A++ and can't wait to come back again and try dinner sometime!

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary :)

ROx4u36MOBdIT8bwObCbAA.text: Fabulous flavors with exceptional options. We enjoyed the ceviche and queso fundido  with mushrooms- yummmy so good!!! Tacos are awesome- I really liked the pork belly one and carne asada - superb! My husband enjoyed the mole enchiladas. Definitely coming back soon. Muy bueno!!

xAwc9vjzpMciWFK3HoaNXw.text: Small guacamole is too small.  For the price, should offer more.  Street tacos are good and drinks are solid.  Been back a couple times and just booked holiday office party there.

fqRDZfBToI_bBP7-Tuk-7g.text: would have gave it 4 stars but my other over easy egg was over cooked, loved the guacamole dip, I had the Torta my lady had the fish, chicken an shrimp tacos.. Service was great, Food 4 stars, a little pricey but worth a try.. Ps liquor store next door sells cheap beer :-)  lol

mXMTc4EN6a4yHO9Sfn_riQ.text: Went there for breakfast today. Although it was half empty I waited 45 minutes without food and finally gave up and left hungry and angry.. Waitress said she didn't know what the problem was.  Who is watching the store??

FZUM6_Cq9288sTQuKhvjCQ.text: There was a friendly wait staff, and the pancakes and eggs, and guacamole were delicious. The flour tortillas were excellent, and we enjoyed the quesadilla. However, the quinoa salad was not good. The chicken was very dry and burned on one side. The chips are way too thick. The corn tortillas for the enchiladas were also way too thick, and the enchiladas were rather plain. The beans were very bland and even bitter, and the rice was just bizarre. I wanted Spanish rice but got some strange concoction. If we go there again, it will be for the breakfast food, but we probably won't be going again.

rt2syoubDrTFz-0gN9LaUw.text: The food is great, make no mistake about that. The atmosphere is cool. The kitchen is slow but worth the wait. The service is terrible. Zero customer service. Decidedly un-friendly. From what I've seen there is no communication between the host/ess and the servers. More than once I've seen other patrons come in and then walk out because no one ever came over to their table. Completely unacceptable. We tried doing takeout for a while but after more than a few missing items on our orders we threw in the towel. We'd love to be regulars here but the disappointment isn't worth it.

iohg5LWEek5Yd0NfHW8uDA.text: It pains me to write this review. Otro used to be my go to place for the best tacos in Cen Pho. I hadn't been in awhile and was so disappointed today during my visit. Prices have gone up, taco size has gone down and the service was so incredibly slow and unattentive. Their green salsa and chips are amazing, but what used to be complimentary is a charge now. Otro, it may be time for us to part ways.

y0Mh72Xc3rZa1JWPKipyWw.text: Mmm tasty ! Love the freshness and unpretentious style of Otro One visit and am a big fan!  Staff is super ! Food delicious! Atmosphere uncluttered and as fresh as the food!

VsZgOGulsm0NSQWEJ-WeTQ.text: Awesome food. I don't know how I could ever eat at Chipotle or Baja Fresh again. Got the carne asada and fish tacos and they were delicious.

3LLgFlVdeyVgNjW-CIRNQA.text: Food is very good......the service is dreadful. It is slow, surly, rude. I have been several times....the food brings me back, but think that the slow, rude service will finally keep me from  ever going back. It never changes!!!! Doesn't  anyone from management read these reviews?? Wake up......you have a good product......do something about your service.

jKPRljJTaZW8wAl8nYJM-w.text: Food was good and seamed reasonably priced, but the service was pretty slow.  Margaritas were nothing special.  It's not located close to me, so I probably won't be back.

_KTV5-w1f1WW46Q5gBLYhw.text: Gallo Blanco set a high bar and Otro grabs onto the bar here and there but cant really pull itself up to it. Terrific in spots, lagging in others, overall just okay. Kudos for carving out the pleasant open interior, but the service, atmosphere and even the food here dont consistently match the flagship. That somewhat reluctant observation hardly rises to the level of condemnation, more like mild disappointment, and is based on a handful of visits to both locations.  Servers downtown are/were hip and more importantly, sharp, anticipating needs, recommending condiments, invested in their guests' satisfaction. At Otro, it feels tenser and more transactional, like you're a tab instead of a guest. There's just less professional and personal confidence here and you're less likely to get your iced tea refilled or thanked on your way out. I realize they're going for casual, but casual should be a personality or flair, not a tangible reduction in customer service. Not in this market and age, especially not with Gallo's pedigree,   I also prefer Gallo's menu, although there's considerable overlap. Companions claim food here is comparable, so maybe it's what you order and who you are. Otro's homemeade paella had too much salt or onions, for me, and tasted more packaged than savory. I had a torta there where the filling was fine but the bun evoked McDonalds, like they ran out of better buns. The chiliquiles here is rojo and the lopsided tower tended to fall apart.   I prefer (adore, is more accurate) the expertly assembled verde downtown.  Our party agreed the  biscuit, banana and plaintain dessert was awful. Not expensive, but the least satisfying dessert we've had out in a long time.   I like the big, thick chips they serve with the guac. They pour a big glass of wine. There's quaint, thoughtful seating in the foyer in case there's a wait.  And I love any North Central spot with spacious DIY parking, sans valets. That almost feels retro now, like hitching your horse up in front of Monti's Casa Vieja a hundred years ago. You might even score a shady spot out back this summer. Orange shirt and feedbag optional.

2jOv9Z3X4C5ym20Gc2HOYQ.text: Nice little restaurant Tucktaway in the corner of the strip mall next to the flower store in the vitamin shop. The food is well done and inexpensively priced. The downside is the service. The waitstaff is inattentive. With an east west exposure having dinner in the restaurant will blind you. The restaurant does not have a shade or anything to pull down to avoid this and when asked to be moved was met with a blank stare. The chef came around frequently to ask how everything was. I would come here again... And see if I can get better service. The food is worth it.

LnuvJ8zFm6CFkcASZhk6pg.text: I wanted to like this place, but there were a few things that made the experience not very delightful. The menus are difficult to read. Very small print and nothing is defined, so it took me a while to order. I struggled to find something I would like. Nothing very traditional on the menu and most was a la cart. The service was extremely slow. I had lost my appetite by that the time my meal came. I settled on a burrito. It took over 30 min to get something this simple. I find the menu to be pricey and the Happy hour selections not very defined on the menu. I had to ask about HH, the waitress never volunteered that info. The check came and it had errors. She forgot to put in HH pricing. WTF?!. It took over 20 minutes to get the right bill. I was not pleased and it was not worth the money spent. I can get a burro anywhere, fast and hot, with rice and beans included. I won't return to any place messing with my $. Lol

VJeMOEdp60vLGOnGrytlAg.text: The Mole Negro and Paella are both excellent and this time we tried some of the playful side dishes (sweet corn dusted with Mexican cheese and smoked paprika and some snow rolls that had egg noodles, shrimp and I believe yellow beets... both delicious). The best part about OTRO is that Mr. Robson could easily charge 25 percent more for his food but doesn't. Added bonus: On this Saturday we had a stellar soundtrack provided by the jazz three-piece What's the Big Idea, which played jazzy versions of contemporary rock songs from Weezer, Pink Floyd, Muse and Guns N Roses. Brilliant. OTRO has assumed the No. 1 position on my Phoenix Restaurants Power Rankings.

nhvgqQIUQtHylb15SJ921w.text: Started off with two pork belly taco's. Then I told them to make me a pork belly burrito. No bs but these are the best tacos I have ever eaten.

hLkuspdVgAjnIiNV2qvwaw.text: Great tacos. Best I've had in awhile! The service was efficient. I enjoyed the shrimp tacos. It was fresh. The guacamole in the taco enhance the flavor!

_DOteR7AD5orOCgbeI1mCw.text: Wow!  Delicious flavorful food! Made to order fresh. Guacamole was fresh, Queso fundido was flavorful. Nice attentive staff. Had agua de pina to drink, it was light and flavorful. Our dinner was pollo asado and and assortment of tacos, my favorite was the pork belly, delicious!

CrvsJXKMJHNv_lFZjGhtwQ.text: It started brilliantly with a trio playing in the foyer while we had a short wait for our table. Great nachos and guacamole to start, followed by tasty mains and a yummy flourless chocolate cake. Friendly, attentive service, nice space and excellent pricing. A hidden gem and one our faves in Arizona.

bo9g43lQ10bfLyd9CfIi6g.text: Excellent. I could not have been more pleased with my burrito (Veggie) , my wife was a big fan of her tacos, and our daughter loved her FREE kids meal as well. We loved everything about this place and will be making frequent trips. Looked to have a great selection of local beers that we'll have to come back for as well. And our service was so good, my daughter made our server a drawing!

1QWRRGieSrxpKGtAcx-Vpw.text: Really good happy hour specials.  Had the guac, ceviche and tacos-all delicious. Chips were thick and crunchy with perfect amount of salt. Staff was super friendly and drinks were really good.  Will definitely be back.

beP1oLujBX1gqDZEcrMruw.text: Excellent laid back atmosphere. This is the type of place you'd want to visit after a long day to grab some good eats while listening to some light upbeat music.

hP_Pg0-vK3ZQLdxEKM8sOw.text: This place is amazing!!! Had 3 tacos - fish, chicken and carne asada, all equally delicious. Also had the maya margarita a side or rice and the most yummy chocolate s'mores pudding.  The place is adorable on the inside, super affordable and our waiter was wonderful.  Will come again no question.

BbezPu_v7Dsy1h8vAVzdnw.text: This spot is amazing. Everything on the menu is fresh and flavorful. The ceviche, guacamole, paella, tamales, corn on the cob, and more! The cocktails are great too!!

JT_Re1voX3gRU0nEdjqcOQ.text: This place is a gift from G-d in heaven.  Ok, maybe I'm being dramatic, but just MAYBE. The struggle for quality Mexican food in PHX is real...but this place delivers.  The enchilada trio might be the best enchiladas I've ever had.  Ill be dreaming about all three of the sauces.  Yum.  The green salsa is amazing and the Margaritas drink like water!  Fresh juice in a house marg? Yes please!  Oh and the rice- the side of rice- is the most amazing veggie paella. It could be a meal all by itself. Add in good service, friendly conversation and live music on Sundays plus Flamenco on Wednesdays and there is literally no reason to not eat here.

3byO6zH5ebC9GognsWgMCA.text: I am hooked! Tried it once on a whim and have been back at least 3 times since (a two-week span of time, mind you). The decor an ambiance here are just so-so. It's a very casual spot, and not romantic, but is great for a low-key meal or dinner with a group. Most everything served here is local and prepared fresh daily. You can definitely tell!  The Inca salad is wonderful; so many unexpected flavors. Add shrimp for a healthy and satisfying lunch. If you are ready to splurge-- the BLT & A is a MUST! It's huge though, so consider sharing it with a friend.

LMQQvZ6DIOgNaRCzLZ_JAg.text: I love Gallo Blanco so I knew I was bound to enjoy Otro Cafe. I started with some yummy guac and despite the fact that it was a million degrees out I was so utterly compelled to try the chicken soup and I'm so glad I did. The small order was huge with rice noodles and chunks of white meat in a delicous broth. The BEST thing about the soup is that they serve basil, cilantro, peppers and spicy soy sauce to season to your taste.....part of me wished it was cold and I was sick so that I have it cure me......I know I'm a sick bastard.  I finished up with carne asada and shrimp tacos (shrimp aren't my favorite, truth be told!) and a side of black beans. I really enjoyed my meal and my sever was so sweet and friendly. The ONLY thing they didn't have which I was so looking forward to was the chicarron de queso, the awesome cheese crisp they serve at Gallo Blanco. I REALLY hope they add this to the menu.  So glad these guys are here because Gallo Blanco can get crowded.

XOFNFb1RbxuEVFqxKX4ugQ.text: These people are awesome! Great food and we had an awesome experience with Ashley F! She noticed me and my fiance were showing some friends her ring and she helped us celebrate with a free dessert! She was awesome all night as well! Thank you so much! Definitely will return here often!

OEgteP5JpXHJi6_9MYDQIg.text: It's hard to find a Mexican food spot that isn't a complete hole in the wall or super expensive. Gallo Blanco and Otro are that happy medium. Good food, good ambiance, good service, good price. It was nice to finally go to a restaurant where we didn't have to shout over one another. It was nice and quiet and we could enjoy our time together. The chicken paella was awesome! I would highly recommend it. We have had the tacos at GB so didn't go that route and tried a burrito. We shoulda stuck with the tacos, they are awesome. So next time we will. But get the paella!

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken paella

1HO8DgU1F7xR4ywaGpEzmg.text: Yesss! This is our new go-to Mexican place.   The restaurant looks very unassuming outside, as it's in the middle of a strip mall, but the decor is cute as soon as you step through the door. Everything from the service to the food was fantastic. We tried the guac (super fresh onions, roasted garlic, chunky avocado, awesome touch with the white cheese on top, a slight kick), three different types of tacos (the veggie ones were amazing), and a side of roasted cauliflower (verrry interesting!).   And since no Mexican restaurant is complete in my book unless they serve chips and salsa on the house, I was happy to note the cauldron of chips arrived immediately and without prompting. Their chips were pretty standard, but both the red and green salsas were excellent. The green salsa was heavy on the cilantro, really addicting, and tasted like it was made to order. Ugh, seriously, no complaints! And the kicker... every Monday is a happy Monday, with happy hour all day and all night: $3 drafts, $1 off select menu items, and $5 select cocktails and wines.

mUYNao3W-E9wA_qgRuBb6A.text: We had excellent service.  The food was excellent.  I am a big wimp with spicy food but dared to eat something different.  I had the chilaquiles with green sauce on the side topped with two over medium eggs.  It was not the normal red-sauce chilaquiles I was used to but nonetheless, excellent.  I find  myself thinking about them, wanting to go back.  My friends and I shared their world famous flapjacks.  They were pretty darn gooooood!  I highly recommend Otro Cafe and can't wait to take my family there.

qadCXDNRT3AeSeCSsEzwNA.text: Came in to place an order to go. Both men behind the bar were rude. Young kid working to go orders was a straight up asshole And the Asian man bartending was also. It took over a half an hour to receive our food, I had my receipt thrown at me and to top it off they forgot part of our order. The food was delicious but the 2 dudes working the front were incredibly rude not only to us but to their co workers. Luckily Carlos the executive chef brought the food that the young kid forgot to our doorstep and was super polite. He may be the only reason I return.

2lnOTRm_SgHeelDMrr76Ug.text: This place is owned by the Clarendon Hotel folks.  I love that north central Phoenix is becoming a place to come eat, drink and dance, because I break out in hives when I go to Scottsdale.  We went to lunch here.  The acoustics are far better than at The Clarendon, so you can hear your companion speak.  The waiters also seem far happier to be there than those at GB.  We had chips and guacamole which was good and fresh.  Split a quinoa salad which was really good and colorful, had great dressing and freshness.  We each had a couple of tacos.  I had carne asada and al pastor; my companion the fish.  Everything was good.  The only thing that I thought notable was they told me the menu was really different from Gallo Blanco....but I found it to be very similar.  But good job!  Great location!

QjurNt8uU1MVi4xKhP9paQ.text: I really enjoyed the Al Pastor Pork Burrito. I love a grilled burrito. Added good texture to each bite. The atmosphere was nice. A cute trendy little place with live music on the day we went. Service was good and our waiter was friendly. I would definitely go back.

ny8IduPFu9Rynpja7fW1QQ.text: Sat at the bar for ten mins. Bunch of employees standing around didn't bother to take our order or bring us water...we left & we won't be coming back!

GWuV_aMcKMCd7pDMCoF8Jg.text: Really good tacos, I am a vegan and I love the veggy tacos. Everything we have ordered here has been exceptional. The guac is delish. We loved Gallo Blanco too and I am so sad they closed. Good job with Otro!

Na4IRrlMWpCrrNn9Aa-Ayg.text: This is our first time. We got there and there were quite a few people waiting. We were told there would be about a 35 minute or more wait. That would have been ok, except as I looked in the restaurant there were many many empty tables and an island with place settings and chairs set up, but no one sitting. I find that really annoying. The only thing I could think of is that they did not have enough waiting staff, or their kitchen staff aren't able to keep up when they need to service a full house. Regardless, it doesn't make for a great impression or mood when at least I see this type of situation. When we got seated we were greeted very warmly.I really like the decor, which is clean and modern.  I ordered a Sangria which was about the best tasting Sangria I've ever had. However, there was more ice than Sangria. A couple of draws on the straw and it was gone. When the server came and asked how everything was I told her I really liked the taste of the Sangria, but felt like I was spending $10 for a class of ice with very little actual Sangria in it. She looked very embarrassed, apologized, and left. The good news is she came back with another Sangria which was more Sangria than ice. You really can't ask for more than that. Now for the food. I had Paella  and my wife had lamb ribs. Both were delicious. So I'm giving 4 stars instead of 5 due to what I've told you about. But those things will not stop me from coming back. To many other things I want to try. Oh, and there is this really nice looking patio I want to sit at to enjoy our great AZ weather.

gOPU5CTESvB6zk_WuS1YWg.text: Their food is he best Mexican food I have ever had in my life. So clean and the quality is too notch. You will be very pleased!!!!

qccg06EgPnpT4jYSvbndtA.text: Chips N Salsa - pretty good Elote Callejero - decent Chicken soup - bland Citrus infused tilapia taco - not much flavor Trio enchilada - Ranchero flavor was good. The Mole flavor one was burnt and should not have been served.  Arroz fritos - didn't taste fully cooked yet it had a burnt flavor to it.  Carne asada burrito - the worst i've had at a restaurant. It was like the microwavable burritos you buy at a grocery store. Too much beans and little meat.

dZ-yyUk5lc-hJ8E0Cr9j_A.text: So we used to love otro but recently my fiance and I went there and hated the experience. Not only did our waitress forget to put our order in but we literally waited an hour and half. Mind you it was not even a busy time. We finally got our food and it was terrible. My fiance's tacos were so chatted she could not even eat the pork. My burrito was greasy and as I said no sourcream alas it had sour cream. Would have got another but that would have taken another 45 minutes. Sad it went so downhill.

KLdZzLtnASWtPZk7YjmzWA.text: This place has very fresh and delicious Mexican food.  Usually you can count on Mexican restaurants to have vegan dishes and they made it easier to find those items with a green "V" next to them and a note at the bottom of the menu that those items could be made Vegan or vegetarian.  However, I was disappointed that the menu had the corn tamales listed with one of these V's, but when I asked the waitress to order it without cheese she replied that this could not be done.  I ended up ordering a pinto bean burrito which was not on the menu, but was very good.  I did have to eat it with a fork though as it was quite runny.  We ordered French press coffee after our meal so we could sit and digest for a bit and I discovered that they do not have soy or almond milk either.

q9NhDrplxHE83yB3I9e0nw.text: This places is so awesome. From the servers to the owners.  I love there happy hour and the brunch is wonderful! Don't skip the flapjacks!

AgNjFNQzn-uLap0vozDxCA.text: Amazing breakfast food! The El Madrid and Banana Flapjacks are my favorite.Dessert lemon tartlet- best ever

Sq7N2-XtqLtlwA60alkQdg.text: Oh, Otro. We used to love your food. The service was never stellar but that seems to be the trend in so many  new restaurants.  I have a business within walking distance of Otro and we frequently order lunch to go. The Inca salad was my favorite with an amazing blend of flavors and textures - quinoa, pepitas, yulu seeda, a bit of the elote corn, cranberries and surprising tastes of mint and basil. The dressing with the accompanying half lime was a perfect complement.  2 weeks ago, a friend and I ordered the Inca salad with chicken (on my recommendation ). The chicken was half raw and I  called to complain. Whoever answered the phone asked us to bring the salads back for an exchange.  When I explained that my lunch break was over I was offered a gift certificate for  $25 to be emailed to my phone. 3 days later I called because I hadn't received the certificate.  They apologized and asked again for my email address.  I  called 4 times over the course of 2 weeks. I never got a certificate from Otro,  so I decided to walk over and see what the problem was. After much blame passing,  I finally got the certificate.  Several days later,  we ordered lunch with the certificate. The Inca salad was missing several key  ingredients and when we called to complain,  Otro asked us to carry the salad  back for inspection. They explained that there was a miscommunication with the chef, who failed to notify them that certain ingredients had run out. They offered me extra chicken and blueberries,  which aren't even part of the salad. I used to love this restaurant but after this poor treatment,  (and for the sake of brevity, I'm not including several other mishaps, including a shrimp ceviche without a drop of shrimp ) I won't return.

17qDcaTFiuihBkBZ3EnSsA.text: This place is awesome.  I highly recommend the carne Asada tacos and the El Espanol appetizer.  The green Mary was a great creative version of the Bloody Mary.  Good good food and great service.

YNRRM0scJyEmFITNmTcXsA.text: Fabulous food. Yummy tacos like at Gallo Blanco. Similar vibe. Corn on the cob to die for.

Av8nFQ6ZUbNaCQfw-n3X0g.text: I have been to this neighborhood restaurant at least a dozen times.  Its not fancy or unique, but its reliable and the food is good, plus it has cocktails!  Lively atmosphere with friendly service.  Went with one of my friends last night and we only had to wait for a table for about five minutes.  He had fish tacos and I had a chicken burrito...not going to win any dining awards but you will enjoy your meal and surroundings while having some pleasant conversation with your friends.  Oh, I noticed a sign up front that says they are open every day for breakfast now too.

pJpKnPA56c9lumk1p0GY4A.text: I am so impressed with this place!!! I was craving shrimp tacos and this definitely hit the spot! They used large shrimps that they marinated so it was packed with flavors!! And the el pastor....oh my goodness! Pork belly marinated with pineapple chunks...wow! I like their house sauces as well. We are at the bar and the girl was so pleasant. Would definitely come back. We came during lunch but I really enjoyed the atmosphere. It would also make a fun place to go for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp tacos and el Pastor tacos

MpZZvM7j1Nkjlt7VIGqX9w.text: This place is so good.  My wife and I have been here a lot since our first visit, just a couple weeks ago.  Can't stop thinking about that carne asada burrito!  Get the pork belly taco(s)!  All tacos are very tasty, but the pb stand out.  Just had the Inca salad with grilled shrimp... Delicious!  Outro does it right.  Oh... The chilequiles are just like the ones I've had in Guanajuato.  Real deal folks.  Great staff, tunes, vibe.

o-k6QaJmHB3XELaLimrzTQ.text: Food-wise this restaurant is easily 5 stars.I have been here 3 times now and have had different menu items each time and everything has been fresh, delicious, and creative.I have nothing but glowing things to say about the cuisine! Their drink menu is pretty awesome too.  The space and concept are fabulous as well....  I want so badly to be able to call this my favorite restaurant and come back frequently but I have to say the service each time has been extremely "awkward" and it took asking the server 3 times on our last visit just to get water and 2 times to make sure our guacamole order was in. Previous visits were just as frustrating-including the time we ate at the bar. In fact, we had guacamole technical difficulties on a prior visit as well..  I get that it is a loud restaurant but servers should be able to work around that and make sure they clarify orders. I have honestly never seen such a confused staff.  It is frustrating because I feel like this restaurant is on the cusp of being something fantastic but they haven't quite pulled it together. I mean any other place I would not have returned after the sloppy service but the location, premise and food are that good!   Ok Otro...I am going to give you one more try. OK...maybe 2 more tries...The burning question remains...is the end result (the food) worth the hassle/frustration of getting to the amazing food? That remains to be seen...

uGKrKhTuHcMy00thxhVJ5Q.text: This place was so great my boyfriend wanted me to write a positive review for him lol. It's not traditional mexican food but everything is fresh and they try to get as much local product as possible. The restaurant itself is nice very simple with a slight industrial feel with lots of windows for natural light. Everything is spaced out well so you don't feel like you're sitting on top of the person at the next table. They really took the time to lay everything out. It is in a weird location but that doesn't seem to deter the many people that kept coming in maybe it was the wood you smell from their grill which automatically makes your mouth water when you walk in the door. So with that here's what we decided to eat:  ensalada de la casa (house salad)- we got the big size to share and it is plenty for 2. they perfectly dress it (which for the both of us is a big deal because we both work in kitchens) and the flavors are light and meld well together for the combination of things they have in it (serrano ham, little spanish green olives, goat cheese, tomato and red onion) . My only criticism is the croutons, to me, were not that but the bread they use has a nice chewy crust so I can forgive that. According to my boyfriend you can't win friends with salad but this one he can make an exception  we both had tacos al pastor (pork) and carne asada  the al pastor was so tender and they grill fresh pineapple for it which in my book wins every time  the carne asada was juicy and full of flavor with a generous dollop of of smashed avocado  we also got sides which I recommend just make sure you ask what the first 3 are because they change according to what they get from that particular vendor.   So I got maya's farms veggies which consisted of yellow squash and zucchini that they grilled and tossed with sliced garlic lemon and shishito peppers. Amazing  My boyfriend got the arroz frito which was their take on fried rice. They stir fry it with a ton of fresh veggies and I think they may use bacon fat but don't hold me to that  There was no disappointment here just wish we were there for happy hour but we were an hour too early. Maybe next time since they seem to have a ton of items that they give discounts on. We will definitely return again again.

n-cq6ZjJJSKtJVwAPS4Byw.text: In town for a wedding from Detroit and came here for lunch on a recommendation from my uncle who lives in the area. We waited about 10 minutes for a table which was fine, they were pretty busy and had a large table reserved. Ordered the Bloody Mary which uses a house made mix. It was really good, heavy on fresh dill so if dill isn't your thing I would order something else but we both enjoyed it. Guacamole for an appetizer was delicious. Nice and chunky, extremely simple but delicious. The chips and guacamole were served with 2 salsas a fire roasted salsa and a green salsa. They were to die for. For lunch I ordered a vegetarian burrito and a quinoa salad and I was very happy. I already want to go back.

ESA3Cz-SnspyCbzvJiL7HQ.text: This place is so delicious! It's such a chill environment dress up or don't it's totally up to you. And the food.... Well it's delicious south-Mexico style food. You must try The Espanol for an appetizer but you can never go wrong with the guacamole either. And the paella is just delicious but be prepared for left-overs! Oh and don't forget the drinks, Bloody Michelada or a Margarita, both are great!

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Elote callejero (you MUST try) &amp; tacos al pastor &amp; Tacos de carne asada!
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Paella Mexicana (usually come with tortilla but you can substitute)
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Enchilada Trio (1) ranchero (1) green &amp; (1) mole

L6I8kAI-97-pbkGT5lyP4w.text: Great place no complaints about any of the items on their menu. The service is fantastic and everyone is very friendly and helpful. Definitely a great place.

VjHmiDiC9-t9UYBkV0EOkg.text: This place was AMAZING! Our server Betsy was very helpful with the menu, was always smiling and energetic. I had the shrimp taco, carne a sad a and Al pastor taco. They were very good and super tasty. This place has a great urban, lofty atmosphere. Overall I had a great time and awesome food with great service!

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beat Margaritas Ever!
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Paloma goodness!

J9HG4BS14qfx12JAhzPEPA.text: Great food!  The current lamb rib special is beyond this world!  Pork belly taco and queso fundido with chorizo are phenomenal too. Cool atmosphere and art work, nice bar.  I tried the bourbon sweet tea, but I don't think there was but a drop of bourbon, if that.   Ok, now the issue...slow as freaking Christmas!  Not our first time here either, and both times we spent waaaayyyy too much time waiting for our food.  Tonight it was literally an hour and forty five minutes from sit-down to finally getting our check.  Our waitress acted like she was, smoking a little something out back between tables.  I don't think they looked short staffed either.  I think the best bet here is do the takeout from now on.

c4XGCnx3L_wmWuDCQfqofQ.text: I just LOVE this place.  If you want to eat clean, local and flavorful Mexican food, I highly recommend this place.  The drinks are delicious too! Fruit juice made in house for for their cocktails.

FVgRF_MX3xZKEGqonrxtQw.text: My first post. Okay have been here many times before and one of my favorites. But tonight had the best dish and hope they have it always. It was the Caldo De Mariscos. If you go tonight order it. If not tonight tell them to include it on the menu.

kNWn4Th146nwRQsf7eW6bA.text: Went for dinner one Friday night. Love that you can make a reservation! We were very impressed with all our food, drinks and prices. The service was a little spotty, but not horrible.  Can't wait to go back!

pbde6dumwXQU-QAbHJzztg.text: More and more, 7th Street is becoming the street to be on. Terrific restaurants continue to pop up, and even more are being built as I type! Otro is no exception to that. It's a great little casual dining spot with delicious food and awesome ambiance; it's perfect for a date. If you're a fan of Gallo Blanco, you're going to be familiar with what Otro has to offer.  Mexican beer, wine, cocktails, tacos, chips, guacamole and tasty salsas... All were had, and all were yummy. The al pastor and carne asada tacos are choice! While the al pastor was sweet and savory, the carne asada was tender and scrumptious! They know what they're doing, so you shouldn't be disappointed with Otro's taco game. Complementary chips and salsas are always a nice touch, and when paired with Otro's freshly made guacamole, be prepared for food baby status because you won't be able to stop picking at them! With all that goodness shared, I have one gripe.. I ordered a michelada, and Otro's only comes with beer and lime juice. I was hoping for some spicy tomato juice with it, but c'est la vie...  Otro is worth a visit, and I'll be back in the near future for sure. I'm already craving some of those delicious tacos and salsas. To all my foodies, get off your butts and go check it out.

4njBlEdNmRCshNXbb2lPxA.text: This place is soooo good. Some of the food falls into the prestigious category of cuisine that makes it's eaters stop talking. Not because their marriage has become stale, but because the food is too fantastic to stop shoveling it in.  I also love that they feature art from local artists and that some of it is for sale. I didn't absolutely love the paella... It needed more flavor but I absolutely loved everything else.

FWzJ4rCAhtFZh-RJo54ysg.text: Four stars because of the food. Its fresh mexican food, everything I've ever ordered from there is the bomb. Highly recommend it for the food.   Service, not so great. The server was busy but walked passed my table many many times like 10 times within 10 minutes without asking if I was ready to order or anything but was attending all of her other tables. I started with an appetizer. Then another 20 mins went by before she got my order. Spent a lot longer to dine than what I planned on. I planned on a quick stop for some street tacos and guac. Two hours later, I was finally paying my bill.

3PU9XLKGM-C_TfpLALvKBg.text: I am a born and raised Phoenecian and grew up in the 7st hood. Otro is the bomb! Great menu, beer is cold and salsa is terrific. Service can be a bit suspect from time to time but overall experience has been great many times.

0nFBx1P_gWoGEi_3xXFqkQ.text: This was my first and last time eating at Otro Cafe. The food was Bland and not very good. It was quite expensive but had a nice atmosphere.

YqKOZDqwbaMaCoj4nYy0yg.text: Hmmm...same menu safe, chef.....but it seemed like the ingredients weren't the same as Gallo Blanco.  I still love the salsas but i think i will keep going to GB and deal with the overwhelming crowd.    Loved the art mural!

JR86JQmrgBGnnVJkcARquw.text: The food is pretty good. I had the paella. its not paella in the traditional sense but it was good. this restaurant is pretty much Gallo Blanco. solid food service with a smile.  I personally just don't care for the feel of the place it feels like a cafeteria. needs to be warmed up.

oFzIUmXinRQvhBjYSCNHeQ.text: We had breakfast, 2 people NO liquor-OVER $37!!! I don't care how good the food +/or ambiance is breakfast, aside from brunch at a 5 star resort, should be no where near $30. Everything is al-a-cart at Otro. My $12 omelet came w/ no toast, potatoes nada. It's not like we ate a lot either, between us we had- 1-ice tea, 1-oj, 1-omelet,4 fried eggs,1 side breakfast potatoes, 3 strips bacon, a 2" piece of sausage(which they consider a side)- and THAT WAS IT.  Needless to say we were still hungry after we ate (oh yeah, my friend's 4 fried eggs did not come out together- 2 eggs, then 3-4 minutes later another 2 eggs, really?).... I've been in the business for years and one of the many mistakes  restaurant owners' make is being cheap- the profit margin on breakfast is huge-  Hey guys , are things so bad that you can't cough up some toast + home fries w/ breakfast like every other eatery in town?  But we are lucky in my neighborhood and Phx in general because we have many choices of places to eat. I know where I won't be eating again. Have a great day y'all!

CYFJxCJO2DZctBuGAVOMcg.text: I really loved the food here.  In a city where virtually all of the Mexican restaurants menu seems to either be the same old "combo platter" or they consist only of tacos, this is a huge breath of fresh air.  LOVE the Owner and Chef, Doug All four meals were GREAT!!!  I found California Sea Bass, a delicious ocean fish that you can only find in California as far as I know, and the torta was perfectly layered, and had a wonderfull wood fired smell!!  The tacos were just as good.  The Mexican Paella was completely original, and Full of flavor!! The only thing I think could be improved is how difficult it is to see this place from the street (at least for us).  Maybe add a larger 2nd sign? Still, a FIVE STAR food experience!  Also, the service was really great this time!! They also have FLAMENCO night !!!

m1z36D0mPKCaoHMYkSYKmw.text: I was there over the weekend.  The food was good and so was the atmosphere.  The wait staff seemed to be annoyed with their job.

dZoSkV_C7pvxRQjPoHTOUA.text: Great place, great prices, great drink selection and selection in general, great staff and great location. Parking is no problem as there's more in the back. The staff is very informative and friendly all the way from the waitresses/waiters to the hostess. If it was closer to home, we'd stop by more often.

3723XkmM3w150zbag3PWNw.text: Went for happy hour to order margaritas. Our server, who we couldn't tell if she was being overly nice or if she was patronizing us, brought us back lime juice with simple syrup. We could barely notice the "great tasting" silver tequila she was describing to us before we ordered them. Another thing I didn't appreciate was the lack of check ups she did with our table. We saw her three times during our dining experience. The food though.... Amazing. I highly recommend this place for the food. I had the veggie tacos and they were to die for.  Giving three stars because of the poor service. Would recommend this place for the food for sure. So good!

1X2L8iD-HphQX_j1Cz6M_w.text: There was a thick nasty black hair in my burrito, they said they would let me pick whatever I wanted from the menu, the price of what I picked was a little over $5 from the burrito so they said they wouldn't give it to me for free and I had to pay for it, first and last time there. No one wants someone's hair in their food, you don't know what hygiene habits they have and it's just plain disgusting. Would NOT recommend you to eat here!

JBhSePzcWqqWH4mg7LiCUw.text: Christopher T. is correct in stating that this place should go into your usual rotation.   I had the chicken soup - and while I did see a review that this wasn't authentic Pho - WHO CARES!  It was amazing.  If you are looking at reviews, considering dining here, just get in the car and come.  It's good, and you will like it.

rMv0J2qSCckgrqGB5A7KEQ.text: We tried for the first time. They seated us by the doors  and the sun was on us for about 50 minutes.  The chips were thick  and the hot sauce  was thick.  I did not like the chips or sauce.  We ordered the quesdilla.  The waitress  forgot the  order and brought  it last . One of them had very little cheese. . The guacamole  was good but I like it spicy with some fresh jalapenos.  My breakfast  burrito was a little saucy . We did like the fish tacos. It was noisy and had trouble  hearing the waitress

1ckH8tW26DFUpcyRFXL_aA.text: Guacamole was very tasty. The small was large enough for two. We each had a burrito. One carne asada; both of which had an amazing flavor. Portions were large for the price. Will be back

leHaUzgmNXhv66RTt9kP3Q.text: Hate to use the cliche, "everything is good" but I have had everything and it's all good!! Best thing, Pork Belly taco.   Also I never get soup ever, but I get it here.

ia7g6J6mvHwDQbGqH4Oq-w.text: Loved this restaurant! The food was spectacularly delicious! We started with the guacamole and chips, both of which were really good. We also tried the queso fundido, which we aren't as crazy about, because the cheese seemed a bit too thick and hardened too quickly when it cooled. Then we tried four of the tacos - the pork, chicken, carne asada and the shrimp, all of which were very good and very different. For dessert, we tried the Dulce de Leche Flan - very rich and full of flavor. We found the service to be very good. We will definitely return.

LxU00a_aIZL_6MBl8vO06A.text: Okay, this place is high in hype, low in everything else. I've never liked the food much- everything is bland and overpriced. It's way too noisy inside- even in a place that's pretty low-key you can't hear across the table. Or be heard by the poor wait staff. On that note, I've experienced more than one slightly off waitress. They're just aloof enough to bug you. I guess the decor is nice. I like the paintings by local artists and the patio would be nice in cooler weather. Not that I'll go back to find out.

RzWxpZaWqHRpgTjUOPq5yw.text: Food was great. I had the BLT-A torts, kids had the flap jacks, and the Mrs. had the shrimp tacos.  Good service (guacamole did come out when chips were almost out, had to ask for more to finish the Guam with, and could have checked in more - thus the 4), and food was great!

h1pc8YoFNNOVk1viopau_Q.text: Minimalist, clean cut, urban atmosphere, excellent food, and friendly service. It can get pretty busy during the rushes though. Definitely a gem! The burritos are delicious, and you can  even get breakfast items after breakfast is over.

wKKqO29GOA00EjNFW_Pfug.text: Will not be back...Pisco Sour is $9 for 5 sips- I do mean sips- and the music was blaring. We asked it be turned down, so we could talk;, it was turned down temporarily, then blaring again. Food was okay, not delicious.

ka15iFuvOJnmf8oEIAyr-Q.text: It's in a little strip mall off 7th St and Bethany Home. Walking in, it's a nice size resturant, clean and welcoming.   We got here at 1145ish on a Monday, and had no problems getting a table. I ordered a coke and was offered bottle or fountain. The fountain is on a meh level, but I've had a LOT worse so I didn't mind.  So like I said we ordered before the lunch rush came in (by 1215 it was full with people waiting to be seated. It took us 30 minutes to get the Steak and Apple salad and 3 tacos.   But they arrived finally and OMG, the steak was amazing. Now I forget which was which but the one with the potatoes and mushrooms was absolutely AMAZING. I wasn't thrilled with the 3rd choice. I could eat another one of the 2 I liked, bit not willing to sit for another 30 minutes to get it!!!  The salad was good. There were no complaint. I also got the side of mixed veggies and ate most of that. And I'm not a veggie person so I'm pretty proud of myself. Was an excellent sauce that it was all cooked down in.   We passed on the guacamole and chips today.  I am most definitely looking forward to a return trip!!!

Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork, Chicken and Beef taco
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak and Apple salad

8HED299HY2m3dUxM5_SLHw.text: Brunch is amazing.  Lots of southwest fare, amazing tamales (weekends only) and flapjacks!!

1mdvMqHzfF8LIZJrg8pZEA.text: Best pancakes and Mexican breakfast in the north central corridor. My go tos are the breakfast sampler or the Mexican breakfast. Chips, salsa, guac ftw. They also have live music on the weekends during breakfast and lunch hours.

dUewpWTGam1tRhNRLIRxPA.text: If you like gourmet Mexican it'll be good for you. I got the veggie chilequiles and was in for a surprise. I'm not used to having anything but cheese and egg, these were covered in a variety of veggies. I do like butternut squash and purple cauliflower, just not on my chilequiles. I'd prefer a more traditional, simple version.

InUR-nJjyk1qgP6l-JMUFQ.text: Had a carne asada street taco and pozole soup.  Great tacos.  Pozole was neither red nor green.  Very different tasting.  Good, just unlike anything I had before.

KPdFt0oABPz5_aI7uJYsdw.text: I rarely ever give five stars to any establishment. But when it is deserved it is deserved. I have been here twice. I have had the ceviche, elote callejero and tacos. All are excellent. The tacos are the best I have ever had... especially the pork belly. The ceviche is excellent and very fresh. If you have not tried elote callejero, you are in for a treat. It is a roasted corn on the cob with cheese and spices. I had never had it before. This place is located in a small center that is easily missed unless you know where it is. Service is extremely friendly. I would go all the time if I lived anywhere near this fantastic little restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Street tacos. Pork, chicken, and pork belly

29_lQb1oOztIMJvh0fCH1g.text: They got a new menu starting...today.  Generally love the civiche but today was off.  Manager came over and apologized offered me free food but more importantly wanted to know how it could be better.  This place is a classy establishment.  Food is great.  Definitely try

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pokégym!!!!!!!

9NCzRA-GsVlYtqvKBXXdNg.text: We were planning on going to another restaurant which was unexpectadly closed so we chose Otro instead, and we were delighted! The atmosphere is great during dinner hour, the food was stellar, the service was accomadating. Give this place a try!

f4DZjCVUGqKznD9wwoJx1A.text: Decent food, but I was shocked that the burritos only came with white flour tortillas and that there were no sides with the burrito. As much as I liked the taste, I'd prefer a whole wheat tortilla and some good sides with a $10 burrito!

YzRKRGmXjo2-zKIRguiKMw.text: Ambiance busy. Scents incredible and pork belly tacos a must! Staff is welcoming and efficient. Don't miss this restaurant.

7bMCsuzgC4-_ucTlKQF3EQ.text: Absolutely brilliant. Food and service were both outstanding. Went for breakfast and had the huevos rancheros and a green iced tea. The chef's take on the rancheros was delicious, with gooey, melted cotijo cheese stuffed in the tortillas and perfectly poached eggs. The green tea - not normally something I love - was delicious, without the bitterness I usually expect from it.   Highly recommend

vxUYN5c2m22FJxe3Bdgm2g.text: Came in for lunch, have veggie taco with Rice and beans on the side, no very impressed with the veggie tacos, more like an Asian stir fry, not Mexican cusine, at least goes my taste, I was not impressed with the rice heavy oil taste, buried the flavor of the rice. My recommendation do not come in for vegetarian tacos. If you are omnivorous the. Carne asada tacos are fantastic.so this time for lunch with mom very disappointed on the vegetarian side for tacos.

X8H3dFUOB1W2JwZO3AX3Vg.text: From Paella to the Guacamole to the Fish Tacos, this place is as good of a Mexican Restaurant as you'll find in Phoenix.  Ambiance = 5* Atmosphere = 5* Service = 5* Food = 5* Overall Experience = 5*

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

lq60NnlLeYn3vr6wetRlPg.text: TL:DR = Eat here.  Just do it.  It's The Best.  And now a little something for all you story people:  I'm not normally a Mexican food person.  I mean, I'll eat it, sure.  But when my girlfriend says, "What do you want to eat," anything Latin is usually farther down on the list.  That said, I love a good taco, and I'm glad that my native Minnesota is rife with taco trucks.  So during a trip to Phoenix to celebrate my brother's graduation from ASU's PhD program we decided to find a good place for dinner, and he suggested Otro, having previously been a fan of Gallo Blanco (same dude and all).  You'd probably miss the place if you weren't looking for it.  The outside is pretty non-descript, but like all great things in life, appearances are most definitely deceiving.  The inside is gorgeous.  Beautiful woodwork, cool, lived-in-looking tables and chairs, and incredibly bright and colourful artwork by some local artists.  It's trendy without looking like it's trying too hard.  Joseph was our server, and he was perfect.  Very friendly, helpful, knowledgeable, but never to the point of being overbearing.  My brother couldn't make up his mind on which tacos to order, so Joseph gave him an extra one on the house just so he could try it out.  Very nice.    My brother and our folks ordered tacos (the fish was a big hit all around), and I ordered the naco torta, which was grilled, chopped ribeye steak, two fried eggs on the top (but cooked how you want), lettuce, ahi aioli, and guac on the bun.  Holy crap.  It's amazeballs.  The meat was perfectly marinated and cooked.  I'd planned to eat half and bring half home, but by the time we left I looked down and wondered where the rest of my sandwich had gone.  We didn't have room enough for dessert, but I have no doubt that it would have been as incredible as everything else we had.  So.  Eat at Otro.  I'd even wear a sandwich board for them if they wanted me to.  Now I guess I'll need to open one of these up in Minneapolis.

s7PUoK2WIY2Imdv93wsBtQ.text: I love this place! From the cozy atmosphere, the food, the service, and last but not least, the Wednesday night live Flamenco entertainment.  Their food taste so fresh even their chips are made in house. The portions are just right and the price is even better. Their ensalada de la calle or house salad is my favorite with fresh crushed green olives and jamon serrano, yum!!! Their tacos are also great and my other favorite is their house version of Pho, which they call chicken soup. Everything is made fresh everyday and you can certainly taste the freshness.  Their service is also great! They have attentive servers and very efficient and friendly. The establishment owner and the sous chef sometimes come out to check on every table to make sure every patron is happy. Everyone leaves happy and satisfied.  The best time to go is on Wednesday when they have the live Flamenco entertainment. This group of flamenco performers are amazing from the flamenco guitarist to the singer, to the dancer. I highly recommend this place and worth the visit.

6uwuCOWlLPnn1OxYKGjLtw.text: Had a great brunch today. Great food and the atmosphere was perfect. My waiter Colin gave great suggestions and made me feel right at home. Definitely go

i7U8A3Tp0pSuiIBcFz33rQ.text: This is probably my fav taco place in Phoenix. I love love loveeeee the green salsa! Brilliant. Kids eat for free ! I love that idea! And they have delicious horchata. My kiddo is addicted! My favorite dishes: tamales, chillaquiles, tacos...elote can be a hit or miss. Service ...could be better. I have my favorite waiter...5 stars for me.

yJhmSwP41h4vVxlX8Jkuqg.text: The food and service were excellent!  We went there for breakfast and I ordered the combination that included a flap jack (yummy!). Fresh, hand-made tortillas were to die for!  They gave me very generous serving of bacon (couldn't eat it all). Two types of homemade salsas. The coffee was so delicious I had to ask where they get it.  Just one suggestion - dust the light fixtures above the tables.

Pe-L8cWer4IT-BA8bApw7w.text: Otro is a fiery gem in the food desert that is Phoenix. Sure, you can find good food in PHX ... but rarely do you find a restaurant that does all of it RIGHT! You can taste the freshness + authenticity they infuse into every dish.   My favorite things ... Guacamole: prepared fresh to order + so good with their house-made chips + salsa. Tacos: they are all good, but my favorites are their fish + pork belly tacos. Chicken Soup: perfect for when you or a loved one are feeling blue. Paella Mexicana: Full of amazing flavor, great for sharing, and sooo good as leftovers (with an egg in the morning ... yum!)  Now I have to share this story about their breakfast ....   When my boyfriend and I go out for breakfast, he always gets eggs, bacon, hash browns + 1 pancake. When he ordered the Sampler Breakfast at Otro, I don't think I've ever seen him so satisfied. Eggs were perfectly done. The bacon was seriously the best bacon I've ever tasted - also cooked perfectly. The pancake - omg, slightly crisp on the outside and soft in the middle - served with probably the best maple syrup we've ever had. To get his hash brown fix, he ordered a side of fries ... and WOW. It baffles me that the best fries in PHX are served at a Mexican Restaurant! Ha!  Thank you Otro for always satisfying my taste buds + heart!  xo, Taylor

DdGGJtemz7c0IZi-grGx4A.text: Been wanting to try this place for quite some time. We got the El Espanol for an appetizer, holy flavor town and what a fresh and unique approach compared to your typical appetizer. I had the Al Pastor burrito and my brother had the Carne Asada. The Al Pastor was full of flavor and absolutely delicious. The Carne was cooked medium and incredible as well. Definitely check this spot out, you won't be disappointed.

sORczatzItX-m12h5QxSog.text: Like Beth above, I found Otro's food up to the high standards of sister restaurant Gallo Blanco, but the service was a disappointment. Our server took our order and then vanished. Drinks stood empty as did our molcajete of chips. Iced tea was replenished, finally, but without ice. However, like Beth, I will be back for the great food. Try the frijoles negro (black beans liberally dusted with cotija) and the paella mexicana, delicious with bits of chorizo, chicken, and surprisingly zucchini. Some of the rice grains along the inside of the cast iron serving plate were wonderfully crisp. Your creative and delicious cuisine should carry you far, Otro, but only so far if the service continues to lag behind.

EPXNKGPJv2P1AB9Faj0-8g.text: The flavors at this Mexican restaurant are so fresh and vibrant, not weighted down by oils and overcooked sauces. Spices are point on. Certainly the best Mexican food I have had on either side of the border. Our server was extremely pleasant as well.

weeenpgQ--7C95npPTZbZw.text: I was just reading the reviews on Yelp!, and I can't justify the 1 star reviews with the great meal and service I just had.  Everything was super fresh, the al pastor torta and tacos were delish, and I couldn't get over how much shrimp was in the Coctel de Camaron (prolly misspelt :-)  Service was friendly, mostly quick and super knowledgeable.  Also several local Az breweries were represented, and the bar looked pretty well stocked, with some interesting house cocktails.  We tried both desserts (pudding and tort) which just put the meal over the top.  My only complaint, the menu was kind of limited.

ePuQ0xyZ6FSHVxB1zH64rA.text: I really enjoyed dinner here tonight. Shared the Inca salad with a friend and had a carne asada taco and a veggie taco, both were excellent. My friend had the mole chicken and said it was tasty

zAVsrpQET2cn2k09701rWQ.text: I frequent Otro often and it never disappoints.  Carne Asada anything, breakfast all day, pork belly taco is mind blowing and the chicken soup cures all ailments. Thanks Doug for an amazing establishment.

0wVODQfAd7yUzdbsPeeoJA.text: The food is good here but what is up with the service!?   It may be an issue that they are understaffed. Comparing this place to Joyride I would say food is equal however the service at Joyride is 100% better. Hopefully they start recognizing this and do something about it. It's really frustrating.  In my opinion.

19zPgY6rL8PhxG1hnycifg.text: Like a lot of other reviewers I'd have to say the food is 5 star but the service is horrendous. We were blatantly ignored once and got up and left after 15 minutes of staring at the menu. We gave it another shot and actually made it to the ordering part; and the food really is phenomenal once you actually get someone to take your order and bring it to you. The horrible service explains why it is never busy when we've gone. Which is unfortunate because we love the food. If they ever bring this place all together into a 5 star worthy eatery they will have a money making gem there! Until then know it's hit or miss on the service. More miss than hit. And honestly for me that was their last chance to gain me as a regular. Sorry Otro.

JLDRnghA-kXHIeEeZIzb9w.text: Love the flavors and atmosphere of Otro Cafe.  Great addition to the neighborhood.

wMpxBYv_zWdf6k85zMVoRw.text: I loved the food here. The guac & chips/raw veggies was excellent. The veggie taco (vegan) was to die for. And I got two vegetable side dishes, which are whatever veggie is fresh from different local farms, and they were both amazing. The charred cauliflower was incredible and a huge hit, and the cooked radishes were awesome, too. My peach margarita was great. Love it! Great for vegans and vegetarians (and obviously omnivores -- everyone else loved their food, too -- the 3 enchiladas, chicken mole, and bacon torta).

9Y0BO-ZESR_yahh6sqoxow.text: My sister loves coming here every time she comes to visit!! The Espanol is really good if you like prosciutto. Staff is extremely helpful, prices are great, and food is phenomenal!!

5_Mse75aoBrOPvEm0qU8vA.text: I was really excited to try out this restaurant since the chef had previously done a demonstration at the Uptown farmers market. He made a very original citrus guacamole and I loved it. So I decided to bring my friend. He ordered the steak burrito and I had the elote callejero, and steak tacos. The flavors of the taco were great and I would definitely come back to have some more. My friend was very disappointed by the burrito since the beans overwhelmed the other flavors, including the steak. The restaurant is cute and has friendly staff, but compared to other Mexican places like La Santisima & Joyride, from our experience, it's just ok.

lj8Dbd8uyzQPiHl1kS6xTg.text: Check it out the food is great and the atmosphere is low key chique

QTXulUIP7Erslk-UTqLczw.text: I love the food here and normally the service is ok. Today for some reason it was not very good at all. The day I decide to bring my friend to try it out, she is left with a poor impression of the place. We walk in, restaurant is about half full, we see a couple of open tables on the patio so we request patio seating with the person that greeted us. They look outside and tell us it'll be 5 minutes for them to get something ready for us. Well within the 15 that we actually waited 3 other staff members asked if we had been helped, to them we replied that we were waiting for an outside table (that had been clear and open the whole time). Finally we are taken to our table. Our friendly server took our drink order and gave us a few minutes to look over the menu. She comes to take our order and we ask for some chips and salsa as well. Well the chips didn't come until our food arrived even though we stopped another staff member to check on our chip order. My friends coffee was served cold and the refill I asked for on my Arnold Palmer was never brought out. Even though the staff was friendly, they never once concerned themselves for our discontentment. I don't often come here but not sure I'll be back anytime soon sadly. My friend was less than pleased with her first experience here. My meal was delicious though!

GhTk-RIV_XK8C5oUUEU0MQ.text: Great food and atmosphere but extremely poor service. waitress never asked us if we wanted more drinks, we had to flag her down to order food. Great Chilaquiles! A while after we finished eating, someone cleared our table, no one offered more drinks. The spicy Bloody Mary was good but apparently they only wanted to serve one. About a half hour later we had to get up to go find waitress to ask for our check. She came over and asked us what we ate and drank so she could make out a bill for us. She did not even offer an apology for taking so long. I only gave 3 stars because the food was good and might give them another try and hope the experience was just a waitress having a bad day.

Wy_CnvM_PxyhzZQW63tZJw.text: I love Gallo Blanco, so I was pretty excited about this new offering, and I wasn't disappointed.  I was there with a group of nine for happy hour/dinner.  I can't be effusive enough about how attentive the staff was, and how gracious they were about our many requests.  It seemed like every time the server approached the table, he left with another order.  We had the ceviche, guacamole, chicken paella, steak tacos, coconut pudding, and key lime pie.  Everything was amazing.  The wine menu was a little light, but someone (I think she was the manager) told us that they'd had a meeting with a wine distributor earlier in the day and would be expanding the wine menu in the coming weeks.  If you like Gallo Blaco, you'll like the additions to the menu offered by Otro Cafe.  The space itself is crisp and clean, although not particularly large.  I foresee long waits as word gets about this place.

TcaspzgEvhgVMwhTfELnXQ.text: On my last review I noted how I thought this restaurant was good but did not compare to Gallo Blanco. I was encouraged to go again,  which I did,  yesterday with a group of 8 people.  To start,  they would not sit us because we only had 6, the other two gals were on their way. The restaurant was pretty empty,  but they stated they had other reservations.  I never saw a group of 8 come,  so. ..our table should have been available anyway.  We would have ordered many more drinks but instead we had one, two at the most.  The guy that finally decided to sit us was not very nice,  and rudely said "come on! " to which I responded that we weren't a bunch of cows being herd to our table. He didn't say anything.  Our server was alright,  her voice was a bit much on the ears, have you heard of voice fry? The food,  great, guacamole and queso fundido were tasty. The tacos great as expected, the mijito, though  not on the menu was well done. We came during happy hour,  but when checks came the bill didn't reflect that. The waitress seemed annoyed when we asked about it.  We are by no means a difficult or demanding group. So I am inclined to think it's an attitude issue on their part. I was  completely done with the experience when a plate load crashes on the floor. It falls from the hands of one of servers. It was literally next to us,  soooo loud,  pieces flying,  and not a word to apologize or something!? We weren't offered desert and at that point I was too bothered to stay longer.  I said bye and thank you as I walked out,  but there was no response from the staff. So maybe I'll go again,  to eat tacos because they are truly amazing but I am now even more sad that Gallo Blanco is gone. .. the charm,  atmosphere,  attentive service is clearly not at this but the Otro (other) restaurant. Sigh...

VV5uHI8DXAOVNCmzEWLxyw.text: I read an article about this place in the Phoenix New Times, so the wife and I decided to give it a try.   The best thing about the place is their guacamole. It was very good, maybe some of the best I've had in the Valley, and it was only $5!  I tried their al pastor, carne asada, and shrimp tacos a la carte. The pastor tacos were fantastic, the carne asada good, and the shrimp were tasty but there was plenty of room to put a third shrimp in the taco instead of a stingy two.   My wife had a chorizo torta. I thought it was delicious and immediately wished I had ordered that instead. It sounded good, but I thought it would be in a huge piece of bread, and I didn't feel like filling up on bread. Instead it had a very thin, soft bun which allowed the chorizo, egg, and black beans to be the show.   Beware that the iced tea is very fruity, but that's not a big deal. We sat on the patio but our service was still superb. I'm pretty sure we arrived after happy hour ended, but our waitress still charged us happy hour prices. Not sure what the happy hour was, but it lowered our bill by $7, and she ended up with a bigger tip of course as a result.   My only major draw back is I thought the menu was pretty limited. I think they had more drink options than food options. I'd like to see them expand the menu some, because the food was really good, and I'd like to try more. We will definitely be back.

n6R5-_qUqEONQlbdXkQTPg.text: great food! the breakfast burrito was delicious as well as the carne asada burrito, cheese dip, and kids quesadilla. although the food was fabulous, the service was extraordinarily slow. they only had one waitress who was still in training. our food and check took an eternity to arrive. normally I wouldn't be so harsh, but we happened to be seeing a movie that night. we barely made it and had to skip our stops on the way. overall, great food, but horrible service. do NOT come here if you have any plans for the day.

5fXtOXDTiPVJb3cMSpWhqg.text: Had a great meal here, tried the delicious Paella and Head Office had fish, veggie and chicken tacos. Very comfortable, service was great and loved the chicken paintings on the walls. Nice place, will be back for breakfast.

nYJ9UAVsPp8d7OxgAyFK3w.text: I have been regretting the thought of writing this review, but feel I need to in hopes Otro can meet its promise.  We have been regulars (at least weekly) at Otro for over a year.  We preferred its former sister restaurant - Gallo Blanco - as it always had better food and service, but Otro is in our neighborhood.  We had hoped the closing of Gallo Blanco would bring its higher standards to Otro, but the exact opposite has occurred.  The food at Otro used to be good and now has taken a step down in quality and consistency.  The service at Otro has always been mediocre, but has become awful; always inattentive and often bordering on rude.  We are taking Otro out of our regular restaurant rotation for now - but hope we hear from others that it has turned the corner and is worthy of another try.

p6RJTO7jynEdVGmnNVhfJg.text: This used to be so good.  They opened with the same menu as the old place at The Clarendon.  That place was amazing!!  Tacos used to be SO good.  The new menu at Otro is a massive step down in selection and the cooking has gone down too.   .  Bring the old menu and cook back!!!

kgCwROZEk0-N7a0mTz-4NQ.text: Did you ever have a little insignificant almost not worthy mentioning kind of thing happen while dining being a precursor to things to come?  It started with my iced tea. It was an unexpected fruity flavor but what really annoyed me was the very old orange slice hanging on my glass. I could tell by looking at it that it's been around for at least more than a day. That sort became a kiss death in my opinion and maybe blemished my experience a little bit.   They started us off with a generous amount of chips and salsas. The chips were fresh and slightly on the thick side. The salsas were both unique one was a very limey tomatillo and the other was a creamy very spicy red that had a smokiness to it with a slightly bitter taste to it.  I had the smaller sized Quinoa salad that was mostly quinoa. I thought the salad was OK. I liked the pumpkin and local yulu seeds in it. I also thought the sweet roasted corn in it was a nice touch and it would have been better with just a little more roasted corn.  I would have enjoyed the salad more if I didn't add the chicken because I didn't care for the taste of the chicken. I"M NOT SAYING IT WAS BAD in any way but it had that similar taste to it that the hot sauce had that I didn't care for. It was something smokey and the salad flavors, the fruity iced tea and the smokey chicken just didn't taste good together for me. But I note that's just me and anybody else might like it.  My husband had what they called Paella. He said it was OK as a chicken with salsa and rice in a skillet kind of meal. It didn't have the crust of rice one expects at the bottom to be paella and the rice was mushy but OK. It seemed like more salsa than broth. He didn't recognize anything pork in the dish but was told it was in there when he asked about it.  I just kept looking at that falling apart soggy orange slice...........  2.5 stars  I do note they have a nice patio for al fresco dining.
