Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Paella

ryKqO9A1e25VXuQe4kpP0Q.text: Horrible i uses To Love this place but never go at closing time they will serve you old chicken that taste like garbage not fresh , I can't believe I had to pay for something I didn't eat .  Manager never came just the nice serve said he was sorry I will never be back I used to love Gallo blanco but this place is no good after 9:40 pm

SGhRUsKGasiHq83xa50I6g.text: Food is hit or miss. When it's a hit food is amazing. Not sure why they make you wait 30+minutes when half the restaurant has empty seats.

eJgsTKiZoG-_OyhN8mL3Wg.text: We've been going here for a while because I love the guacamole. This time I just wanted to grab takeout and go home after a long week. After I got home I realized half of my order was missing. I was pretty unhappy but I didn't I want to leave again because it was pouring outside.  The owner called and offered to drive our order up right away.  That is probably some of the best customer service I've seen in a long time. And just because of that I will definitely be going back to enjoy their food.

hwoiszZnKBdd4zUlpBvYOw.text: Came here with friends for a Saturday lunch. I ordered one chicken and one shrimp taco, and we ordered guacamole for the table to share. The guacamole was some of the best I ever had, and the chips were really good by themselves. They looked freshly made. Both my tacos were also good, clearly made with fresh ingredients. The shrimp itself was probably the freshest-tasting I have ever had. I really liked the hot sauces on the tables, especially the green, more spicy, one.  The atmosphere was very nice. There was some very interesting artwork inside. There were a decent amount of people there when we were, but it did not feel cramped. Our waitress was very nice and attentive.  A very good choice for Mexican in Phoenix!

t4C5-Z04UqF_8Myy44rOTg.text: Atmosphere: 5 Location: 5 FOOD: 5!!!!!!! Service: 1 Food is soooo YUMMY! Fresh, clean, and I love the open kitchen. I had a fabulous quinoa salad for screamin deal, $5. The veggie taco with butternut squash, AMAZING. Pear mojito was good but it definitely took 15min to make it to me. FREE chips and salsa, so i still tipped accordingly, but the service was just bad. I came in after a day of moving so I looked a little scruffy but I watched our server go out of her way to basically cater to everyone but us. Its a small location so I dont know how she missed the dirty empty dishes (with my card on the edge of the table) for AT LEAST 10min.... if it wasnt for the amazing food I wouldnt go back.  But seriously, AWESOME food! UPDATE:  Ive been in a little more than a handful of times now and the ONLY time I have received good service is with Randy. He was absolutely wonderful.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

j3N_Kn3knTuOZIx3SeiVMQ.text: Let me just say from the beginning that my husband and I are HUGE Gallo Blanco fans. Huge. So expectations for sister restaurant Otro Cafe were high going in. And let me tell you, Otro delivered.  After looking forward to Otro's opening for a while, we were finally able to make it in today for a late, lazy Saturday lunch. Our server was incredibly nice and knowledgeable about the menu. I decided to try the pear mojito just because, and it was delicious. Not to sweet, and (thankfully) not too strong. Just a refreshing start to what would turn out to be a wonderful lunch.  Chips and salsa are free, which is a nice change from Gallo, who does charge a small amount. We got the guacamole for a few bucks extra, and the chips, salsa, and guac were just like Gallo's. I think Gallo has the best guac anywhere in Phoenix--fresh ingredients, just a hint of citrus, and heat--so I was thrilled that Otro appears to serve the same recipe.  On to the main course: I usually get tacos at Gallo, but today I was in the mood for something different, so I went with the Inca Salad. Three words: to die for. Quinoa, corn, dried cranberries, and a bunch of other fresh ingredients, including what I believe are Yulu seeds, which add a great nutty flavor and occasional crunch. Delicious. A great choice for a light lunch, and very good on a day like today when it was already 90 degrees by lunchtime.  My husband had the paella and loved it. He described it as good old fashioned comfort food. I didn't try it because I am vegetarian and there was meat in it, but the husband was definitely a fan. From where I was sitting across the table I could tell it smelled delicious.  We were pretty full after all this food, but not overly stuffed, so we opted for the coconut pudding for dessert. Our server described it as cool, creamy, and not too sweet or overly coconutty, and he was right on. A very simple, very classic dessert that doesn't try to do too much. A cup garnished with chocolate shavings was the perfect ending to a very delightful lunch.  The word that kept coming to mind during the entire meal was FRESH. You can tell that Otro, just like Gallo, uses only the freshest ingredients, and that makes all the difference.  It sounds like they are going to be expanding the menu in the coming months, so you will definitely want to check this place out. Another great neighborhood dining spot. We will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coconut pudding, with the remains of our paella in the background

wqA7cP8vFDschZ-7meZoDA.text: The service has changed for the better.  As usual the food is amazing along with the service.  I would recommend this place to anyone that loves a different taste and great service.  I get the pork belly tacos with marmalade.  And with the fresh tortillas and fresh guacamole.  You can't loose.  Thank you otros for changing up the service.  So much better.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

v5-7-ReQwLBvIhDc8fUv9Q.text: Food is good but overpriced. I ordered the asado chicken salad which cost me $13 out the door and it was the equivalent of a small salad. When I asked the host if I got the large salad he confirmed what I was holding was a large then proceeded to walk off rudely.  The salad wasn't organic and the chicken wasn't free range so why $12?? At least put more lettuce as a filler. Disappointed.

rB_J8ntCxSmx_Hph9Pz0jg.text: Went in a second time and actually tried something different. I had the Guac (of course) and an, Al Pastor Taco. I always eat too much when I go here or Gallo so I just got the one taco. It was delicious and I am not usually a fan of pork. I then had to get the Coconut Pudding, which like my previous review noted, is outstanding. Funny thing is I still left stuffed.   I also enjoyed the service. The waitress and I shared a history lesson and the background behind Al Pastor. Hmmm, Shawarma, who knew?  Thanks to Smart Phones everything called, "info" is at the touch of a button. lol   I really think this is the best Mexican Restaurant in the valley. Note, I said Mexican, not what Americans think Mexican is.

V1gIK5UAUk_Ncnwhi5nirg.text: The food and server were very good!!  The restaurant lost our reservation, so we had to wait for a table.  The food (1 hour) and drinks (20 minutes) took a long time to arrive after we arrived at the restaurant.  We arrived at 5 PM and got our food at 6.  Somehow the flow was not efficient.

TsWlkI3wjp5CLGutE7Y9uQ.text: This rating is solely based on the service provided at the restaurant.  The food is great.  I mean crave in the middle of the night great.  However, they always seem overwhelmed and understaffed.  The staff does a good job of greeting you once you arrive but that does nothing for your hunger pains.  The bartender(male) appears very dismissive and doesn't embody the welcomed face or culture you would expect.  I'm sure this is caused by a lack of team atmosphere and basic customer service skills or he could just hate life ...     With all that being said the food is amazing but the service makes you want to find another amazing place.  Empty or full confusion exist.  Come hungry and patient.

t_nbj7im8hSi0PjIZ7bimg.text: Since I haven't had my dose of Gallo Blanco, I had heard that there was a sister restaurant to Gallo Blanco, Otro Cafe. My boyfriend and I decided to try it out today for brunch. I was happy with the whole place and their food! It took me back to Gallo Blanco days.  We will definitely be coming here often for some delicious food.

VW_c0BF5wP1WVsJD30Qftw.text: This cafe gem was created by the Chef and owner of Gallo Blanco Cafe -- as a huge fan of GBC, I was looking forward to this restaurant. Atmosphere is nice and cozy.  I ventured out with three friends so we could each order a differ entree and sample & taste.  Chips & salsa were hot and tasty. I had the Caldo de Pollo con Fideo Chino & an Otro salad (Gotta keep it light to maintain my Size 4 figure!!!) --- simply delish. I had samples of the Mole Negro -- YUMMILICIOUS! The Paella Mexicana wasn't a fave but it's something I would never order for myself. Overall, I loved the food and definitely look forward to sharing more times with good friends here at Otro Cafe.  CHEERS***

qqB7brmi1SyN8mi_2wnq7A.text: I am dissapointed ever since they opened up as Otro fro Gallo Blanco I've watched the quality dwindle today was no exception we constantly have to ask for more coffee and since when did they start using flour instead of corn tortilla.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coffee service sucks

SmbT3YuKx15F0PLqEkFj0A.text: I have wanted to love this cafe since it opened but it consistently has left us disappointed. My daughter and I were seated promptly and then waited forever for someone to greet our table.  Our order: $5.00 guacamole is the size of a small bowl and the chips were hard and tasteless. My daughter ordered a combo enchilada plate. After one bite - she found a hair. (Ugh) The kitchen apologized and quickly remade her order. My Asado chicken salad was fresh and flavorful - but not much for the $10 price tag. We left at $36. No one stopped by to check on us after we finished or offered anything after the hair incident. Didn't expect anything free-just more concern about our experience.

qZZzf-N8jLAhK9wYiF7I_A.text: Inedible... simply heinous ..ordered chilaquiles ended up putting a huge chunk  of chicken fat in my mouth I had to spit out...grossed out

_vQjlvsAd3bhgfWhbZOjqQ.text: Breakfast was fantastic.  I had a Campo omelet with goat cheese that was the best I have ever had.  Unfortunately, service was a little slow.  I would return.

PnLqjE5v8xHZcuWinJTw2A.text: Our first time at this restaurant, we werent very impressed. We waited to be seated for 30 minutes. I ordered the BLT&A The bacon was undercooked and the Eggs were runny. My husband ordered the Carne Asada burrito, the meat was tough and had a burnt taste. The service was very, very slow. With all of the opens tables the service shouldn't have taken so long. Overall not very impressed with this restaurant.

JSkW40m_lfcHOv-oNewvpw.text: Dinner for four last night turned out to be a disaster!  First, the surly waiter did not know if they served bourbon or scotch.  Asked for "second choices" in case they didn't have them.  When the drinks arrived we needed a few more minutes to make our dinner selection.  Questions about the menu were apparently not appreciated by the waiter and answered very shortly.  We attempted to get the waiter back to take our order to no avail.  Finally we asked the hostess if she would get the waiter and another one came to take our order for additional beverages and food.  It took forever to even be served the second drink.  We noticed that a gentleman (owner?) was at the cooking station getting chips out of a large bin, putting them into bowls to be served with his bare hands.  Our dinner was finally served (one the wrong order, perhaps because the waiter couldn't hear over the loud music) and we found it to be just okay.  The Paella had little flavor.  The hostess did offer to buy us a desert but after this "dining" experience took us several hours, we did not want to wait any longer.   Recommend you go to Christos down the street as food and service is excellent.

3ZRaDuW7JQ_iIY8P0qhuVA.text: I have eaten here a few times.  Normally, its very busy so there is sometimes a wait.  Today, I met a business associate here for lunch at 11:30am.  There were 7 tables seated.  There were about 11 tables open. When I approached the hostess, she explained to me that there would be a short wait of 5-10 minutes.  I asked why and she said that they are out of menus (there were togo menus sitting on the hostess station), and that they just seated the tables that were already sitting.  She explained that they were afraid that the kitchen would get too many orders at once so instead of seating me at one of the many open tables at 11:30, she wanted me to wait 5-10 minutes.  Normally, I would not mind waiting when there is no place to sit.  But, this place just opened for lunch.  Why in the world would there not be enough people to cook food at lunch with 11 open tables?  I went back and forth with her and to her credit, she was very nice but I still could not get past the idea that I am being asked to wait while there are 11 open tables because the lunchers are wanting to eat.  Why are there not enough cooks for this place?  Was lunch a surprise today?  When you ask people to wait to be seated at a half empty restaurant because you don't want to put too much stress on the cooks to cook the food, you are asking us to take part in managing your staff.  I want to come to your restaurant to eat.  I don't want to have to call ahead first and find out if there are enough cooks for the number of seats you have.  I don't get paid to run that place. That's way more time than I have to put into eating during the business day.  Was the food good?  It was great.  Was the service from the waitress good?  It was fantastic.  Am I coming back?  Not at all.

vav8cPR50fbpIGrfyB1nFw.text: One of the best spots I  hit since I came in town has a full bar great cocktails and awesome happy hour menu is very broad and very flavorful anybody that comes to Phoenix should definitely hit this spot.

JrjnEdSQrxYsXWurSAoAsg.text: I'm glad that fellow Yelpers look out for each other because otherwise I probably wouldn't have ever found out about this awesome place. Appearently Otro Cafe is owned by the same person as the Gallio Blanco and for some reason (not complaining at all) this place serves their delicious tacos in home made flour tortillas. Big win for me as I so much loved the ingredients in the tacos at GB but absolutely cannot stand corn tortillas. I was so excited to find out about this place that I had to go almost right away and I'm glad I did.  Love their carne sada tacos, they are officially my favorite tacos ever!! Bonus, our waiter was super friendly and they had cool rooster art on the walls. I now have a new food to crave while I'm sitting at home. Cannot wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ZBQ11Uf76UkPbJQfRFZeYQ.text: Been coming with my family and friends here for awhile. Tonight just me and my husband. We waited 10 minutes for our table to be told they no longer allow parties of 2 to sit in booths (even though there are 2 available?? Further new host advises he has to "hold" booths for larger party that "may" come. Honestly on a Tuesday night at 630? Actually escorted us  back to door to leave????  What on earth is going on here- miss old hostess and customer service and owner presence

2kj2bCxWv91ue0PAN7Gbrw.text: We had been wanting to eat here for a while and finally made it happen.  Apps- We ordered the queso dip and before you imagine that bowl of yellow-ish melted cheese, think again. They mastered the art of melting cheese in a little skillet and mixed in is your choice of veggies or chorizo. We opted for veggies and it was great. Veggies tasted very fresh and the cheese was melted enough to use with a chip but not an actual liquid.  Entrees- I ordered two tacos. Carne asada and Al Pastor. The carne asada was the better of the two. Great flavor, moist, cut up well.. summed up as a tasty carne asada taco. The Al Pastor was great aside from the pork being a little dry. The sweetness from the pineapple was refreshing and salsa on top was a great savory touch. The wife ordered the chicken enchiladas and she really liked them. She got them with red sauce and it wasn't the "normal" runny red sauce that you get. This was an actual salsa that they use and it's not the same one as they bring with chips/salsa.   Oh! The tortillas are wonderful! I don't think this is a place that I'll crave often but it's definitely recommended to go and visit if you haven't yet.

6xvLH2koe7m2xjvkgXjBJw.text: Perfect Saturday morning breakfast! Completely blew me away!! Awesome service to match the phenomenal food. Wish I lived here, I'd be here every week.

Mb7aXtRDO5iJlPVLEphNbg.text: Service with a smile. From LA visiting a friend for the Phoenix symphony and looking to grab food to go and to lay pool side. The atmosphere is great for brunch, lunch and possibly dinner. The menu is contemporary Mexican, however the taste is authentic Mexican.   I got the grilled chicken burrito with extra guacamole. Great place to try out.

pRQTqfYNhzx0zXyCl1-fdA.text: I love the quaintness of this gem. I was invited to meet here for a first date. Very memorable and impressive! The food and beverage transportation specialist was so attentive. The food is mouth watering and leaves a desire to come back. I consume a lot of water; It was good. Otro is a very delightful place to chill. If you enjoy dining outdoors you'll love Otro. Well, maybe you won't but I'd bet you will. Cheers...clink clink

5rXUrMXcSfRV8yBGTnak1Q.text: Both the food and service were excellent. Visiting from Texas, I was impressed with the authenticity of the food. Everything was well-balanced and flavorful. I'd never had clear pozole before, but it was great!

BgGV1CA67K4gvV4Fx-90vg.text: There's not much to say other than its amazing! The staff is super friendly, the food is ridiculously good. I'm absolutely obsessed with their take on chicken pho Soup. It's pure bliss. Breakfast (they open early!) , lunch, dinner is all delicious.

cTKT6zxhpYNnwUMGL5XdVA.text: So I frequent the health food store next door to this place and when the lot in front of the health food store was full, I parked in front of Otro Cafe.  I was a bit hungry so I popped in for a bite.   I had the grass-fed beef grilled steak salad and it was fantastic.. The beef was perfectly cooked to med rare and was seasoned to perfection.  The salad was made with fresh mixed greens, apples and gorgonzola.  Needless to say I scarfed I'd down like a wild monkey.   I will return.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Industrial Decor.  Communal Table . Local Consignment Art!

8kxfQ_NVRgK0Zpy0t2Lg5Q.text: This is one of my favorite spots. The tacos are amazing, the homemade tortillas are my favorite, one of the best guacamoles around, and for brunch the Huevos Rancheros are perfect. Cocktail wise, I always go for the Paloma. The service can be spotty, but I'm okay with that for great food.

ojgGiyUHhWdzl0aAn0DGvA.text: So let me start with I love Doug the owner, and I was a HUGE fan of Gallo Blanco. My complaint is with the service and the length of time to get food. The waiters are not friendly and could care less about your business! The time it takes to get your meal is an exorbitant amount of time. Once you get your food it is amazing!

pGUMBd2RmHxtnsizs6GNTQ.text: Otro has always been one of my favorite places but tonight's visit was far from the usual Otro experience. The food was good....no great....the BLT & A torta with hard fried eggs on it is still my favorite sandwich in town.   Minor complaints added up as the meal progressed....we were never served chips & salsa....my friend's Bloody Mary seemed to take a long time to get to the table....the music was very loud to almost being too loud to talk in a normal volume....the hostess seemed determined to stick us in a table next to the kitchen door and area where the wait staff get tea, silverware, etc and definitely seemed unhappy when I asked if we could sit by one of the open window booths.  Our server was okay but my experience at Otro has always been where the servers seem happy to see you, are chatty without being too chatty, and just extremely positive. Our server was nice but that Otro "extra" wasn't there.  All minor issues I know, but all were glaring in the face of the past wonderful experiences I've had at Otro. It has been one of my "go to" places to take visitors or just when I want a great overall experience because Otro seemed to have that something extra besides great food that kept me coming back and always recommending it to people.  I hope my experience tonight was not the new norm for Otro. I hope that "extra" isn't gone.  For food....5 out of 5 stars. For the rest of the experience... 2 out of 5 stars.

Y7VVWGKIatkSg526ihXUnA.text: Just okay but consumer beware your car might get towed at this spot! Sucks and personally not worth the meal. I would much rather hit Gallo Blanco or Las Santisima Up if you want delicious food and zero hassle/ stress.

1Tv2wdukIZrn0yiImEVX0w.text: Okay people... love me some brunch but this one takes the cake. The Mexican breakfast was incredible! I felt like someone invited me to their moms house in Mexico for brunch. Well done guys!! We will definitely be back.

2TDZN-NGqWWo5wxpm_hbdg.text: We ate at Otro again recently, and it pains me to say they've lost something And they raised the prices. I'm an Arizona near native and familiar with Mexican food, but recently, they don't know how to control the heat in their various dishes, to the point of it being inedible or making one wish they hadn't eaten it. I was told the chiles were hotter this year, but then you adjust! I had a shrimp cocktail that was too spicy to eat! The last guacamole was so hot, my son needed milk; I dealt with it. The point being, it's gone from flavorful to bad. Not eating there for awhile. This was a MAJOR disappointment.  Sorry Otro :(

Vd1MQbczWIj2Fj-9vZMLIQ.text: I have pretty fond memories of Gallo Blanco, a modern Mexican food concept restaurant that adorned the trendy Clarendon Hotel in central Phoenix for many years.  It was a fun eclectic take on the usual Mexican fare, but affordable enough to attract a diehard loyal following.  I'd gone there a number of times for dinner and happy hour with groups of all different kinds.  So it was obviously quite a shock to find out the Clarendon effectively gave Gallo Blanco the boot despite the restaurant's runaway success.  Otro Cafe was basically Gallo Blanco's 2nd location serving many of the same items in a similarly modern restaurant setup over on 7th Street just north of Bethany Home.  Now, Otro is chef Doug Robson's one and only.  I'd actually never ventured here before but my date loves this place.  So a little Tuesday night dinner get together it was.  The one thing my date loves more than anything else about Otro is their guacamole.  I don't remember Gallo Blanco's guacamole being that distinctive, but I will admit Otro's was quite delicious.  I'm not ready to say it was better than Barrio Cafe's guacamole, but as traditional guacamoles go Otro's can more than hold its own.  I think it's the Cotija cheese that really sets it apart.    For our main dishes, she went with a pair of Carne Asada tacos while I ventured into the unknown with a Paella Mexicana.  Paellas are more of a Spanish concoction than a Mexican one, but I've had really good paellas at Tapas Papa Frita in Scottsdale as well as a couple of places in Las Vegas so I was curious to see how this one stacked up.  Otro's version includes chicken, pork, chorizo, rice, and a garden of different veggies all mixed in.  It's also served with tortillas on the side if you want to make soft tacos out of it.  The paella came out very hot (scalding hot even), though not too spicy.  The flavor profile was quite impressive though I have to admit this paella was mostly rice and veggies moreso than the meats.  The portion size is more than big enough to feed two and I get that paellas are almost always dominated by the rice, but I guess I would've liked the meat and veggie proportions to be a little more equal.  My date gave me a sample of her Carne Asada taco and it was excellent.  She especially loves dousing her tacos with (what I believe was) the green tomatillo and lime sauce mix that they provide at the table.  You could pretty much put that sauce on anything.  Its that good.  No dessert this time as we were more than satisfied with the food we had.  The place was busy pretty much throughout the dinner hour (despite being a Tuesday in the middle of summer).  Our server was fast and friendly and environment was nice and relaxed.  Based on first impressions I would say Otro doesn't have quite the charm of Gallo Blanco, though the overall setup and menu are fairly similar.  There's no shortage of Mexican food choices (even in CenPho), but Otro has certainly earned its place as a neighborhood joint.  Otro has plenty of unique and unusual dishes to choose from, but I'd recommend sticking with Otro's traditional Mexican fare.  That's what Otro does best.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Paella Mexicana (sorry for the sunlight in the photo).  Decent dish, though I would&#39;ve liked more meat

QkqFcMTDEQze3AHOLdTIHA.text: Really good breakfast and friendly staff!  Love this little place.  Great little homemade tortillas and fantastic flapjacks!

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Koz9kyQkFCR8n6Kb6tB4tw.text: Yes, the name kind of gives this place an 'also ran' or second fiddle status to Robson's other gem, Gallo Blanco.  But once you enter you get a different take on Mexican.  The Salads, Elote, Enchilada's, and Paella are all worth the drive up from Clarendon.   My favorite is still the Naco Torta which is kind of ironic given that I'm more of a 'Fresa'.

P-jNq3I9YLfUPA_yWek1kg.text: We came here for my mother's birthday, and unfortunately we were thoroughly unimpressed. When you walk in, the restaurant is visibly appealing, clean, with a industrial chic Mexican ambience. Once we were seated, we waited several minutes for a server, and then once we did we waited even longer for drinks with our chips and Guacemole (their guacamole by the way is the only reason they are receiving two stars). We eventually got our drinks (had to ask for water), ordered our food, and then waited longer, again for the food to arrive. Once it did, we were once again, unimpressed. My fish torta was rather bland, very little flavor aside for a bit of spice. My mother received eggs with a yolk that more closely resembled scrambled eggs than over medium eggs, and when she sent them back they took her whole plate to remake it, leaving her without food for several minutes. The rest of the food was passable, nothing wrong with it but nothing to praise. We received no discount for our trouble, and our service was overall slow despite them not being busy. As a Culinary student who will be studying Hospitality, and someone that works in a restaurant, I can say that this experience was unacceptable and that this restaurant would be a very poor choice to try. We will never be back.

2bP_fw_ffnfPVfoXy7CLgw.text: LOVE this place! MY favorite all time breakfast spot!! There coffee is delicious! I loved their Naco Torto which is no longer on the menu :(

-x9l5oOrRB_L1qu45hWf8g.text: First time and everything was great! Grass-fed burger with fries was full of flavor. Tacos were full of meat and good quality. Tasty limon tart for dessert which was the perfect balance of everything.

jI8nxusbMoTCTlbPQWRShQ.text: Our love for Otro will never die! HANDS DOWN THE BEST!  The dishes are eclectic, flavorful, and refined!   We cannot get enough of this place!  Highly recommend the huevos rancheros!   Otro has become a family favorite of ours!  The staff is super sweet and offers excellent service! It's nice to walk in and know they KNOW the menu and are never afraid to make suggestions! Trust their judgement as we ha e been able to experience some incredible dishes due to the staff suggestions!   Love the art, the atmosphere and OTRO

sCjslnJm7QTPMSwX2JKu_w.text: Food was fantastic but the service was extremely poor. We were seated out back, which was ok. It was a Wednesday night, do not completely busy. It was my husband's birthday and we wanted a beer. The menu had 4 options labeled as season 1, 2 etc. he tired to ask the server what exactly that meant but he just told my husband to read it and get back to hI'm when he returned. He didn't return. My husband decided to have a beer from our fridge in our hotel room. We ordered chips with guacamole, got the chips but never got the guacamole. He didn't come back to refill water, we had to get a couple bottles from our car (it was parked right outside the out door patio). When he did return, we had already refilled. The only time he was quick to get back to us was to drop off and pick up the bill. My husband definitely wasn't going to leave 20% he left 12% and didn't tip on tax. Our overall experience wasn't pleasurable.

n54I_INnHew1PnAvRZMIOA.text: We usually love Otro. The food is great. However, the service is sometimes spotty. For instance, our server today seemed a bit rushed during our meal, seemed a little annoyed when we ordered dessert, and had someone else bring dessert without any utensils. We had to physically go up to the bar and get utensils because there were no servers available. I wish this restaurant would be more consistent with service. Otherwise, fantastic place to eat and great deal with kids!

ftqraeTfsmI3oHUEveWwTA.text: Classic Mexican Breakfast was next level. The ingredients were fresh and flavorful. The tortillas reminded me of the flour tortillas you could get at Taco Cabana (shootout to my Texas transplants) which means they were fluffy and amazing. The Chorizo was spiced just right. The Margarita packed a punch and was very tasty. Very friendly Bartender and staff.

QK02Z6M1FhIqHKbXQVYJow.text: Whenever my husband and I want Mexican food this is our spot! The food is delicious, we have been multiple times. My favorite dish is the two wash chicken, but so far nothing on the menu has disappointed. Great ambience and service has always been pleasant!

hHj2yJevwREkE4AEy4Khfg.text: Great tacos at a reasonable price.  I love this place! They offer a great patio atmosphere for the nicer weather months along with great happy hour deals.

OolJoAPYgshOlhcvfsXXRg.text: Killlller spot!! What a gem. Excellent across the board. I travel for work and wish this could be every night. From the smells as I walked in the door to the service and food that is just amazing. Killerrrr. Love it guys. Great work. All. Around. Strong team contribution. Even music. Lighting and acoustics. Cheers

ovZ6yua0T1hCa_BV8N1GUA.text: Awful experience. The place was dirty. Floors were not swept. Tables, chairs, and menus all have old food stuck to them, salsa dried because nobody ever wipes the seating area down. Rice from previous guests stuck in the cracks of everything. Pork Belly tacos were burnt---not charred, but completely burnt. Eggs were extremely overcooked, brown and rubbery. Chorizo overcooked and dry. Carne Asada tacos were dry and burnt. The tortillas were all soggy like they had been sitting in water. The sous chef and server letting this food be served to a table suggests this is a wider problem than just a bad set of line cooks. The server didn't even care that our meal was so poorly executed. Will never come here again.

aOeJa5HEg486_WTQXipYNQ.text: I had a burger, yes I know-a burger at a Mexican restaurant seems odd. It was really good and cooked to perfection. It came with crispy steak fries that were the best I've had.   The ambience was really nice. There is bar, indoor, and outdoor seating available. There are giant sliding doors (with screens to keep the bugs out) on one side of the indoor seating area which gives the fresh air feel. It's a unique restaurant in an area with multiple dinning experiences.

D1xzavvMV3JdOYPI2tj0Zg.text: This place is off the hook hook...  just ate Roasted Corn on the Cobb, stripped tableside with Consuelo de Sur... chorizo, linguica sausage, over roasted potatoes with two eggs over medium... forget about it... the best of Phoenix...

zuocQYWo1OrEq31hrj9D0A.text: No matter when you head to Otro Cafe, if it's busy or not busy you'll still get good quality food and service. After several visits to Otro's 7th Street location over a several year period they have never disappointed. One of the best things is that you can get breakfast anytime! But peruse over their menu and I guarantee EVERYTHING is good. It's a hard choice if you've never been there. Want a delicious breakfast? Try the Nortico or El Madrid, and of course the flap jacks (recommended) are also a breakfast must have! Need a tasty finger food bite? Try any taco or burrito in any combo...YUM! Just want a veggie option or lite faire? Share an appetizer or a salad (and maybe Papas Fritas too....) to satisfy your nibble quotient. I can't  wait to go back again when I'm in the neighborhood.

6VE19HHBbM00mybn03gUyg.text: Food and ambiance were great. Service is the only reason I wouldn't give this place five stars. Definitely would recommend.

kWFwb9K5VusWMUUsGh2rxw.text: Great place. Trendy and quite enjoyable for our group of four. Rick took care of us even though we took several hours for our meal.

q7JNYf25PV5a-95zo6U45A.text: First up: the amazing smells when we walked in the door.  Top notch, made me salivate a bit.    Ordered a couple of cocktails - was surprised they had a somewhat limited liquor selection, but all good, we made it work.    Started with the wood-grilled corn on the cob (Elote Callejero) which was pretty amazing.  Expensive for what it is, but considering taste alone, it was fantastic.  Ordered and shared the Paella, which was nothing short of amazing.  Lots of tasty goodies in there and the warm tortillas were amazing.    Server (Savannah) was really nice and friendly, but was stretched a bit thin that night (hard to get her attention when we needed something).  Would go back for the good smells and tasty food, for sure.

h467wSYq8HKZT_FQ5V7PiA.text: Everything was authentic and fantastic! It was a very very busy night, and the order came to the table wrong. But the waiter was very kind and efficient in fixing things! Look forward to going again next tine we're in town  My favorite of the night was the Pazole!

vHAXB1WYGphAxkLkF4IQYg.text: Delicious and healthy!  Can't wait to go back.  The inca salad was a great!

dKfj52iGLndt9gMwWnn2dw.text: Not terrible, not great.  I had the enchiladas with Mole, which was pretty boring chicken staked in a shell then canned Mole dumped on top.  Other things looked better.

t1AEo79UoEdvE5c_QeJTxA.text: This place is 5 star awesomeness. Saw them on Channel 3. Had the ceviche, queso, cochinita, dorado, chicken tacos, paella rice, and lots of homemade chips with their spicy salsa. Frescas were good too! Took home a togo order for later tonight.

B3Ij1Ej7nbLBNQAj4dX6HA.text: Here's all you need to know: - Get anything with the pork belly and you're golden - The tortillas are UHH-mazing...even without anything in them (yeah, THAT good). So really, I'm just saying all their tacos are delish! - Can't go wrong with the Naco Torta (I'm drooling just thinking about it - Pro Tip: the flapjack is actually pretty damn good. I was stunned that they'd have a flapjack that good here honestly. Get it as a dessert...just trust me on that.  Just eat here. And enjoy!

rAlGSxlCYwH7J4zpL_o12w.text: This is an ok place ...  My first visits werr better ... maybe it's better for breakfast, however for dinner .. I got up to refill my water 3 times. Asked if I could sit at a table, host must've been thinking about instagram ... beaches a she took me straight to a booth.  Why don't people listen these days. Oh and the horseflies were gross. Disappointed with my experience. Asked for no onions, still got onions. My partners chicken was under cooked.

1sdWDMZoqDlaOGD-XUl8Wg.text: The best steak burrito in the state hands down. This is a staple in our rotation and should absolutely be on your list. Watch out for the red salsa, it's amazing but has a kick!

s1zw7Qm6WJiwA6-aT4Z84w.text: Love this place. Whenever I'm in the area I grab the carne asada burrito  it's perfect in every way. Not to big, not to small, full of flavor!

SHf-8RBdg8Kcl6l588mFug.text: When we went we sat 30 min before we were acknowledged and that's because we had to get someone. Manager corrected the situation but that left a bad taste in my mouth. Went on recommendation but won't be returning.

du_Ok5SGTPHAaC_xpRHDbg.text: I give this restaurant 5 stars alone for simply having the balls to serve super spicy chiles de arbol red salsa. The Mexican Paella is divine and their posole blanco is excellent comfort food. I always get kudos when I bring friends here.

rkhXeKHX5fdOUHDm6iIccA.text: Love this place. The staff is super friendly and the tacos are awesome. I don't love that the salsa is in plastic bottles that everyone uses, but that can be over looked.

4WfwOS4fLi09_s0Lp6Axow.text: The pork belly taco is easily the star of the menu along with cheese and chorizo with tortillas! The red sauce on the enchilada I ordered tasted like marinara sauce which was kind of weird. I also found it odd they don't use corn tortillas for tacos but use them for enchiladas. When I asked the server why she said that they want to keep the grill gluten free. The flour tortillas are sinful but just not as healthy which prevents me from eating here more often. Oh well! I still love you Otro Cafe!   P.S I don't think flour tortillas are gluten free.

WEN8_SJLvs7US3FA6zKvDw.text: I have been here many times; I love this place!  This week three others and I went for a birthday lunch. Not only was the food delicious and the order exact as always, our server, Kenneth, was notably exceptional. No one in our party had mentioned the birthday to him, but he is so observant that he noticed a greeting card envelope sitting next to the honoree. Without saying a word beforehand, he presented a complimentary dessert at the end of the meal, careful to ask before setting it down, "Is it your birthday?"  I'm not sure which dessert it was (it may have been the tarta de limon), but it was absolutely delicious and perfect for sharing. Kenneth even came prepared with four spoons as he delivered the dessert, so we didn't even have to ask! Just amazing customer service. It is greatly appreciated!

4ojaGSIf_Jq9hwsJvR7Qlg.text: I used to consider this my go to upscale Mexican restaurant in Phoenix. Sadly, that's no longer the case. The food tasted of dirty grill and it was obvious that some of the food had been prepared well ahead and no longer tasted or had fresh texture. Sad to see this fine establishment go so downhill.

jxri35OGvrITDWietoZrWQ.text: This place is a hidden gem! I've lived in central Phoenix my entire life and it wasn't until recently that I've had the pleasure to dine here. I haven't had one thing one the menu that I don't like. The pork belly tacos are especially my favorite.

WDyPT5sBXICb7GsHiVae8g.text: The food here is amazing! Everything is fresh and so delicious. And the price is nice. The service is good, and it has a nice atmosphere. Tonight was my first time there, and I'm definitely going back.

qJpQrbDnnlCGmGQLPSp1LQ.text: Food was okay . I would of thought the food would of been like all the other spots on that block . Meaning great and good food with great service . Service was so so I guess seat out side always has its perks. Would I go back ? Yes just to give it a shot .

sHIMmeeeRW3OH_mlf9SI5g.text: Consistently good.   Food is on point. Service isn't overwhelming and had a couple weird experiences but nothing to keep me from coming back. Sit at the bar if you want the quickest and most consistent service. Certain days you can even catch some live music.   Keep it up.

n0jB-2MPGOG2IxBL1X3gAg.text: Something has gone dreadfully wrong at this once great little culinary gem. Wow.   Last night (Sunday, 5:30pm): Painfully long service even though the place was 1/3 full. Beers and margaritas took 15 min to come out from time ordered. Inattentive service by our befuddled waiter, who seemed like he might have had a few joints prior to work. Food (tacos and salad) took 25+ min to arrive from time ordered. As a table we all felt abandoned.   We had invited another couple to join us last night and had been talking up Otro for weeks one of our delicious favorites. The food was fine but frankly maybe a few notches below our many prior visits.   Bottom line: something seems to be "off" at Otro. Someone's not paying attention to the operation. This wasn't just a bad night. We never saw a manager *ever* (at past Otro visits last year, we always had an enthusiastic manager come over to say hello and check on things).   Some people might give Otro the benefit of the doubt - maybe they were just having a rough night. But my guess is that there are big management issues that are spinning at this once great spot. Besides the mesquite wood, something else smells at this place and we will likely not be back, as it's apparent Otro is on decline now. It's a shame.

hXBaaSH-ZJD_46zJ9gyi0g.text: What can I say? Just excellent! Been here twice now on the recommendation of a good friend. Love the Posole Blanco. Great staff and friendly attentive service on both my visits! Highly recommended!

keqP71gg0sqtLR5eADBL_Q.text: This place never disappoints! Breakfast is awesome!! Prices are great too! Their guacamole is awesome!!

hV8qA63T-EvOT88f7KQ4Ow.text: WOW!!! We had chips & salsa with a side of fresh guacamole-yum...very filling then we had the grass fed burgers for dinner also wow-& the fries are excellent we loved our waiter Rickwe will be back!!

AosXIZ0vzTS995sMfB05WQ.text: Great Mexican food in a really cute location.  Our server, Kenneth, was the best.  Made great recommendations and was fun to be around #Otrocafe

xK2-5uq5AQrQNJIwYTB2kw.text: Eh...service was great, sangria was great, guacamole was great. We tried steak tacos, pork ,chicken and veggies as well. All decent enough. Tortilla fell apart, maybe they should double em up? Kitchen seemed clean and staff was nice but the dining room seemed a little banged up but other than that....the place was good.

NlSBKxpHSfr29AX_NpCMzg.text: This is a quaint restaurant. I had the huavos ranchero. It was awesome! They had a variety of food choices. Their salsa has good flavor and a little spicy. The servers we friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. I will definitely go there again.

G5tLaY0yjcogFih6jqaxgQ.text: Not at all impressed. The restaurant itself is beautiful, with awesome decor. The staff is very friendly and attentive. However, the food was less than appetizing. I ordered the Queso Fundido, which wasn't bad. I really liked their tortillas. I also ordered a shrimp taco, and a fish taco. The fish was okay. The shrimp was awful and flavorless. I don't think there was a drop of seasoning on the shrimp. The salsa was also not very good. My mom ordered the Posole, and that really did it for us. It was also flavorless, and we were convinced there was freeze dried chicken, and not pork in the bland bowl of broth. My son didn't care for his quesadilla either, as he took two bites. I wanted to like this place, as I love the atmosphere, but I just could not get there.

XlDlT_iCT66lcYiPguGI-w.text: Three things I love about this place- 1)the margaritas made with fresh juice 2) the guacamole 3) the chicken soup! Great during these chilly months and makes for great take out.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great, diverse menu here!

mxlRbIM7qPvCPHYxJhP3Qg.text: Normally my family and I come here for breakfast on Sunday on the food and service are great. Tonight we came for dinner and couldn't be more disappointed. There were four of us and we had to wait..."to clean off a table" we were told. 15 mins later in a virtually empty restaurant we were seated.  Waiter took our drink and appetizer order. Food can put first? How? They had two bartenders on staff and the place is not busy. Waiter has no idea about food service. We completely finished both appetizers before the waiter finally showed up with our three drinks.  After I downed mine pretty quickly he came by to tell us our Pollo asado order would be delayed yet another 20 minutes. Put that on top of 20 we waited BEFORE he told us this. WTF??  Oh, and he never asked if I wanted another drink. Hey pal...Waiter 101 - Restaurants make a whole lot more on drinks than they do food.  While I would have recommended this place for breakfast I must warn evening diners to drop this place from the list of possibles. You will be sorry. Apparently everyone on the night shift for a Sunday is pretty damn incompetent.   Ok, so I was contacted by the "new" manager who admitted they have some staffing issues to resolve. He did the customary request for us to return soon but I asked him to contact me when issues were resolved and we'd be happy to return. To date, I haven't heard a word. So, on faith, we showed up again on Sunday at about 12:15pm. Told it's a 20 minute wait. Cannot use bar high top because "the kitchen is behind" per the hostess. I see things have not changed after months. Let's see how the service is. More to follow.

_x-GCpB0YEhVhoHOzPRwDg.text: The service and food here is phenomenal! Typically I order the Posole and wash it down with a michelada. This place definitely has a fusion to it so it's not very traditional Mexican food. For example, the micheladas have dill in them. They are very tasty but it's different.  The server informed us that this restaurant has no electrical/gas stoves so everything is wood fired. You can smell the amazing-ness the moment you walk in

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Posole, guac and michelada con Sangre

U3KL0hbzFuEPhhCWTcpjpA.text: This place is so freakin' good... the elote... BOMB. The tacos... BOMB (get that pork belly, wow). Can't wait to come back and try more stuff on the menu.

5GmZdSgK1pdzsRLvrIxINQ.text: My roommate frequents this spot often so I was curious. When we got there around 8pm we were told the wait was 15-20 min which it was but did notice lots of empty tables. Seemed fine because service was speedy once sat.   let's start w/the positives; Ron y pina as a cocktail....so tasty fresh pineapple, rum, lime and chili y salted rim which I love and you can also taste a light pineapple pulp.  For dinner I ordered the rice which was super interesting & had bits of veggies like mushrooms mmmmm. I bet it's their paella rice, it's a lil crispy and chewy and has some nice flavoring. I really could jus come and eat a million bowls of rice.   taco chinos are pretty bomb, so hearty and unique. They have this Vietnamese style thing going on. I know this is jus wrong to say but I would use less meat and add maybe carrots or a little bean sprt to give it an ump. But really that is minor.   my hang ups; I tried to order pork belly tacos but they were out and no chips and salsa which for me is blasphemy.  cochitia taco. was totally thrown off by the flour taco and I feel some sort of way for paying $4 for 1 taco, it was good but not impactful.  overall I wanted to love this place but I luv the taco truck la frontera more##%#^*+==

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. taco chino is a #yummyeat

Loovq9zM9H3FdQ2-xsX5_Q.text: What's up the restaurant it's empty and there's a waiting list????Food was better before it got busy. I see already it's demise in future,they forgot how they used to do it.Just another up and coming place that was good going down now they're busy.Bye bye,oh by the way I'm sure owner will put in not recommended review all 1 and 2 star comments are put in this file

8gYiLS_pUKyk17HjEdF93Q.text: Our first visit to Otro and overall pleased, with a couple issues.  Very pleasant staff and good food.  The issues?  We sat around 6pm and while busy, the staff was good & attentive.   We did have a couple changes to the orders and was hit/miss.  The hit - thanks for the meat change for the filling on the enchiladas, Miss - I did ask for no bean (which was done correctly), but I never got my rice and since we got appetizers it didn't become obvious right away as we had plenty of food.  The table behind us wanted to order lamb but they apparently had already run out around 630 on a Saturday?  Also, I did want the Lemon/Spanish cinnamon creme brule after our good meal and sadly - they were out on this as well (around 7pm on a Saturday), even with a few misses and some of the items seem to be slightly over-priced or priced maybe a bit higher than you'd think ... but we'll certainly be back and hope to try the patio in cooler weather!

tH8sqixBeC93nD3dJ_yQNg.text: Great food and great service. The server, Colin, was very knowledgeable and directed what the best item on the menu was. Don't regret it on bit. Amazing service and food

B43XAggm6rgh2kpPGfJeeQ.text: Cons - Service can be uneven & slow.              If head injuries had a sound track, they play it.              Cilantro.  Pros - Best Mexican breakfast anywhere.Go with the conseulo.

isxhPiafjBG_3rQ7yS8jqg.text: The food here is delicious and is what keeps me coming back. The service leaves a lot to be desired and has since the restaurant opened.

AhA_l1ZWIvjWfp40Smqxdw.text: Great atmosphere and quality of food. The food here has a unique style with a hint of fresh.  They offer a vegan option which is pretty cool. It's not the cheapest but they make up in quality.

ZQMkR3QLSz4ZIWcWEcNDwQ.text: I waited until I'd been here twice before reviewing and I'm pleased to say both times it was a 5 star experience.   Delicious food, great menu, super cool atmosphere and vitally, really friendly staff.   I was a big Gallo Blanco fan before it closed so that's what got me here. The Tacos are still delicious and the Tortas are amazing.   A perfect location for Sunday brunch on the patio with friends. I can't wait to come back here for dinner too.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. So delicious.

7CqNEUgnoU4wEm9mIkD8WQ.text: The food is good, but I've never had good service here. Recently had a to go order and 2 of the burritos were the wrong ones. They were still good, but would have been nice to have gotten what we ordered. Will still go back though. Just be prepared for slow service. We once waited 20 minutes for a table that was empty when we got there. The service was laughably bad. Even when we sat down there were open clean tables that were ready to go but still they made people wait. I really don't understand how the service can be so bad, but like I said, I will still go back. Good food

fMjk0p5OoYcuYWuGU0024w.text: Love the food here, tried so far the tacos and a burrito, and they are so delicious! The chips and salsa are great too, and don't forget the tasty hot sauces. Definitely one of my favorite Mexican bars/restaurants in the valley! Cheers

GP8ddZebcHyUBzrGv5m1Zg.text: this place is..................da bomb!!!! the food is all fresh and ingredients are local. i had the best food experience here. the staff here are very friendly and don't bug you like most restaurant waiters by hovering over you or listening about the questionable night you had the night before. the  environment here is relaxed with nooo stuck-up people here. this place is a great place for lovers and families.  i love you guys man!!!

DDefwICr8KU0sYNlTvESmQ.text: Alright, so I already had a 2 star review here, but need to update.  That was because the service has fallen off so bad.  I now wish there was a zero star option.  We live close by and used to come once or twice a week.  The staff knew my family by name.  Now, you leave the place to have a drink next door and they tow your car.  Unbelievable.  No clear signage to warn you either.  Way to bring yourselves closer to the community.  I hate this place.  Never going back.

hKCSHjG0s9uCcM3qEpoXIQ.text: Love trying new places to eat when I don't feel like cooking at home. We found this place randomly and thought we would give it a go. Lets start with first impressions when we walked in, the restaurant was so cute not to mention a restaurant with an open kitchen is a great start. We had the option to sit on the patio, which we took giving the weather was stunning. A young lady approached us saying she wasn't our waitress but wanted to make sure we had water while we waited and proceeded to ask if we wanted they to move a umbrella over or move us in a shadier area since the sun was on us. Fabulous! Our waiter came up and asked if we've been there before and proceeded to welcome us and give us a great recommendation of the guacamole, it was fresh and perfectly seasoned. Both of us being foodies, we ordered several different taco options, a burrito and their pozole blanco. Their complimentary chips and two different types of salsa did not disappoint and neither did any of our main orders. The menu is very Americanized but so worth is. Great establishment and well mannered friendly staff... ya, we'll be back... probably tomorrow!

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

yS0PuItUCRb-DXo7x82cyw.text: Great recipes and very good service here. Cool ambiance and stunning Flamenco on Wed. nights! Guac is the best we've found in town. And their housemade sauces are terrific! Only reason not 5 stars is we once went there for breakfast (which is also great, by the way) and were told there'd be a ridiculously long wait time, despite numerous open tables and nobody else waiting. Maybe they were expecting a giant reservation to arrive, don't know, but they were not at all apologetic about it so we left.

4Fa0f6aSSuWq00qE8A8Y2Q.text: I've been to Otro a few times now and I have always received excellent service. I've sat at the bar, in the dining room and most recently on the patio. Every time the server has been friendly and attentive. Way to go Otro! In the same vein of Gallo Blano the tortas and tacos are excellent I don't have a favorite, I love them all.   On my last visit I had the carne asada burrito and it was HUGE, I washed it down with a $4 Negro Modello and left full and happy. Ole!~

TCvVfzZg_4YsCC8OYIq_YQ.text: Great food!  Of the 5-6 modern Mexican restaurants in uptown, this one most definitely has the best food. The carne asada is fantastic.  Homemade taco shells, great chips and salsa, unique salads, and flapjacks served at all meals.  The service can be slow...and some of the servers aren't knowledgeable about the menu.  A couple of times I had to send back food for being a little cold.  I come here because the food is better than Joyride, Ladera, Casa Amiga etc.  But, they need to get their servers on point!  I hope they can, because service used to be really good.  Maybe its summer help??

d3Oo4cZZANzZvz8qE_IYeA.text: Been here twice now and has been a good experience both times. First I tried the carne asada torta with bacon added and a side of fries, yesterday tried the carne asada burrito with a side of guacamole and chips. Their carne is delicious, perfectly seasoned and good quality. The guacamole was great. Their chips are really thick and crunchy with salt but are also great. I would skip the fries and go for the chips, though.   Also got coffee both times and it comes in a little single serve French press you press yourself so you can let it brew as long as you want, which is awesome. I wish there were refills! Decent prices with good service and a nice atmosphere. Recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mini French press

QJwTzg8CSA-_13r7CctwsQ.text: I have been a follower of chef Doug Robson all the way back to his days at La Grande Orange. Gallo Blanco was a favorite and when he opened Otro, I was ecstatic. The food is always fantastic, the service quite good and the atmosphere, tough to top, especially with the recent upgrades. The flapjacks are simply the best restaurant pancakes in town, bar none. The tacos are a delight and the guacamole? Heaven. One of my favorite eateries anywhere.

l1d8vbk2j5EZQJT2J6eWgA.text: This a great spot to have lunch Street tacos were delicious  Great presentation  Nice location on a street where a lot of good restaurants are popping up all over Nice little bar

VJKlKcgpyl5dJTFQxI-KIA.text: The food is interesting and delicious! I have never had a bad meal there! Great spot for lunch! Need to try it at dinner.

5Zaei0okkPJ5kz01QiEnpA.text: The food is always spot on here. I've only ever had some chewy carne asada once. I LOVE that I can have healthy options in a Mexican restaurant. They will make any taco in lettuce for you and they source local whenever they can. I would be raving with a five star but they have the hardest time finding help that cares. Service is lacking big time and they need to work on that. Starting with the owner. We eat here a couple times a week and not even a smile! We are currently waiting 10 minutes at the bar for 10 minutes with no one else at the bar to ring up our bill!

KwxGe7jpo13_Zz088yF6CQ.text: We love this great little place near our downtown Phoenix apartment! The food is absolutely delicious and the service is always great. I love the shrimp tacos and the chile relleno with corn sauce is the best I've ever eaten! And don't forget to order the delicious fresh guacamole!

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp taco and chile relleno with corn sauce - yum!

HNdXdNkRk8nzp7caNQqZIA.text: Nice little, unpretentious: YES I said unpretentious place with GREAT food and a laid back vibe.   Mostly devoid of hipsters. Whew!

v2EOwCjxuk9R6_-yGctenA.text: Good food and drinks- Saturday night they were out of Tamales and corn tortillas (wanted to sub for flour).  The most concerning part was the mass number of cars being towed from the parking lot.  Apparently the owner has spotters that report patrons using this parking for Camp Social and Joe's Midnight Run.  We were paranoid thinking our cars were going to be towed at any moment- we rushed through our dinner so we could get out in time.  We'll go back again, just not any time soon.

0bwN9gaE7UPpUIMRpH3ZHQ.text: What a great addition to the neighborhood!  I came on a lazy Saturday afternoon with a friend. I really liked the layout of the restaurant. It's pretty open with a good sized patio. The restaurant was pretty empty on my visit, but it was also a Saturday in July and 112 degrees outside... not exactly the time of day most people in Phoenix are out and about.  We were quickly greeted, sat, and had our drink orders taken. I order a glass of sangria and it was the perfect light and refreshing drink for a hot summer day. And since it was happy hour, it was only $5.  To start, we split the Otro salad which has a little bit of everything, including eggs and corn nuts. I was a little wary, but since the waiter recommended it, we went with it. Excellent choice! The salad was light and flavorful, but also filing. The corn nuts added the perfect crunch and saltiness. We also ordered some guacamole to share. The guacamole was delicious and tasted really fresh. I'm pretty sure they make it to order because we asked for some changes and they were able to accommodate.  Being a big fan of Gallo Blanco, I had to try the tacos. I'm happy to report their just as good as Gallo's! And like Gallo Blano, they are also on happy hour daily from 2-6 pm. The other entrees, as well as brunch, also sounded great. The menu definitely has a lot more variety than Gallo.  If I was still living down the street, I would have made this place part of my regular rotation. Our server was great, the food was amazing, and you can't be their happy hour!

ncjrQWA3MlU72KZnXQsu-g.text: RAT!!! Loved this place, it "was" one our favorites. But... while we were waiting for a table last night a rat fell onto their wood pile from the wall or ceiling. It was attached to something like a trap and screaming with pain, so they clearly know they have a rat problem. We were two feet away from it. Needless to say, we didn't stay to eat. Hopefully they get this under control as we really liked the place. Happened on 09-08-2017 at 6:30 pm

dtrlIbRjIjkXfT7qtQ8tUg.text: The food was so good it was gone before I had a chance to take pictures...oops!  I really like Otro,  their food is fresh, flavorful, and made with quality ingredients.  I went in search of a good taco al pastor, and while theirs missed the mark of a truly authentic one, the taste and flavor of the taco here was very good.  (BTW I'm still in search of a taco al pastor that tastes as good as the ones I came to love in central Mexico so if anyone knows of a good taco shop send me a message)  Now on to what is really good...the Inca salad, I could eat buckets of it.  The sofrito rice is another of my favorites, perfectly cooked and perfectly spiced.  Elote Callejero - roasted corn with cheese and paprika...in a word YUM!!!  I can't wait to return and try more.

IlMNjgt9tDp6aIR4ciFv7w.text: We went here for my boyfriend birthday.  I made a reservation for 10 people and they were very generous and worked with me on an upcoming busy Saturday.  We had a large table in the center of the restaurant.  The chips were good, the salsa was a little different, only because you didn't dip it, it was in squeeze bottles.  Still very tasty.  The star of the dinner were the carne asada tacos!  I would go back just for those!  The bartender also made me a pineapple mojito that wasn't on the menu.  Great dinner spot!

kKsXWvNX5YRfnyss6nzI0w.text: Ohhh wow. Delicious.  My husband and I love Gallo Blanco, so we had to try Otro Cafe. The location is interesting; the restaurant is open and spacey, which I think I prefer to Gallo, and the seating is more comfortable. I really like that the kitchen is open and you can watch the chefs cook your food. I also think the staff is a little friendlier than at Gallo.  You're served the same two sauces as at Gallo, but you get chips. I also had a one person serving of guacamole, which was so good. Definitely some of the best guacamole I've had. I love that you can order a smaller portion, as my husband doesn't care for guacamole and if it's just the two of us eating Mexican, we don't get guacamole as an appetizer because it ends up being too big a portion. This ended up being perfect.  I had a veggie taco (kale, cauliflower, and squash) and a shrimp taco. My husband had the naco torta. The veggie taco was fantastic - I loved the mix of vegetables and the sauce they used. The shrimp was also excellent, with a really great slaw on top. The naco torta was huge and delicious - perfectly cooked over medium eggs and tender beef. It was rich and delicious.  We didn't intend on getting dessert but we decided to try the coconut pudding. I thought the consistency was a little thin, but it was creamy, smooth, and not too sweet. It was topped with some shaved chocolate which simply added to the richness. A great ending to a great meal.  Loved it! Can't wait to go back and try the other menu items.

photos.caption: Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie taco and shrimp taco
Photo of Otro Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coconut pudding

cvBbHPqUcCTqGeSOYDZI3A.text: I've been a big fan of Gallo Blanco. But now Otro is closer, hence I expect to be spending a lot more time here.  First up: the Guacamole- an Otro/Gallo Blanco specialty. While I am partial to Gallo Blanco with the citrus infused guac, this one was pretty tasty.  I'm a huge fan of the chicken soup! Chicken soup you ask? Yes! It comes in a bowl of noodles and broth accompanied by a great selection of fresh herbs (Mint, cilantro) and veggies (beans, jalapenos) to spice your dish to your liking. All for $5? Its a steal!  Tacos: I am a huge fan of Gallo Blanco's tacos. My one complaint, is that there aren't enough on this menu. I know.... I know... They wanted to do something MORE than what they could do at Gallo Blanco. But I just love the GB tacos.  Paella- I've been eyeing it. Will be trying in short order!

Tt2XQWOTUZRto43977kOLw.text: Place has good enchiladas sampler, mole is a fave! Service is always good, love the drinks especially the bloody Mary! My only gripe.....always only 1 piece of shrimp in the taco!

aNC-FkDvMpa2j4ux6tHMtQ.text: This is Gallo Blancos sister restaurant. Same appeal and great atmosphere. Not as many GF options but they are very considerate and will accommodate. The owner advised that he is reopening Blanco downtown hopefully this year, we cannot wait!

4_d2jZN3-X3LReMMlr2PnA.text: Amazing El Campo Omelet.  Fresh and delicious! Added a side of home-made tortillas!!  Yummy. Bloody Mary also perfect. Getting our food was about a 30 minutes. Busy time. Worth the wait!!

wbzjL_F8DVFF79bGALSfuQ.text: My fiance and I want to love this place, as it is walking distance from our house. However, time after time, we just get disappointed. The "to go" items are incredibly small, much differently proportioned the items in house. We have had many experiences with incorrectly prepared to-go" orders and, again, disappointed in the small size of salads and entrees. If they want to compete with all of the new restaurants in 7th street, they need to up their game.

kh3ReMgrK8qXDFAf-cvUIg.text: I went on a Saturday during Happy Hour and it was not busy at all. It is a quaint atmosphere and is very simple. The Happy Hour is awesome- $1.00 off specific food and drink items. We enjoyed the tacos and the corn, which were all very good and started with chips and salsa which was also yummy The sangria was a bit strong and way too much fruit. I had never heard of the place until I found out about Guillo Blanco and its location is kind of hidden in a strip mall. I would go back there again.

5PuNTPUYZ7Qk1h0btmAXyg.text: Pleasant atmosphere and fantastic food. We are planning to bring our friends to experience Otro.

4nUoXnOQRJ9GpcOZLjsBKA.text: Great addition to the neighborhood!  Very impressed with the food, atmosphere, and happy hour.

CWR3LdruYppzHaJLyZWrWg.text: Just had my first visit to Otro on Friday, and it was fantastic! Great little place, nice outdoor area, and the food was fantastic. I could have eaten the chips and salsa all day! So good. Nice to have a Mexican Coke as well!

T5DwO7b7EKZ0TtVE1ZxfLg.text: It was our third and last visit to Otro Cafe last night. Waited 35 min (she said 25) while 3 tables of two sat empty. She turned many customers coming into the door away by telling them it was a 45-50 min. wait. The three tables were still empty when she finally sat us at one, other two stayed empty. The communal table and one booth emptied about the time we sat down - nobody waiting at that point. Our waitress took our order, but others brought the drinks/water and food. She didn't seem to know what was going on. Food was good - not great. Bathrooms were questionable.

H7Gkp7Q6cmXFXkh-NN2I8g.text: The only reason I'm giving two stars is because I really enjoyed my shrimp taco. I also tried to order a side of beans.. but they were out. How is a Mexican restaurant out of beans?! My husband had the enchiladas, they literally tasted like vegetable soup filled with what tasted like green beans. We also tried ordering a pitcher of margaritas that are very clearly listed on the menu.. but the server didn't know if they were available yet since it was a "new thing they were trying". They ended up being able to make us a pitcher, but instead of leaving it on the table for us to distribute as we like.. they insisted on pouring it evenly into everyone's glasses until none was left. Really annoying because we didn't all want to drink the same amount, especially those who were driving! The music was too loud and the service was too slow. The company was great, so we at least had a good time with each other! There are so many other good restaurants in the neighborhood, won't be back here.

7smy8P4Job7kzTiUBoNGdw.text: Love this quaint neighborhood eatery.  Service is friendly and food is excellent. It would be misleading to call Otro a Mexican food restaurant but it certainly has a south of the border influence.

6Z41-BguyvHQo-VgXMPqIg.text: The genius behind Gallo Blanco has opened up a new spot and we stopped by for Paella!  I had been looking for a good paella since my trip to Madrid and I have to admit I still miss my dish.. I will say that the mexican paella was pretty damn good! When you have great ingredients you have a shot at good food and when you marry that with this chef's touch you have success. They have similar dishes to Gallo Blanco but I appreciate the blend and uniqueness of plates like the Espanol that change things up enough to make this another stop in my Mexican stops.  Try out the arroz con coco desert too, it was awesome!

L5oym7M7afjgQdXuM2uKow.text: Excellent spicy Bloody Mary .. Great toast??!  Yes, the toast is a must and my omelet was just right.  Really good breakfast.

rY9WFCHpWu2jy6Ylea9dBw.text: Best fish tacos, tasty fries, awesome guacamole, Modelo beer and hands down best Inca salad with quinoa. Okay, I love this place. Breakfast served all day - can't go wrong there either.. Really cute spot, tucked away.  Did I mention, killer happy hour?!  Check it out, you won't be disappointed.

Q54yhOStWjAgusqdegASaw.text: Very simple foods, but expertly put together.  Paella was amazing! They use fresh produce  from local growers and add their flair!  We can't wait to go back.

WtxsETUpTkOO9mttB4v-Xg.text: We visited Gallo Blanco last time we were in Phx and were sad to hear it is temporarily closed, but found Otro instead.  We thought the Carne asada was very good (we got it without beans).  We also ordered the Mole Negro (half chicken) which was very tasty.  The salsa verde with the chips was excellent (and while you get charged for the chips, it was only $1).  Thought the price of the burritos was very good, but probably wouldn't order the chicken ago (a little pricey, I thought).  Had the AZ Margarita which was very good.  Our waitress was attentive; our burrito was incorrectly made with beans and she was back at the table to check in on us shortly after our lunches were served and then our new one came out very quickly.

0aSAL4hvZyg8U4Q9xXjJ-Q.text: Food was fine, but WOW the service.  There is just not a friendly vibe here.  We've noticed the same at Gallo, but not as bad as the waitress we had last night at Otro.   Drinks were slow to get to us.  The blond waitress last night seemed like we were almost inconveniencing her by being there.  At one point my husband asked for hot sauce or a spicy salsa to accompany his tacos and she seriously ROLLED HER EYES!  What are you 12?  Disappointed and won't be back.  There is too much competition popping up in this neighborhood for management to tolerate snotty waitresses.  Will stick with Urban Taco.  The owner comes out multiple times to check how things are, it's a warmer atmosphere and their food is just better.

lNgXUk-DM9pE7F6daI85oA.text: Went here for brunch this past weekend. I really like this space and their menu looked amazing. I opted for their Chilaquiles. I am a HUGE fan of Chilaquiles and these did not disappoint. You can have Chicken or Veggies with this dish. I went with the Veggies. I got my eggs scrambled and they were light and fluffy and brought this dish together. I also got a coffee and I really liked that they serve their coffee with a french press. I did think the coffee could have been better, but this did not effect my review at all. It was just one piece of criticism I would offer up. I will definitely be back to try more dishes. I give this place two thumbs up.

-H6jiflnbMCkfd5iJBwkoA.text: Tried it last week. I thought it was terrific.  Quality of food, originality, prices......all excellent.  Service was very good.....tad slow but they had a party of 20 that might have thrown things off some. Some items are quite spicy so I'd ask about what you order.  Menu was cryptic to me, I had ask on a number of items; "what is this?" Anyway, I don't write reviews often unless I really enjoy a place or if something is awful.   PS: House margarita was terrific!

MSa8kwZ1ARRFwu0RPuaGCg.text: I love this place.  The food is super and the cocktails are great.  I wish I lived closer.

fPvdMZ-QVXYTSCDIk5_Owg.text: Their guacamole is the best I've ever had. Their tacos are really good too. A little bit on the pricy side but definitely worth it. They have a 2pm-6pm happy hour where their tacos are 1$ off, good deal!

_CwqQnllbfAqZhexqBAdbg.text: Solid food from the folks who brought you Gallo Blanco. The apps outshined the entrees during our visit (though the entrees were fine). I would consider ordering several apps for the table and pretending it's tapas served family-style next time.

IDfVrT8_fqhJrdrMqN7-Ww.text: Have been here several times. I wish there was a location in little arcadia (hint hint). The jamon serrano served over bread with a balsamic dressing and avocado is a must try and we also like the shrimp ceviche, paella, sangria, key lime tart, Lux french press coffee. The mexican pop artwork is fabulous I would love to have one for my place. I also noticed a caja china putside so they must roast a whole pig sometimes. great service/ambience/very reasonable $$/incredibly fresh food/creative recipies

Q8mhqIOLuvHOSHr7I6SVNQ.text: First exposure was great. Second exposure made me sick. Probably won't be back for a third. Still scores higher than Otro's sister, Gallo Blanco, simply because there aren't any hipster waiters talking trash about customers behind the bar like what you get at Gallo. Haha. Service here is truly decent and the staff isn't sitting around acting like they're gracing you with their presence. Great service. Food made me sick for awhile. I won't be back, but the staff alone earns three stars by itself!
